<a name="BR_GetMouseCursorContext"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void BR_GetMouseCursorContext(char* windowOut, int windowOut_sz, char* segmentOut, int segmentOut_sz, char* detailsOut, int detailsOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>BR_GetMouseCursorContext(#window, #segment, #details) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("BR_GetMouseCursorContext", #window, #segment, #details) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>string </i>window, <i>string </i>segment, <i>string </i>details = reaper.BR_GetMouseCursorContext()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>String</i> windowOut, <i>Int</i> windowOut_sz, <i>String</i> segmentOut, <i>Int</i> segmentOut_sz, <i>String</i> detailsOut, <i>Int</i> detailsOut_sz) = BR_GetMouseCursorContext(windowOut, windowOut_sz, segmentOut, segmentOut_sz, detailsOut, detailsOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Get mouse cursor context. Each parameter returns information in a form of string as specified in the table below.<br>
<br>
To get more info on stuff that was found under mouse cursor see <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Envelope">BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Envelope</a>, <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Item">BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Item</a>, <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext_MIDI">BR_GetMouseCursorContext_MIDI</a>, <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Position">BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Position</a>, <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Take">BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Take</a>, <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Track">BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Track</a> <br>
<br>
<table border="2"><tr><th style="width:100px">Window</th> <th style="width:100px">Segment</th> <th style="width:300px">Details</th>                                           </tr><tr><th rowspan="1" align = "center"> unknown     </th>    <td> ""        </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr><th rowspan="4" align = "center"> ruler       </th>    <td> region_lane </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> marker_lane </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> tempo_lane  </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> timeline    </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr><th rowspan="1" align = "center"> transport   </th>    <td> ""        </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr><th rowspan="3" align = "center"> tcp         </th>    <td> track       </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> envelope    </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> empty       </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr><th rowspan="2" align = "center"> mcp         </th>    <td> track       </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> empty       </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr><th rowspan="3" align = "center"> arrange     </th>    <td> track       </td>   <td> empty,<br>item, item_stretch_marker,<br>env_point, env_segment </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> envelope    </td>   <td> empty, env_point, env_segment                                  </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> empty       </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr><th rowspan="5" align = "center"> midi_editor </th>    <td> unknown     </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> ruler       </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> piano       </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> notes       </td>   <td> ""                                                           </td> </tr><tr>                                                           <td> cc_lane     </td>   <td> cc_selector, cc_lane                                           </td> </tr></table><br><br>
<a name="BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Envelope"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>TrackEnvelope* BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Envelope(bool* takeEnvelopeOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>TrackEnvelope</i>  BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Envelope(<i>bool &amp;</i>takeEnvelope) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>TrackEnvelope</i>  extension_api("BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Envelope", <i>bool &amp;</i>takeEnvelope) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>TrackEnvelope</i> retval, <i>boolean </i>takeEnvelope = reaper.BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Envelope()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>TrackEnvelope</i> retval, <i>Boolean</i> takeEnvelopeOut) = BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Envelope(takeEnvelopeOut)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Returns envelope that was captured with the last call to <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext">BR_GetMouseCursorContext</a>. In case the envelope belongs to take, takeEnvelope will be true.<br><br>
<a name="BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Item"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>MediaItem* BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Item()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>MediaItem</i>  BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Item() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>MediaItem</i>  extension_api("BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Item") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>MediaItem</i> reaper.BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Item()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>MediaItem</i>  BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Item()</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Returns item under mouse cursor that was captured with the last call to <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext">BR_GetMouseCursorContext</a>. Note that the function will return item even if mouse cursor is over some other track lane element like stretch marker or envelope. This enables for easier identification of items when you want to ignore elements within the item.<br><br>
<a name="BR_GetMouseCursorContext_MIDI"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* BR_GetMouseCursorContext_MIDI(bool* inlineEditorOut, int* noteRowOut, int* ccLaneOut, int* ccLaneValOut, int* ccLaneIdOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  BR_GetMouseCursorContext_MIDI(<i>bool &amp;</i>inlineEditor, <i>int &amp;</i>noteRow, <i>int &amp;</i>ccLane, <i>int &amp;</i>ccLaneVal, <i>int &amp;</i>ccLaneId) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("BR_GetMouseCursorContext_MIDI", <i>bool &amp;</i>inlineEditor, <i>int &amp;</i>noteRow, <i>int &amp;</i>ccLane, <i>int &amp;</i>ccLaneVal, <i>int &amp;</i>ccLaneId) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> retval, <i>boolean </i>inlineEditor, <i>integer </i>noteRow, <i>integer </i>ccLane, <i>integer </i>ccLaneVal, <i>integer </i>ccLaneId = reaper.BR_GetMouseCursorContext_MIDI()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> retval, <i>Boolean</i> inlineEditorOut, <i>Int</i> noteRowOut, <i>Int</i> ccLaneOut, <i>Int</i> ccLaneValOut, <i>Int</i> ccLaneIdOut) = BR_GetMouseCursorContext_MIDI(inlineEditorOut, noteRowOut, ccLaneOut, ccLaneValOut, ccLaneIdOut)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Returns midi editor under mouse cursor that was captured with the last call to <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext">BR_GetMouseCursorContext</a>.<br>
<br>
inlineEditor: if mouse was captured in inline MIDI editor, this will be true (consequentially, returned MIDI editor will be NULL)<br>
noteRow: note row or piano key under mouse cursor (0-127)<br>
ccLane: CC lane under mouse cursor (CC0-127=CC, 0x100|(0-31)=14-bit CC, 0x200=velocity, 0x201=pitch, 0x202=program, 0x203=channel pressure, 0x204=bank/program select, 0x205=text, 0x206=sysex, 0x207=off velocity, 0x208=notation events)<br>
ccLaneVal: value in CC lane under mouse cursor (0-127 or 0-16383)<br>
ccLaneId: lane position, counting from the top (0 based)<br>
<br>
Note: due to API limitations, if mouse is over inline MIDI editor with some note rows hidden, noteRow will be -1<br><br>
<a name="BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Position"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>double BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Position()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>double </i> BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Position() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>double </i> extension_api("BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Position") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number</i> reaper.BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Position()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Float</i>  BR_GetMouseCursorContext_Position()</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Returns project time position in arrange/ruler/midi editor that was captured with the last call to <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext">BR_GetMouseCursorContext</a>.<br><br>
<a name="BR_GetMouseCursorContext_StretchMarker"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int BR_GetMouseCursorContext_StretchMarker()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> BR_GetMouseCursorContext_StretchMarker() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("BR_GetMouseCursorContext_StretchMarker") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.BR_GetMouseCursorContext_StretchMarker()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  BR_GetMouseCursorContext_StretchMarker()</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Returns id of a stretch marker under mouse cursor that was captured with the last call to <a href="#BR_GetMouseCursorContext">BR_GetMouseCursorContext</a>.<br><br>

<a name="BR_GetSetTrackSendInfo"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>double BR_GetSetTrackSendInfo(MediaTrack* track, int category, int sendidx, const char* parmname, bool setNewValue, double newValue)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>double </i> BR_GetSetTrackSendInfo(<i>MediaTrack</i> track, <i>int </i>category, <i>int </i>sendidx, "parmname", <i>bool </i>setNewValue, newValue) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>double </i> extension_api("BR_GetSetTrackSendInfo", <i>MediaTrack</i> track, <i>int </i>category, <i>int </i>sendidx, "parmname", <i>bool </i>setNewValue, newValue) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number</i> reaper.BR_GetSetTrackSendInfo(<i>MediaTrack</i> track, <i>integer</i> category, <i>integer</i> sendidx, <i>string</i> parmname, <i>boolean</i> setNewValue, <i>number</i> newValue)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Float</i>  BR_GetSetTrackSendInfo(<i>MediaTrack</i> track, <i>Int</i> category, <i>Int</i> sendidx, <i>String</i> parmname, <i>Boolean</i> setNewValue, <i>Float</i> newValue)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Get or set send attributes.<br>
<br>
category is &lt;0 for receives, 0=sends, &gt;0 for hardware outputs<br>
sendidx is zero-based (see <a href="#GetTrackNumSends">GetTrackNumSends</a> to count track sends/receives/hardware outputs)<br>
To set attribute, pass setNewValue as true<br>
<br>
List of possible parameters:<br>
B_MUTE : send mute state (1.0 if muted, otherwise 0.0)<br>
B_PHASE : send phase state (1.0 if phase is inverted, otherwise 0.0)<br>
B_MONO : send mono state (1.0 if send is set to mono, otherwise 0.0)<br>
D_VOL : send volume (1.0=+0dB etc...)<br>
D_PAN : send pan (-1.0=100%L, 0=center, 1.0=100%R)<br>
D_PANLAW : send pan law (1.0=+0.0db, 0.5=-6dB, -1.0=project default etc...)<br>
I_SENDMODE : send mode (0=post-fader, 1=pre-fx, 2=post-fx(deprecated), 3=post-fx)<br>
I_SRCCHAN : audio source starting channel index or -1 if audio send is disabled (&amp;1024=mono...note that in that case, when reading index, you should do (index XOR 1024) to get starting channel index)<br>
I_DSTCHAN : audio destination starting channel index (&amp;1024=mono (and in case of hardware output &amp;512=rearoute)...note that in that case, when reading index, you should do (index XOR (1024 OR 512)) to get starting channel index)<br>
I_MIDI_SRCCHAN : source MIDI channel, -1 if MIDI send is disabled (0=all, 1-16)<br>
I_MIDI_DSTCHAN : destination MIDI channel, -1 if MIDI send is disabled (0=original, 1-16)<br>
I_MIDI_SRCBUS : source MIDI bus, -1 if MIDI send is disabled (0=all, otherwise bus index)<br>
I_MIDI_DSTBUS : receive MIDI bus, -1 if MIDI send is disabled (0=all, otherwise bus index)<br>
I_MIDI_LINK_VOLPAN : link volume/pan controls to MIDI<br>
<br>
Note: To get or set other send attributes, see <a href="#BR_GetMediaTrackSendInfo_Envelope">BR_GetMediaTrackSendInfo_Envelope</a> and <a href="#BR_GetMediaTrackSendInfo_Track">BR_GetMediaTrackSendInfo_Track</a>.<br><br>
<a name="BR_GetTakeFXCount"><hr></a><br>

<a name="BR_MIDI_CCLaneReplace"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool BR_MIDI_CCLaneReplace(void* midiEditor, int laneId, int newCC)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> BR_MIDI_CCLaneReplace(<i>void*</i> midiEditor, <i>int </i>laneId, <i>int </i>newCC) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("BR_MIDI_CCLaneReplace", <i>void*</i> midiEditor, <i>int </i>laneId, <i>int </i>newCC) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.BR_MIDI_CCLaneReplace(<i>identifier</i> midiEditor, <i>integer</i> laneId, <i>integer</i> newCC)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  BR_MIDI_CCLaneReplace(<i>void</i> midiEditor, <i>Int</i> laneId, <i>Int</i> newCC)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Replace CC lane in midi editor. Top visible CC lane is laneId 0. Returns true on success.<br>
Valid CC lanes: CC0-127=CC, 0x100|(0-31)=14-bit CC, 0x200=velocity, 0x201=pitch, 0x202=program, 0x203=channel pressure, 0x204=bank/program select, 0x205=text, 0x206=sysex, 0x207<br><br>

<a name="BR_SetMediaItemImageResource"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void BR_SetMediaItemImageResource(MediaItem* item, const char* imageIn, int imageFlags)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>BR_SetMediaItemImageResource(<i>MediaItem</i> item, "imageIn", <i>int </i>imageFlags) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("BR_SetMediaItemImageResource", <i>MediaItem</i> item, "imageIn", <i>int </i>imageFlags) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.BR_SetMediaItemImageResource(<i>MediaItem</i> item, <i>string</i> imageIn, <i>integer</i> imageFlags)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>BR_SetMediaItemImageResource(<i>MediaItem</i> item, <i>String</i> imageIn, <i>Int</i> imageFlags)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Set image resource and its flags for a given item. To clear current image resource, pass imageIn as "".<br>
imageFlags: &amp;1=0: don't display image, &amp;1: center / tile, &amp;3: stretch, &amp;5: full height (REAPER 5.974+).<br>
Can also be used to display existing text in empty items unstretched (pass imageIn = "", imageFlags = 0) or stretched (pass imageIn = "". imageFlags = 3).<br>
To get image resource, see <a href="#BR_GetMediaItemImageResource">BR_GetMediaItemImageResource</a>.<br><br>
<a name="BR_SetMediaSourceProperties"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool BR_SetMediaSourceProperties(MediaItem_Take* take, bool section, double start, double length, double fade, bool reverse)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> BR_SetMediaSourceProperties(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>bool </i>section, start, length, fade, <i>bool </i>reverse) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("BR_SetMediaSourceProperties", <i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>bool </i>section, start, length, fade, <i>bool </i>reverse) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.BR_SetMediaSourceProperties(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>boolean</i> section, <i>number</i> start, <i>number</i> length, <i>number</i> fade, <i>boolean</i> reverse)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  BR_SetMediaSourceProperties(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>Boolean</i> section, <i>Float</i> start, <i>Float</i> length, <i>Float</i> fade, <i>Boolean</i> reverse)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Set take media source properties. Returns false if take can't have them (MIDI items etc.). Section parameters have to be valid only when passing section=true.<br>
To get source properties, see <a href="#BR_GetMediaSourceProperties">BR_GetMediaSourceProperties</a>.<br><br>
<a name="BR_SetMediaTrackLayouts"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool BR_SetMediaTrackLayouts(MediaTrack* track, const char* mcpLayoutNameIn, const char* tcpLayoutNameIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> BR_SetMediaTrackLayouts(<i>MediaTrack</i> track, "mcpLayoutNameIn", "tcpLayoutNameIn") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("BR_SetMediaTrackLayouts", <i>MediaTrack</i> track, "mcpLayoutNameIn", "tcpLayoutNameIn") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.BR_SetMediaTrackLayouts(<i>MediaTrack</i> track, <i>string</i> mcpLayoutNameIn, <i>string</i> tcpLayoutNameIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  BR_SetMediaTrackLayouts(<i>MediaTrack</i> track, <i>String</i> mcpLayoutNameIn, <i>String</i> tcpLayoutNameIn)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Deprecated, see <a href="#GetSetMediaTrackInfo">GetSetMediaTrackInfo</a> (REAPER v5.02+). Set media track layouts for MCP and TCP. To set default layout, pass empty string ("") as layout name. In case layouts were successfully set, returns true (if layouts are already set to supplied layout names, it will return false since no changes were made).<br>
To get media track layouts, see <a href="#BR_GetMediaTrackLayouts">BR_GetMediaTrackLayouts</a>.<br><br>

<a name="BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile(MediaItem_Take* take, const char* filenameIn, bool inProjectData)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, "filenameIn", <i>bool </i>inProjectData) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile", <i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, "filenameIn", <i>bool </i>inProjectData) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>string</i> filenameIn, <i>boolean</i> inProjectData)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>String</i> filenameIn, <i>Boolean</i> inProjectData)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Set new take source from file. To import MIDI file as in-project source data pass inProjectData=true. Returns false if failed.<br>
Any take source properties from the previous source will be lost - to preserve them, see <a href="#BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile2">BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile2</a>.<br>
Note: To set source from existing take, see <a href="#SNM_GetSetSourceState2">SNM_GetSetSourceState2</a>.<br><br>
<a name="BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile2"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile2(MediaItem_Take* take, const char* filenameIn, bool inProjectData, bool keepSourceProperties)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile2(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, "filenameIn", <i>bool </i>inProjectData, <i>bool </i>keepSourceProperties) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile2", <i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, "filenameIn", <i>bool </i>inProjectData, <i>bool </i>keepSourceProperties) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile2(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>string</i> filenameIn, <i>boolean</i> inProjectData, <i>boolean</i> keepSourceProperties)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile2(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>String</i> filenameIn, <i>Boolean</i> inProjectData, <i>Boolean</i> keepSourceProperties)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Differs from <a href="#BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile">BR_SetTakeSourceFromFile</a> only that it can also preserve existing take media source properties.<br><br>

<a name="BR_TrackAtMouseCursor"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>MediaTrack* BR_TrackAtMouseCursor(int* contextOut, double* positionOut)</code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>MediaTrack</i> retval, <i>Int</i> contextOut, <i>Float</i> positionOut) = BR_TrackAtMouseCursor(contextOut, positionOut)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Get track under mouse cursor.<br>
Context signifies where the track was found: 0 = TCP, 1 = MCP, 2 = Arrange.<br>
Position will hold mouse cursor position in arrange if applicable.<br><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  BR_Win32_FindWindowEx("hwndParent", "hwndChildAfter", "className", "windowName", <i>bool </i>searchClass, <i>bool </i>searchName) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("BR_Win32_FindWindowEx", "hwndParent", "hwndChildAfter", "className", "windowName", <i>bool </i>searchClass, <i>bool </i>searchName) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.BR_Win32_FindWindowEx(<i>string</i> hwndParent, <i>string</i> hwndChildAfter, <i>string</i> className, <i>string</i> windowName, <i>boolean</i> searchClass, <i>boolean</i> searchName)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  BR_Win32_FindWindowEx(<i>String</i> hwndParent, <i>String</i> hwndChildAfter, <i>String</i> className, <i>String</i> windowName, <i>Boolean</i> searchClass, <i>Boolean</i> searchName)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Equivalent to win32 API FindWindowEx(). Since ReaScript doesn't allow passing NULL (None in Python, nil in Lua etc...) parameters, to search by supplied class or name set searchClass and searchName accordingly. HWND parameters should be passed as either "0" to signify NULL or as string obtained from <a href="#BR_Win32_HwndToString">BR_Win32_HwndToString</a>.<br><br>

<a name="BR_Win32_GetConstant"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int BR_Win32_GetConstant(const char* constantName)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> BR_Win32_GetConstant("constantName") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("BR_Win32_GetConstant", "constantName") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  BR_Win32_GetConstant(<i>String</i> constantName)</code><br><br></div>
[BR] Returns various constants needed for BR_Win32 functions.<br>
Supported constants are:<br>
CB_ERR, CB_GETCOUNT, CB_GETCURSEL, CB_SETCURSEL<br>
EM_SETSEL<br>
GW_CHILD, GW_HWNDFIRST, GW_HWNDLAST, GW_HWNDNEXT, GW_HWNDPREV, GW_OWNER<br>
GWL_STYLE<br>
SW_HIDE, SW_MAXIMIZE, SW_SHOW, SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, SW_SHOWNA, SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE, SW_SHOWNORMAL<br>
SWP_FRAMECHANGED, SWP_FRAMECHANGED, SWP_NOMOVE, SWP_NOOWNERZORDER, SWP_NOSIZE, SWP_NOZORDER<br>
VK_DOWN, VK_UP<br>
WM_CLOSE, WM_KEYDOWN<br>
WS_MAXIMIZE, WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW<br><br>

<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* BR_Win32_GetMainHwnd()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  BR_Win32_GetMainHwnd() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("BR_Win32_GetMainHwnd") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.BR_Win32_GetMainHwnd()</code><br><br></div>

[BR] Alternative to <a href="#GetMainHwnd">GetMainHwnd</a>. REAPER seems to have problems with extensions using HWND type for exported functions so all BR_Win32 functions use void* instead of HWND type<br><br>

<a name="CF_CreatePreview"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>CF_Preview* CF_CreatePreview(PCM_source* source)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>CF_Preview</i>  CF_CreatePreview(<i>PCM_source</i> source) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>CF_Preview</i>  extension_api("CF_CreatePreview", <i>PCM_source</i> source) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>CF_Preview</i> reaper.CF_CreatePreview(<i>PCM_source</i> source)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>CF_Preview</i>  CF_CreatePreview(<i>PCM_source</i> source)</code><br><br></div>
Create a new preview object. Does not take ownership of the source (don't forget to destroy it unless it came from a take!). See <a href="#CF_Preview_Play">CF_Preview_Play</a> and the others CF_Preview_* functions.<br>
<br>
The preview object is automatically destroyed at the end of a defer cycle if at least one of these conditions are met:<br>
- playback finished<br>
- playback was not started using CF_Preview_Play<br>
- the output track no longer exists<br><br>
<a name="CF_EnumMediaSourceCues"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int CF_EnumMediaSourceCues(PCM_source* src, int index, double* timeOut, double* endTimeOut, bool* isRegionOut, char* nameOut, int nameOut_sz, bool* isChapterOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> CF_EnumMediaSourceCues(<i>PCM_source</i> src, <i>int </i>index, <i>&amp;</i>time, <i>&amp;</i>endTime, <i>bool &amp;</i>isRegion, #name, <i>bool &amp;</i>isChapter) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("CF_EnumMediaSourceCues", <i>PCM_source</i> src, <i>int </i>index, <i>&amp;</i>time, <i>&amp;</i>endTime, <i>bool &amp;</i>isRegion, #name, <i>bool &amp;</i>isChapter) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>number </i>time, <i>number </i>endTime, <i>boolean </i>isRegion, <i>string </i>name, <i>boolean </i>isChapter = reaper.CF_EnumMediaSourceCues(<i>PCM_source</i> src, <i>integer</i> index)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>PCM_source</i> src, <i>Int</i> index, <i>Float</i> timeOut, <i>Float</i> endTimeOut, <i>Boolean</i> isRegionOut, <i>String</i> nameOut, <i>Int</i> nameOut_sz, <i>Boolean</i> isChapterOut) = CF_EnumMediaSourceCues(src, index, timeOut, endTimeOut, isRegionOut, nameOut, nameOut_sz, isChapterOut)</code><br><br></div>
Enumerate the source's media cues. Returns the next index or 0 when finished.<br><br>
<a name="CF_EnumSelectedFX"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int CF_EnumSelectedFX(FxChain* hwnd, int index)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> CF_EnumSelectedFX(<i>FxChain</i> hwnd, <i>int </i>index) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("CF_EnumSelectedFX", <i>FxChain</i> hwnd, <i>int </i>index) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.CF_EnumSelectedFX(<i>FxChain</i> hwnd, <i>integer</i> index)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  CF_EnumSelectedFX(<i>FxChain</i> hwnd, <i>Int</i> index)</code><br><br></div>
Return the index of the next selected effect in the given FX chain. Start index should be -1. Returns -1 if there are no more selected effects.<br><br>

<a name="CF_NormalizeUTF8"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void CF_NormalizeUTF8(const char* input, int mode, char* normalizedOutNeedBig, int normalizedOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>CF_NormalizeUTF8("input", <i>int </i>mode, #normalized) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("CF_NormalizeUTF8", "input", <i>int </i>mode, #normalized) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>string </i>normalized = reaper.CF_NormalizeUTF8(<i>string</i> input, <i>integer</i> mode)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>String</i> input, <i>Int</i> mode, <i>String</i> normalizedOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> normalizedOutNeedBig_sz) = CF_NormalizeUTF8(input, mode, normalizedOutNeedBig, normalizedOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Apply <a href="https://unicode.org/reports/tr15/">Unicode normalization</a> to the provided UTF-8 string.<br>
<br>
Mode values:<br>
- Bit 0 (composition mode):<br>
  * 0 = decomposition only<br>
  * 1 = decomposition + canonical composition<br>
- Bit 1 (decomposition mode):<br>
  * 0 = canonical decomposition<br>
  * 1 = compatibility decomposition<br><br>
<a name="CF_PCM_Source_SetSectionInfo"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool CF_PCM_Source_SetSectionInfo(PCM_source* section, PCM_source* source, double offset, double length, bool reverse, double* fadeInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> CF_PCM_Source_SetSectionInfo(<i>PCM_source</i> section, <i>PCM_source</i> source, offset, length, <i>bool </i>reverse, <i>optional </i>fadeIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("CF_PCM_Source_SetSectionInfo", <i>PCM_source</i> section, <i>PCM_source</i> source, offset, length, <i>bool </i>reverse, <i>optional </i>fadeIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.CF_PCM_Source_SetSectionInfo(<i>PCM_source</i> section, <i>PCM_source</i> source, <i>number</i> offset, <i>number</i> length, <i>boolean</i> reverse, <i>optional number </i>fadeIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>PCM_source</i> section, <i>PCM_source</i> source, <i>Float</i> offset, <i>Float</i> length, <i>Boolean</i> reverse, <i>Float</i> fadeInOptional) = CF_PCM_Source_SetSectionInfo(section, source, offset, length, reverse, fadeInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Give a section source created using PCM_Source_CreateFromType("SECTION"). Offset and length are ignored if 0. Negative length to subtract from the total length of the source.<br><br>
<a name="CF_Preview_GetOutputTrack"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>MediaTrack* CF_Preview_GetOutputTrack(CF_Preview* preview)</code><br><br></div>

<a name="CF_Preview_GetPeak"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool CF_Preview_GetPeak(CF_Preview* preview, int channel, double* peakvolOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> CF_Preview_GetPeak(<i>CF_Preview</i> preview, <i>int </i>channel, <i>&amp;</i>peakvol) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("CF_Preview_GetPeak", <i>CF_Preview</i> preview, <i>int </i>channel, <i>&amp;</i>peakvol) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>number </i>peakvol = reaper.CF_Preview_GetPeak(<i>CF_Preview</i> preview, <i>integer</i> channel)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>CF_Preview</i> preview, <i>Int</i> channel, <i>Float</i> peakvolOut) = CF_Preview_GetPeak(preview, channel, peakvolOut)</code><br><br></div>
Return the maximum sample value played since the last read. Refresh speed depends on buffer size.<br><br>
<a name="CF_Preview_GetValue"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool CF_Preview_GetValue(CF_Preview* preview, const char* name, double* valueOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> CF_Preview_GetValue(<i>CF_Preview</i> preview, "name", <i>&amp;</i>value) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("CF_Preview_GetValue", <i>CF_Preview</i> preview, "name", <i>&amp;</i>value) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>number </i>value = reaper.CF_Preview_GetValue(<i>CF_Preview</i> preview, <i>string</i> name)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>CF_Preview</i> preview, <i>String</i> name, <i>Float</i> valueOut) = CF_Preview_GetValue(preview, name, valueOut)</code><br><br></div>
Supported attributes:<br>
B_LOOP         seek to the beginning when reaching the end of the source<br>
B_PPITCH       preserve pitch when changing playback rate<br>
D_FADEINLEN    lenght in seconds of playback fade in<br>
D_FADEOUTLEN   lenght in seconds of playback fade out<br>
D_LENGTH       (read only) length of the source * playback rate<br>
D_MEASUREALIGN &gt;0 = wait until the next bar before starting playback (note: this causes playback to silently continue when project is paused and previewing through a track)<br>
D_PAN          playback pan<br>
D_PITCH        pitch adjustment in semitones<br>
D_PLAYRATE     playback rate (0.01..100)<br>
D_POSITION     current playback position<br>
D_VOLUME       playback volume<br>
I_OUTCHAN      first hardware output channel (&amp;1024=mono, reads -1 when playing through a track, see <a href="#CF_Preview_SetOutputTrack">CF_Preview_SetOutputTrack</a>)<br>
I_PITCHMODE    highest 16 bits=pitch shift mode (see <a href="#EnumPitchShiftModes">EnumPitchShiftModes</a>), lower 16 bits=pitch shift submode (see <a href="#EnumPitchShiftSubModes">EnumPitchShiftSubModes</a>)<br><br>
<a name="CF_Preview_Play"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool CF_Preview_Play(CF_Preview* preview)</code><br><br></div>

<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("CF_Preview_Play", <i>CF_Preview</i> preview) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  CF_Preview_Play(<i>CF_Preview</i> preview)</code><br><br></div>
Start playback of the configured preview object.<br><br>

<a name="CF_SendActionShortcut"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool CF_SendActionShortcut(void* hwnd, int section, int key, int* modifiersInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> CF_SendActionShortcut(<i>void*</i> hwnd, <i>int </i>section, <i>int </i>key, <i>optional int</i> modifiersIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("CF_SendActionShortcut", <i>void*</i> hwnd, <i>int </i>section, <i>int </i>key, <i>optional int</i> modifiersIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.CF_SendActionShortcut(<i>identifier</i> hwnd, <i>integer</i> section, <i>integer</i> key, <i>optional integer</i> modifiersIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>void</i> hwnd, <i>Int</i> section, <i>Int</i> key, <i>Int</i> modifiersInOptional) = CF_SendActionShortcut(hwnd, section, key, modifiersInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Run in the specified window the action command ID associated with the shortcut key in the given section. See <a href='#CF_EnumerateActions'>CF_EnumerateActions</a> for common section IDs.<br>
<br>
	Keys are Windows <a href="https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/inputdev/virtual-key-codes">virtual key codes</a>. &amp;0x8000 for an extended key (eg. Numpad Enter = VK_RETURN &amp; 0x8000).<br>
	Modifier values: nil = read from keyboard, 0 = no modifier, &amp;4 = Control (Cmd on macOS), &amp;8 = Shift, &amp;16 = Alt, &amp;32 = Super<br><br>
<a name="CF_SetClipboard"><hr></a><br>

<a name="FNG_GetMidiNote"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>RprMidiNote* FNG_GetMidiNote(RprMidiTake* midiTake, int index)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>RprMidiNote</i>  FNG_GetMidiNote(<i>RprMidiTake</i> midiTake, <i>int </i>index) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_ArrowButton", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", <i>int </i>dir) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<a name="ImGui_Attach"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_Attach(ImGui_Context* ctx, ImGui_Resource* obj)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_Attach(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>ImGui_Resource</i> obj) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_Attach", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>ImGui_Resource</i> obj) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_Attach(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>ImGui_Resource</i> obj)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_Attach(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>ImGui_Resource</i> obj)</code><br><br></div>
Link the object's lifetime to the given context.<br>
Objects can be draw list splitters, fonts, images, list clippers, etc.<br>
Call Detach to let the object be garbage-collected after unuse again.<br>
<br>
List clipper objects may only be attached to the context they were created for.<br>
<br>
Fonts are (currently) a special case: they must be attached to the context<br>
before usage. Furthermore, fonts may only be attached or detached immediately<br>
after the context is created or before any other function calls modifying the<br>
context per defer cycle. See "limitations" in the font API documentation.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_Begin"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_Begin(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* name, bool* p_openInOutOptional, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_Begin(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "name", <i>optional bool &amp;</i>p_open, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_Begin", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "name", <i>optional bool &amp;</i>p_open, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>optional boolean </i>p_open = reaper.ImGui_Begin(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> name, <i>optional boolean </i>p_open, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> name, <i>Boolean</i> p_openInOutOptional, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_Begin(ctx, name, p_openInOutOptional, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Push window to the stack and start appending to it.<br>
<br>
- Passing true to 'p_open' shows a window-closing widget in the upper-right<br>
  corner of the window, which clicking will set the boolean to false when returned.<br>
- You may append multiple times to the same window during the same frame by<br>
  calling Begin()/End() pairs multiple times. Some information such as 'flags'<br>
  or 'p_open' will only be considered by the first call to Begin().<br>
- Begin() return false to indicate the window is collapsed or fully clipped,<br>
  so you may early out and omit submitting anything to the window.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginChild"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_BeginChild(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* str_id, double* size_wInOptional, double* size_hInOptional, bool* borderInOptional, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_BeginChild(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", <i>optional </i>size_wIn, <i>optional </i>size_hIn, <i>optional bool</i> borderIn, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_BeginChild", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", <i>optional </i>size_wIn, <i>optional </i>size_hIn, <i>optional bool</i> borderIn, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_BeginChild(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> str_id, <i>optional number </i>size_wIn, <i>optional number </i>size_hIn, <i>optional boolean</i> borderIn, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> str_id, <i>Float</i> size_wInOptional, <i>Float</i> size_hInOptional, <i>Boolean</i> borderInOptional, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_BeginChild(ctx, str_id, size_wInOptional, size_hInOptional, borderInOptional, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
For each independent axis of 'size':<br>
- \&gt; 0.0: fixed size<br>
- = 0.0: use remaining host window size<br>
- &lt; 0.0: use remaining window size minus abs(size)<br>
(Each axis can use a different mode, e.g. size = 0x400.)<br>
<br>
Returns false to indicate the window is collapsed or fully clipped, so you may early out and omit submitting anything to the window.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginChildFrame"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_BeginChildFrame(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* str_id, double size_w, double size_h, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_BeginChildFrame(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", size_w, size_h, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_BeginChildFrame", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", size_w, size_h, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_BeginChildFrame(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> str_id, <i>number</i> size_w, <i>number</i> size_h, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> str_id, <i>Float</i> size_w, <i>Float</i> size_h, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_BeginChildFrame(ctx, str_id, size_w, size_h, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Helper to create a child window / scrolling region that looks like a normal<br>
widget frame. See BeginChild.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginCombo"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_BeginCombo(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* label, const char* preview_value, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_BeginCombo(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", "preview_value", <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_BeginCombo(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> label, <i>string</i> preview_value, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> label, <i>String</i> preview_value, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_BeginCombo(ctx, label, preview_value, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
The BeginCombo/EndCombo API allows you to manage your contents and selection<br>
state however you want it, by creating e.g. Selectable items.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginDisabled"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_BeginDisabled(ImGui_Context* ctx, bool* disabledInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_BeginDisabled(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional bool</i> disabledIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_BeginDisabled", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional bool</i> disabledIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_BeginDisabled(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional boolean</i> disabledIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Boolean</i> disabledInOptional) = ImGui_BeginDisabled(ctx, disabledInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Disable all user interactions and dim items visuals<br>
(applying StyleVar_DisabledAlpha over current colors).<br>
<br>
BeginDisabled(false) essentially does nothing useful but is provided to<br>
facilitate use of boolean expressions.<br>
If you can avoid calling BeginDisabled(false)/EndDisabled() best to avoid it.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginDragDropSource"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_BeginDragDropSource(ImGui_Context* ctx, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_BeginDragDropSource(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_BeginDragDropSource", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_BeginDragDropSource(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_BeginDragDropSource(ctx, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Call after submitting an item which may be dragged. when this return true,<br>
you can call SetDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropSource()<br>
<br>
If you stop calling BeginDragDropSource() the payload is preserved however<br>
it won't have a preview tooltip (we currently display a fallback "..." tooltip<br>
as replacement).<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginDragDropTarget"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_BeginDragDropTarget(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_BeginDragDropTarget(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_BeginDragDropTarget", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_BeginDragDropTarget(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  ImGui_BeginDragDropTarget(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
Call after submitting an item that may receive a payload.<br>
If this returns true, you can call AcceptDragDropPayload + EndDragDropTarget.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginGroup"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_BeginGroup(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_BeginGroup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_BeginGroup", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_BeginGroup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_BeginGroup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
Lock horizontal starting position. See EndGroup.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginListBox"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_BeginListBox(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* label, double* size_wInOptional, double* size_hInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_BeginListBox(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>optional </i>size_wIn, <i>optional </i>size_hIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_BeginListBox", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>optional </i>size_wIn, <i>optional </i>size_hIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_BeginListBox(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> label, <i>optional number </i>size_wIn, <i>optional number </i>size_hIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> label, <i>Float</i> size_wInOptional, <i>Float</i> size_hInOptional) = ImGui_BeginListBox(ctx, label, size_wInOptional, size_hInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Open a framed scrolling region. This is essentially a thin wrapper to using<br>
BeginChild/EndChild with some stylistic changes.<br>
<br>
The BeginListBox/EndListBox API allows you to manage your contents and selection<br>
state however you want it, by creating e.g. Selectable or any items.<br>
<br>
- Choose frame width:<br>
  - width  &gt; 0.0: custom<br>
  - width  &lt; 0.0 or -FLT_MIN: right-align<br>
  - width  = 0.0 (default): use current ItemWidth<br>
- Choose frame height:<br>
  - height &gt; 0.0: custom<br>
  - height &lt; 0.0 or -FLT_MIN: bottom-align<br>
  - height = 0.0 (default): arbitrary default height which can fit ~7 items<br>
<br>
See EndListBox.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginMenu"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_BeginMenu(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* label, bool* enabledInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_BeginMenu(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>optional bool</i> enabledIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

Create a sub-menu entry. only call EndMenu if this returns true!<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_BeginPopup"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_BeginPopup(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* str_id, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_BeginPopup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_BeginPopup", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_BeginPopup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> str_id, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> str_id, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_BeginPopup(ctx, str_id, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Query popup state, if open start appending into the window. Call EndPopup<br>
afterwards. WindowFlags* are forwarded to the window.<br>
<br>
Return true if the popup is open, and you can start outputting to it.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginPopupContextItem"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_BeginPopupContextItem(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* str_idInOptional, int* popup_flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_BeginPopupContextItem(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>"str_idIn", <i>optional int</i> popup_flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_BeginPopupContextItem", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>"str_idIn", <i>optional int</i> popup_flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_BeginPopupContextItem(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i><i>string</i> str_idIn, <i>optional integer</i> popup_flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> str_idInOptional, <i>Int</i> popup_flagsInOptional) = ImGui_BeginPopupContextItem(ctx, str_idInOptional, popup_flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
This is a helper to handle the simplest case of associating one named popup<br>
to one given widget. You can pass a nil str_id to use the identifier of the last<br>
item. This is essentially the same as calling OpenPopupOnItemClick + BeginPopup<br>
but written to avoid computing the ID twice because BeginPopupContext*<br>
functions may be called very frequently.<br>
<br>
If you want to use that on a non-interactive item such as Text you need to pass<br>
in an explicit ID here.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_BeginPopupContextWindow"><hr></a><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_Bullet(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<a name="ImGui_ButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft"><hr></a><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_CloseCurrentPopup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_CloseCurrentPopup", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_CloseCurrentPopup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_CloseCurrentPopup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>

Use inside the BeginPopup/EndPopup scope to close manually.<br>
<br>
CloseCurrentPopup() is called by default by Selectable/MenuItem when activated.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_CollapsingHeader"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_CollapsingHeader(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* label, bool* p_visibleInOut, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_CollapsingHeader(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>bool &amp;</i>p_visible, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_CollapsingHeader", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>bool &amp;</i>p_visible, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>boolean </i>p_visible = reaper.ImGui_CollapsingHeader(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> label, <i>boolean </i>p_visible, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> label, <i>Boolean</i> p_visibleInOut, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_CollapsingHeader(ctx, label, p_visibleInOut, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Returns true when opened but do not indent nor push into the ID stack<br>
(because of the TreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen flag).<br>
<br>
This is basically the same as calling TreeNode(label, TreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader).<br>
You can remove the _NoTreePushOnOpen flag if you want behavior closer to normal<br>
TreeNode.<br>
<br>
When 'visible' is provided: if 'true' display an additional small close button<br>
on upper right of the header which will set the bool to false when clicked,<br>
if 'false' don't display the header.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ColorButton"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_ColorButton(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* desc_id, int col_rgba, int* flagsInOptional, double* size_wInOptional, double* size_hInOptional)</code><br><br></div>

<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_ColorButton", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "desc_id", <i>int </i>col_rgba, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn, <i>optional </i>size_wIn, <i>optional </i>size_hIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_ColorButton(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> desc_id, <i>integer</i> col_rgba, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn, <i>optional number </i>size_wIn, <i>optional number </i>size_hIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> desc_id, <i>Int</i> col_rgba, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional, <i>Float</i> size_wInOptional, <i>Float</i> size_hInOptional) = ImGui_ColorButton(ctx, desc_id, col_rgba, flagsInOptional, size_wInOptional, size_hInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Display a color square/button, hover for details, return true when pressed.<br>
Color is in 0xRRGGBBAA or, if ColorEditFlags_NoAlpha is set, 0xRRGGBB.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_ColorConvertNative"><hr></a><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_ColorConvertNative(<i>int </i>rgb) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_ColorConvertNative", <i>int </i>rgb) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_ColorConvertNative(<i>integer</i> rgb)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_ColorConvertNative(<i>Int</i> rgb)</code><br><br></div>
Convert a native color coming from REAPER or 0xRRGGBB to native.<br>
This swaps the red and blue channels on Windows.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ColorConvertRGBtoHSV"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_ColorConvertU32ToDouble4"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_ColorConvertU32ToDouble4(int rgba, double* rOut, double* gOut, double* bOut, double* aOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_ColorConvertU32ToDouble4(<i>int </i>rgba, <i>&amp;</i>r, <i>&amp;</i>g, <i>&amp;</i>b, <i>&amp;</i>a) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_ColorConvertU32ToDouble4", <i>int </i>rgba, <i>&amp;</i>r, <i>&amp;</i>g, <i>&amp;</i>b, <i>&amp;</i>a) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number </i>r, <i>number </i>g, <i>number </i>b, <i>number </i>a = reaper.ImGui_ColorConvertU32ToDouble4(<i>integer</i> rgba)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> rgba, <i>Float</i> rOut, <i>Float</i> gOut, <i>Float</i> bOut, <i>Float</i> aOut) = ImGui_ColorConvertU32ToDouble4(rgba, rOut, gOut, bOut, aOut)</code><br><br></div>
Unpack a 32-bit integer (0xRRGGBBAA) into separate RGBA values (0..1).<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ColorEdit3"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_ColorEdit3(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* label, int* col_rgbInOut, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_ColorEdit3(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>int &amp;</i>col_rgb, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_ColorEdit3", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>int &amp;</i>col_rgb, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>integer </i>col_rgb = reaper.ImGui_ColorEdit3(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> label, <i>integer </i>col_rgb, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> label, <i>Int</i> col_rgbInOut, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_ColorEdit3(ctx, label, col_rgbInOut, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Color is in 0xXXRRGGBB. XX is ignored and will not be modified.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ColorEdit4"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_ColorEdit4(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* label, int* col_rgbaInOut, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_ColorEdit4(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>int &amp;</i>col_rgba, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_ColorEdit4", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>int &amp;</i>col_rgba, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>integer </i>col_rgba = reaper.ImGui_ColorEdit4(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> label, <i>integer </i>col_rgba, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> label, <i>Int</i> col_rgbaInOut, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_ColorEdit4(ctx, label, col_rgbaInOut, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Color is in 0xRRGGBBAA or, if ColorEditFlags_NoAlpha is set, 0xXXRRGGBB<br>
(XX is ignored and will not be modified).<br><br>

   floats instead of 0..255 integers. No round-trip of value via integers.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueLoop"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueLoop()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueLoop() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueLoop") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueLoop()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueLoop()</code><br><br></div>
Some calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return false.<br>
Will cycle through window depths then repeat. Suggested use: add<br>
"SetConfigVar(ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueLoop(), GetKeyMods() == Mod_Shift"<br>
in your main loop then occasionally press SHIFT.<br>
Windows should be flickering while running.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueOnce"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueOnce()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueOnce() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueOnce") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueOnce()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_ConfigVar_DebugBeginReturnValueOnce()</code><br><br></div>
First-time calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return false.<br>
**Needs to be set at context startup time** if you don't want to miss windows.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ConfigVar_DockingNoSplit"><hr></a><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_ConfigVar_InputTextEnterKeepActive() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<a name="ImGui_ConfigVar_InputTrickleEventQueue"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_ConfigVar_InputTrickleEventQueue()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_ConfigVar_InputTrickleEventQueue() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_ConfigVar_InputTrickleEventQueue") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_ConfigVar_InputTrickleEventQueue()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_ConfigVar_InputTrickleEventQueue()</code><br><br></div>
Enable input queue trickling: some types of events submitted during the same<br>
   frame (e.g. button down + up) will be spread over multiple frames, improving<br>
   interactions with low framerates.<br>
<br>
   Warning: when this option is disabled mouse clicks and key presses faster<br>
   than a frame will be lost.<br>
   This affects accessiblity features and some input devices.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ConfigVar_KeyRepeatDelay"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_ConfigVar_KeyRepeatDelay()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_ConfigVar_KeyRepeatDelay() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_ConfigVar_KeyRepeatDelay()</code><br><br></div>
When holding a key/button, time before it starts repeating, in seconds<br>
   (for buttons in Repeat mode, etc.).<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ConfigVar_KeyRepeatRate"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_ConfigVar_MacOSXBehaviors"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_ConfigVar_MacOSXBehaviors()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_ConfigVar_MacOSXBehaviors() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_ConfigVar_MacOSXBehaviors") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_ConfigVar_MacOSXBehaviors()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_ConfigVar_MacOSXBehaviors()</code><br><br></div>
OS X style: Text editing cursor movement using Alt instead of Ctrl, Shortcuts<br>
   using Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl, Line/Text Start and End using Cmd+Arrows<br>
   instead of Home/End, Double click selects by word instead of selecting whole<br>
   text, Multi-selection in lists uses Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ConfigVar_MouseDoubleClickMaxDist"><hr></a><br>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_ConfigVar_MouseDoubleClickMaxDist()</code><br><br></div>
Distance threshold to stay in to validate a double-click, in pixels.<br><br>
