<a name="ImGui_CreateContext"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>ImGui_Context* ImGui_CreateContext(const char* label, int* config_flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>ImGui_Context</i>  ImGui_CreateContext("label", <i>optional int</i> config_flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>ImGui_Context</i>  extension_api("ImGui_CreateContext", "label", <i>optional int</i> config_flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>ImGui_Context</i> reaper.ImGui_CreateContext(<i>string</i> label, <i>optional integer</i> config_flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> retval, <i>String</i> label, <i>Int</i> config_flagsInOptional) = ImGui_CreateContext(label, config_flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Create a new ReaImGui context.<br>
The context will remain valid as long as it is used in each defer cycle.<br>
<br>
The label is used for the tab text when windows are docked in REAPER<br>
and also as a unique identifier for storing settings.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_CreateDrawListSplitter"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>ImGui_DrawListSplitter* ImGui_CreateDrawListSplitter(ImGui_DrawList* draw_list)</code><br><br></div>

<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>ImGui_DrawListSplitter</i> reaper.ImGui_CreateDrawListSplitter(<i>ImGui_DrawList</i> draw_list)</code><br><br></div>

<a name="ImGui_CreateFont"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>ImGui_Font* ImGui_CreateFont(const char* family_or_file, int size, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>ImGui_Font</i>  ImGui_CreateFont("family_or_file", <i>int </i>size, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>ImGui_Font</i>  extension_api("ImGui_CreateFont", "family_or_file", <i>int </i>size, <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>ImGui_Font</i> reaper.ImGui_CreateFont(<i>string</i> family_or_file, <i>integer</i> size, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Font</i> retval, <i>String</i> family_or_file, <i>Int</i> size, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_CreateFont(family_or_file, size, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Load a font matching a font family name or from a font file.<br>
The font will remain valid while it's attached to a context. See Attach.<br>
<br>
The family name can be an installed font or one of the generic fonts:<br>
sans-serif, serif, monospace, cursive, fantasy.<br>
<br>
If 'family_or_file' specifies a path to a font file (contains a / or \\):<br>
- The first byte of 'flags' is used as the font index within the file<br>
- The font styles in 'flags' are simulated by the font renderer<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_CreateFunctionFromEEL"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>ImGui_Function* ImGui_CreateFunctionFromEEL(const char* code)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>ImGui_Function</i>  ImGui_CreateFunctionFromEEL("code") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>ImGui_Function</i>  extension_api("ImGui_CreateFunctionFromEEL", "code") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>ImGui_Function</i> reaper.ImGui_CreateFunctionFromEEL(<i>string</i> code)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>ImGui_Function</i>  ImGui_CreateFunctionFromEEL(<i>String</i> code)</code><br><br></div>
Compile an EEL program.<br>
<br>
Standard EEL [math](https://www.reaper.fm/sdk/js/basiccode.php#js_basicfunc)<br>
and [string](https://www.reaper.fm/sdk/js/strings.php#js_string_funcs)<br>
functions are available in addition to callback-specific functions<br>
(see InputTextCallback_*).<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_CreateImage"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>ImGui_Image* ImGui_CreateImage(const char* file, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>

The returned object is valid as long as it is used in each defer cycle<br>
unless attached to a context (see Attach).<br>
<br>
('flags' currently unused and reserved for future expansion)<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_DestroyContext"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_DestroyContext(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_DestroyContext(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_DestroyContext", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_DestroyContext(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
Free the resources used by a context.<br>
<br>
Calling this function is usually not required as all ReaImGui objects are<br>
automatically garbage-collected when unused.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_Detach"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_Detach(ImGui_Context* ctx, ImGui_Resource* obj)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_Detach(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>ImGui_Resource</i> obj) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_Detach(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>ImGui_Resource</i> obj)</code><br><br></div>
Unlink the object's lifetime. Unattached objects are automatically destroyed<br>
when left unused. You may check whether an object has been destroyed using<br>
ValidatePtr.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_DragDouble"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery()</code><br><br></div>
AcceptDragDropPayload will returns true even before the mouse button is<br>
   released. You can then check GetDragDropPayload/is_delivery to test if the<br>
   payload needs to be delivered.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect()</code><br><br></div>
Do not draw the default highlight rectangle when hovering over target.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DragDropFlags_AcceptPeekOnly()</code><br><br></div>
For peeking ahead and inspecting the payload before delivery.<br>
   Equivalent to DragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery |<br>
   DragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_None"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_None()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_None() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_DragDropFlags_None") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_DragDropFlags_None()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DragDropFlags_None()</code><br><br></div>
<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID()</code><br><br></div>
Allow items such as Text, Image that have no unique identifier to be used as<br>
   drag source, by manufacturing a temporary identifier based on their<br>
   window-relative position. This is extremely unusual within the dear imgui<br>
   ecosystem and so we made it explicit.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload()</code><br><br></div>
Automatically expire the payload if the source cease to be submitted<br>
   (otherwise payloads are persisting while being dragged).<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceExtern"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceExtern()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceExtern() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceExtern") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceExtern()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceExtern()</code><br><br></div>
External source (from outside of dear imgui), won't attempt to read current<br>
   item/window info. Will always return true.<br>
   Only one Extern source can be active simultaneously.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover()</code><br><br></div>
By default, when dragging we clear data so that IsItemHovered will return<br>
   false, to avoid subsequent user code submitting tooltips. This flag disables<br>
   this behavior so you can still call IsItemHovered on the source item.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers()</code><br><br></div>
Disable the behavior that allows to open tree nodes and collapsing header by<br>
   holding over them while dragging a source item.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip()</code><br><br></div>
By default, a successful call to BeginDragDropSource opens a tooltip so you<br>
   can display a preview or description of the source contents.<br>
   This flag disables this behavior.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_DragFloatRange2"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersNone"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersNone()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersNone() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersNone") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersNone()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_DrawFlags_RoundCornersNone()</code><br><br></div>
DrawList_AddRect, DrawList_AddRectFilled, DrawList_PathRect: disable rounding<br>
   on all corners (when rounding &gt; 0.0). This is NOT zero, NOT an implicit flag!.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_DrawList_AddImageQuad"><hr></a><br>

The last pushed font is used if font is nil.<br>
The size of the last pushed font is used if font_size is 0.<br>
cpu_fine_clip_rect_* only takes effect if all four are non-nil.<br><br>

logic (hit-testing and widget culling).<br><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_EndGroup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_EndGroup", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_EndGroup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>

into one "item" (so you can use IsItemHovered or layout primitives such as<br>
SameLine on whole group, etc.).<br>
<br>
See BeginGroup.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_GetColor"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_GetColor(ImGui_Context* ctx, int idx, double* alpha_mulInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_GetColor(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>idx, <i>optional </i>alpha_mulIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_GetColor", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>idx, <i>optional </i>alpha_mulIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_GetColor(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>integer</i> idx, <i>optional number </i>alpha_mulIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Int</i> idx, <i>Float</i> alpha_mulInOptional) = ImGui_GetColor(ctx, idx, alpha_mulInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Retrieve given style color with style alpha applied and optional extra alpha<br>
multiplier, packed as a 32-bit value (RGBA). See Col_* for available style colors.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_GetMouseDelta"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_GetMouseDelta(ImGui_Context* ctx, double* xOut, double* yOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_GetMouseDelta(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>&amp;</i>x, <i>&amp;</i>y) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_GetMouseDelta", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>&amp;</i>x, <i>&amp;</i>y) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number </i>x, <i>number </i>y = reaper.ImGui_GetMouseDelta(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> xOut, <i>Float</i> yOut) = ImGui_GetMouseDelta(ctx, xOut, yOut)</code><br><br></div>
Mouse delta. Note that this is zero if either current or previous position<br>
are invalid (-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX), so a disappearing/reappearing mouse won't have<br>
a huge delta.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_GetMouseDragDelta"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_GetMouseDragDelta(ImGui_Context* ctx, double* xOut, double* yOut, int* buttonInOptional, double* lock_thresholdInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_GetMouseDragDelta(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>&amp;</i>x, <i>&amp;</i>y, <i>optional int</i> buttonIn, <i>optional </i>lock_thresholdIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_GetMouseDragDelta", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>&amp;</i>x, <i>&amp;</i>y, <i>optional int</i> buttonIn, <i>optional </i>lock_thresholdIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number </i>x, <i>number </i>y = reaper.ImGui_GetMouseDragDelta(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>number </i>x, <i>number </i>y, <i>optional integer</i> buttonIn, <i>optional number </i>lock_thresholdIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> xOut, <i>Float</i> yOut, <i>Int</i> buttonInOptional, <i>Float</i> lock_thresholdInOptional) = ImGui_GetMouseDragDelta(ctx, xOut, yOut, buttonInOptional, lock_thresholdInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Return the delta from the initial clicking position while the mouse button is<br>
pressed or was just released. This is locked and return 0.0 until the mouse<br>
moves past a distance threshold at least once (if lock_threshold &lt; -1.0, uses<br>
ConfigVar_MouseDragThreshold).<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_GetMouseWheel"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_GetMouseWheel(ImGui_Context* ctx, double* verticalOut, double* horizontalOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_GetMouseWheel(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>&amp;</i>vertical, <i>&amp;</i>horizontal) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_GetMouseWheel", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>&amp;</i>vertical, <i>&amp;</i>horizontal) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number </i>vertical, <i>number </i>horizontal = reaper.ImGui_GetMouseWheel(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> verticalOut, <i>Float</i> horizontalOut) = ImGui_GetMouseWheel(ctx, verticalOut, horizontalOut)</code><br><br></div>
Vertical: 1 unit scrolls about 5 lines text. &gt;0 scrolls Up, &lt;0 scrolls Down.<br>
Hold SHIFT to turn vertical scroll into horizontal scroll<br>
<br>
Horizontal: &gt;0 scrolls Left, &lt;0 scrolls Right.<br>
Most users don't have a mouse with a horizontal wheel.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_GetScrollMaxX"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>double ImGui_GetScrollMaxX(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>double </i> ImGui_GetScrollMaxX(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number</i> reaper.ImGui_GetScrollMaxX(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Float</i>  ImGui_GetScrollMaxX(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
Get maximum scrolling amount ~~ ContentSize.x - WindowSize.x - DecorationsSize.x<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_GetScrollMaxY"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>double ImGui_GetScrollMaxY(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>

  Useful for Drag and Drop patterns.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_Image_GetSize"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_InputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll"><hr></a><br>

   the callback is useful mainly to manipulate the underlying buffer while<br>
   focus is active).<br><br>

<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_InvisibleButton(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> str_id, <i>number</i> size_w, <i>number</i> size_h, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> str_id, <i>Float</i> size_w, <i>Float</i> size_h, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_InvisibleButton(ctx, str_id, size_w, size_h, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Flexible button behavior without the visuals, frequently useful to build<br>
custom behaviors using the public api (along with IsItemActive, IsItemHovered, etc.).<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_IsItemActivated"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_IsItemActive"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_IsItemActive(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_IsItemActive(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_IsItemActive", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_IsItemActive(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  ImGui_IsItemActive(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
Is the last item active? (e.g. button being held, text field being edited.<br>
This will continuously return true while holding mouse button on an item.<br>
Items that don't interact will always return false.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_IsItemClicked"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_IsItemClicked(ImGui_Context* ctx, int* mouse_buttonInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_IsItemClicked(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional int</i> mouse_buttonIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_IsItemClicked", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional int</i> mouse_buttonIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_IsItemClicked(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional integer</i> mouse_buttonIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Int</i> mouse_buttonInOptional) = ImGui_IsItemClicked(ctx, mouse_buttonInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Is the last item clicked? (e.g. button/node just clicked on)<br>
== IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) &amp;&amp; IsItemHovered().<br>
<br>
This is NOT equivalent to the behavior of e.g. Button.<br>
Most widgets have specific reactions based on mouse-up/down state, mouse position etc.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_IsItemDeactivated"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_IsItemDeactivated(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_IsItemDeactivated(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_IsItemDeactivated", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_IsItemDeactivated(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  ImGui_IsItemDeactivated(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
Was the last item just made inactive (item was previously active).<br>
Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that require continuous editing.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  ImGui_IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
Was the last item just made inactive and made a value change when it was<br>
active? (e.g. Slider/Drag moved).<br>
<br>
Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that require continuous editing. Note<br>
that you may get false positives (some widgets such as Combo/ListBox/Selectable<br>
will return true even when clicking an already selected item).<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_IsItemEdited"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_IsItemEdited(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_IsItemEdited(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_IsItemEdited", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_IsItemEdited(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  ImGui_IsItemEdited(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
Did the last item modify its underlying value this frame? or was pressed?<br>
This is generally the same as the "bool" return value of many widgets.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_IsItemFocused"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_IsKeyPressed"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_IsKeyPressed(ImGui_Context* ctx, int key, bool* repeatInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_IsKeyPressed(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>key, <i>optional bool</i> repeatIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_IsKeyPressed", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>key, <i>optional bool</i> repeatIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_IsKeyPressed(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>integer</i> key, <i>optional boolean</i> repeatIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Int</i> key, <i>Boolean</i> repeatInOptional) = ImGui_IsKeyPressed(ctx, key, repeatInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Was key pressed (went from !Down to Down)?<br>
If repeat=true, uses ConfigVar_KeyRepeatDelay / ConfigVar_KeyRepeatRate.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_IsMouseClicked"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_IsMouseClicked(ImGui_Context* ctx, int button, bool* repeatInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_IsMouseClicked(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>button, <i>optional bool</i> repeatIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_IsMouseClicked", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>button, <i>optional bool</i> repeatIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_IsMouseClicked(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>integer</i> button, <i>optional boolean</i> repeatIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Int</i> button, <i>Boolean</i> repeatInOptional) = ImGui_IsMouseClicked(ctx, button, repeatInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Did mouse button clicked? (went from !Down to Down).<br>
Same as GetMouseClickedCount() == 1.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_IsMouseDoubleClicked"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_IsMouseDoubleClicked(ImGui_Context* ctx, int button)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_IsMouseDoubleClicked(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>button) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_IsMouseDoubleClicked", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>button) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

Did mouse button double-clicked? Same as GetMouseClickedCount() == 2.<br>
(Note that a double-click will also report IsMouseClicked() == true)<br><br>

Clipped by current clipping settings, but disregarding of other consideration<br>
of focus/window ordering/popup-block.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_IsPopupOpen"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_IsPopupOpen(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* str_id, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_IsPopupOpen(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_IsPopupOpen", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_IsPopupOpen(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> str_id, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> str_id, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_IsPopupOpen(ctx, str_id, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Return true if the popup is open at the current BeginPopup level of the<br>
popup stack.<br>
<br>
- With PopupFlags_AnyPopupId: return true if any popup is open at the current<br>
  BeginPopup() level of the popup stack.<br>
- With PopupFlags_AnyPopupId + PopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel: return true if any<br>
  popup is open.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_LabelText"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_LabelText(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* label, const char* text)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_LabelText(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", "text") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_LabelText", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", "text") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_LabelText(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> label, <i>string</i> text)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_LabelText(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> label, <i>String</i> text)</code><br><br></div>
Display text+label aligned the same way as value+label widgets<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ListBox"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_ListBox(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* label, int* current_itemInOut, const char* items, int items_sz, int* height_in_itemsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_ListBox(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>int &amp;</i>current_item, "items", <i>optional int</i> height_in_itemsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_ListBox", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>int &amp;</i>current_item, "items", <i>optional int</i> height_in_itemsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>integer </i>current_item = reaper.ImGui_ListBox(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> label, <i>integer </i>current_item, <i>string</i> items, <i>optional integer</i> height_in_itemsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> label, <i>Int</i> current_itemInOut, <i>String</i> items, <i>Int</i> items_sz, <i>Int</i> height_in_itemsInOptional) = ImGui_ListBox(ctx, label, current_itemInOut, items, items_sz, height_in_itemsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
This is an helper over BeginListBox/EndListBox for convenience purpose.<br>
<br>
Each item must be null-terminated (requires REAPER v6.44 or newer for EEL and Lua).<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ListClipper_Begin"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_ListClipper_Begin(ImGui_ListClipper* clipper, int items_count, double* items_heightInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_ListClipper_Begin(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>int </i>items_count, <i>optional </i>items_heightIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_ListClipper_Begin", <i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>int </i>items_count, <i>optional </i>items_heightIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_ListClipper_Begin(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>integer</i> items_count, <i>optional number </i>items_heightIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>Int</i> items_count, <i>Float</i> items_heightInOptional) = ImGui_ListClipper_Begin(clipper, items_count, items_heightInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
- items_count: Use INT_MAX if you don't know how many items you have<br>
(in which case the cursor won't be advanced in the final step)<br>
- items_height: Use -1.0 to be calculated automatically on first step.<br>
  Otherwise pass in the distance between your items, typically<br>
  GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing or GetFrameHeightWithSpacing.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ListClipper_End"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_ListClipper_End(ImGui_ListClipper* clipper)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_ListClipper_End(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_ListClipper_End", <i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_ListClipper_End(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_ListClipper_End(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper)</code><br><br></div>
Automatically called on the last call of ListClipper_Step that returns false.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ListClipper_GetDisplayRange"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_ListClipper_GetDisplayRange(ImGui_ListClipper* clipper, int* display_startOut, int* display_endOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_ListClipper_GetDisplayRange(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>int &amp;</i>display_start, <i>int &amp;</i>display_end) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_ListClipper_GetDisplayRange", <i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>int &amp;</i>display_start, <i>int &amp;</i>display_end) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer </i>display_start, <i>integer </i>display_end = reaper.ImGui_ListClipper_GetDisplayRange(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>Int</i> display_startOut, <i>Int</i> display_endOut) = ImGui_ListClipper_GetDisplayRange(clipper, display_startOut, display_endOut)</code><br><br></div>
<a name="ImGui_ListClipper_IncludeRangeByIndices"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_ListClipper_IncludeRangeByIndices(ImGui_ListClipper* clipper, int item_begin, int item_end)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_ListClipper_IncludeRangeByIndices(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>int </i>item_begin, <i>int </i>item_end) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_ListClipper_IncludeRangeByIndices", <i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>int </i>item_begin, <i>int </i>item_end) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_ListClipper_IncludeRangeByIndices(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>integer</i> item_begin, <i>integer</i> item_end)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_ListClipper_IncludeRangeByIndices(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper, <i>Int</i> item_begin, <i>Int</i> item_end)</code><br><br></div>
Call ListClipper_IncludeRangeByIndices before first call to<br>
ListClipper_Step if you need a range of items to be displayed regardless of<br>
visibility.<br>
<br>
(Due to alignment / padding of certain items it is possible that an extra item may be included on either end of the display range).<br>
<br>
item_end is exclusive e.g. use (42, 42+1) to make item 42 never clipped.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_ListClipper_Step"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_ListClipper_Step(ImGui_ListClipper* clipper)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_ListClipper_Step(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_ListClipper_Step", <i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_ListClipper_Step(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  ImGui_ListClipper_Step(<i>ImGui_ListClipper</i> clipper)</code><br><br></div>
Call until it returns false. The display_start/display_end fields from<br>
ListClipper_GetDisplayRange will be set and you can process/draw those items.<br><br>

processed by ImGui at the moment. Toggle state is written to 'selected' when<br>
provided.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_OpenPopup"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_OpenPopup(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* str_id, int* popup_flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_OpenPopup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", <i>optional int</i> popup_flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_OpenPopup", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", <i>optional int</i> popup_flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_OpenPopup(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> str_id, <i>optional integer</i> popup_flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> str_id, <i>Int</i> popup_flagsInOptional) = ImGui_OpenPopup(ctx, str_id, popup_flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Set popup state to open (don't call every frame!).<br>
ImGuiPopupFlags are available for opening options.<br>
<br>
If not modal: they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by<br>
pressing ESCAPE.<br>
<br>
Use PopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup to avoid opening a popup if there's<br>
already one at the same level.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_OpenPopupOnItemClick"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_OpenPopupOnItemClick(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* str_idInOptional, int* popup_flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_OpenPopupOnItemClick(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>"str_idIn", <i>optional int</i> popup_flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_OpenPopupOnItemClick", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>"str_idIn", <i>optional int</i> popup_flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_OpenPopupOnItemClick(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i><i>string</i> str_idIn, <i>optional integer</i> popup_flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> str_idInOptional, <i>Int</i> popup_flagsInOptional) = ImGui_OpenPopupOnItemClick(ctx, str_idInOptional, popup_flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Helper to open popup when clicked on last item. return true when just opened.<br>
(Note: actually triggers on the mouse _released_ event to be consistent with<br>
popup behaviors.)<br><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_PointConvertNative(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>&amp;</i>x, <i>&amp;</i>y, <i>optional bool</i> to_nativeIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_PointConvertNative", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>&amp;</i>x, <i>&amp;</i>y, <i>optional bool</i> to_nativeIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number </i>x, <i>number </i>y = reaper.ImGui_PointConvertNative(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>number </i>x, <i>number </i>y, <i>optional boolean</i> to_nativeIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> xInOut, <i>Float</i> yInOut, <i>Boolean</i> to_nativeInOptional) = ImGui_PointConvertNative(ctx, xInOut, yInOut, to_nativeInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Convert a position from the current platform's native coordinate position<br>
system to ReaImGui global coordinates (or vice versa).<br>
<br>
This effectively flips the Y coordinate on macOS and applies HiDPI scaling on<br>
Windows and Linux.<br><br>

<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_ProgressBar", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, fraction, <i>optional </i>size_arg_wIn, <i>optional </i>size_arg_hIn, <i>optional </i>"overlayIn") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<a name="ImGui_PushButtonRepeat"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_PushButtonRepeat(ImGui_Context* ctx, bool repeat)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_PushButtonRepeat(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>bool </i>repeat) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_PushButtonRepeat", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>bool </i>repeat) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_PushButtonRepeat(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>boolean</i> repeat)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_PushButtonRepeat(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Boolean</i> repeat)</code><br><br></div>
In 'repeat' mode, Button*() functions return repeated true in a typematic<br>
manner (using ConfigVar_KeyRepeatDelay/ConfigVar_KeyRepeatRate settings).<br>
<br>
Note that you can call IsItemActive after any Button to tell if the button is<br>
held in the current frame.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_PushClipRect"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_PushClipRect(ImGui_Context* ctx, double clip_rect_min_x, double clip_rect_min_y, double clip_rect_max_x, double clip_rect_max_y, bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_PushClipRect(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, clip_rect_min_x, clip_rect_min_y, clip_rect_max_x, clip_rect_max_y, <i>bool </i>intersect_with_current_clip_rect) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_PushClipRect", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, clip_rect_min_x, clip_rect_min_y, clip_rect_max_x, clip_rect_max_y, <i>bool </i>intersect_with_current_clip_rect) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<a name="ImGui_PushItemWidth"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_PushItemWidth(ImGui_Context* ctx, double item_width)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_PushItemWidth(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, item_width) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_PushItemWidth", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, item_width) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_PushItemWidth(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>number</i> item_width)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_PushItemWidth(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> item_width)</code><br><br></div>
Push width of items for common large "item+label" widgets.<br>
<br>
- \&gt;0.0: width in pixels<br>
- &lt;0.0 align xx pixels to the right of window<br>
  (so -FLT_MIN always align width to the right side)<br>
- 0.0 = default to ~2/3 of windows width.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_PushTextWrapPos"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_PushTextWrapPos(ImGui_Context* ctx, double* wrap_local_pos_xInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_PushTextWrapPos(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>wrap_local_pos_xIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_PushTextWrapPos", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>wrap_local_pos_xIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_PushTextWrapPos(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional number </i>wrap_local_pos_xIn)</code><br><br></div>

Push word-wrapping position for Text*() commands.<br>
<br>
-  &lt; 0.0: no wrapping<br>
-  = 0.0: wrap to end of window (or column)<br>
- \&gt; 0.0: wrap at 'wrap_pos_x' position in window local space.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_Separator"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_Separator(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_Separator(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_Separator", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_Separator(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_Separator(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
Separator, generally horizontal. inside a menu bar or in horizontal layout<br>
mode, this becomes a vertical separator.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_SetDragDropPayload"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_SetDragDropPayload(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* type, const char* data, int* condInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_SetDragDropPayload(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "type", "data", <i>optional int</i> condIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_SetDragDropPayload", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "type", "data", <i>optional int</i> condIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_SetDragDropPayload(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> type, <i>string</i> data, <i>optional integer</i> condIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> type, <i>String</i> data, <i>Int</i> condInOptional) = ImGui_SetDragDropPayload(ctx, type, data, condInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
The type is a user defined string of maximum 32 characters.<br>
Strings starting with '_' are reserved for dear imgui internal types.<br>
Data is copied and held by imgui.<br><br>

invisible buttons, selectables, etc. to catch unused area.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_SetNextItemWidth"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_SetNextItemWidth(ImGui_Context* ctx, double item_width)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_SetNextItemWidth(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, item_width) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_SetNextItemWidth", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, item_width) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_SetNextItemWidth(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>number</i> item_width)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_SetNextItemWidth(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> item_width)</code><br><br></div>
Set width of the _next_ common large "item+label" widget.<br>
<br>
- \&gt;0.0: width in pixels<br>
- &lt;0.0 align xx pixels to the right of window<br>
  (so -FLT_MIN always align width to the right side)<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_SetNextWindowBgAlpha"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_SetNextWindowBgAlpha(ImGui_Context* ctx, double alpha)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_SetNextWindowBgAlpha(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, alpha) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_SetNextWindowBgAlpha", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, alpha) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_SetNextWindowBgAlpha(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>number</i> alpha)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_SetNextWindowBgAlpha(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> alpha)</code><br><br></div>
Set next window background color alpha. Helper to easily override the Alpha<br>
component of Col_WindowBg/Col_ChildBg/Col_PopupBg.<br>
You may also use WindowFlags_NoBackground for a fully transparent window.<br><br>

<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_SetNextWindowContentSize(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>number</i> size_w, <i>number</i> size_h)</code><br><br></div>

Set next window content size (~ scrollable client area, which enforce the<br>
range of scrollbars). Not including window decorations (title bar, menu bar,<br>
etc.) nor StyleVar_WindowPadding. set an axis to 0.0 to leave it automatic.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_SetNextWindowSizeConstraints"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImGui_Context* ctx, double size_min_w, double size_min_h, double size_max_w, double size_max_h, ImGui_Function* custom_callbackInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, size_min_w, size_min_h, size_max_w, size_max_h, <i>ImGui_Function</i> custom_callbackIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_SetNextWindowSizeConstraints", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, size_min_w, size_min_h, size_max_w, size_max_h, <i>ImGui_Function</i> custom_callbackIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>number</i> size_min_w, <i>number</i> size_min_h, <i>number</i> size_max_w, <i>number</i> size_max_h, <i>ImGui_Function</i> custom_callbackIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> size_min_w, <i>Float</i> size_min_h, <i>Float</i> size_max_w, <i>Float</i> size_max_h, <i>ImGui_Function</i> custom_callbackInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Set next window size limits. Use -1,-1 on either X/Y axis to preserve the<br>
current size. Use FLT_MAX (second return value of NumericLimits_Float) for no<br>
maximum size. Sizes will be rounded down.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_SetScrollFromPosX"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_SetScrollHereX"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_SetScrollHereX(ImGui_Context* ctx, double* center_x_ratioInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_SetScrollHereX(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>center_x_ratioIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_SetScrollHereX", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>center_x_ratioIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_SetScrollHereX(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional number </i>center_x_ratioIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> center_x_ratioInOptional) = ImGui_SetScrollHereX(ctx, center_x_ratioInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Adjust scrolling amount to make current cursor position visible.<br>
center_x_ratio=0.0: left, 0.5: center, 1.0: right.<br>
When using to make a "default/current item" visible,<br>
consider using SetItemDefaultFocus instead.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_SetScrollHereY"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_SetScrollHereY(ImGui_Context* ctx, double* center_y_ratioInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_SetScrollHereY(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>center_y_ratioIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_SetScrollHereY", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>center_y_ratioIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_SetScrollHereY(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional number </i>center_y_ratioIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> center_y_ratioInOptional) = ImGui_SetScrollHereY(ctx, center_y_ratioInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Adjust scrolling amount to make current cursor position visible.<br>
center_y_ratio=0.0: top, 0.5: center, 1.0: bottom.<br>
When using to make a "default/current item" visible,<br>
consider using SetItemDefaultFocus instead.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_SetTabItemClosed"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_SetTabItemClosed(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* tab_or_docked_window_label)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_SetTabItemClosed(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "tab_or_docked_window_label") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

(useful to reduce visual flicker on reorderable tab bars).<br>

<a name="ImGui_SetWindowFocus"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_SetWindowFocusEx"><hr></a><br>

Prefer using SetNextWindowPos, as this may incur tearing and minor side-effects.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_SetWindowSize"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_SetWindowSize(ImGui_Context* ctx, double size_w, double size_h, int* condInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_SetWindowSize(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, size_w, size_h, <i>optional int</i> condIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_SetWindowSize(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>number</i> size_w, <i>number</i> size_h, <i>optional integer</i> condIn)</code><br><br></div>

(Not recommended) Set current window size - call within Begin/End.<br>
Set size_w and size_h to 0 to force an auto-fit.<br>
Prefer using SetNextWindowSize, as this may incur tearing and minor side-effects.<br><br>

<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_SliderFlags_AlwaysClamp") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

   By default CTRL+Click allows going out of bounds.<br><br>

   with small amount of digits.<br><br>

   It's generally important to keep this left-aligned if you want to lay<br>
   multiple items on a same line.<br><br>

<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_StyleVar_WindowRounding()</code><br><br></div>

<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_StyleVar_WindowRounding") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_StyleVar_WindowRounding()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_StyleVar_WindowRounding()</code><br><br></div>
Radius of window corners rounding. Set to 0.0 to have rectangular windows.<br>
  Large values tend to lead to variety of artifacts and are not recommended.<br><br>

   with middle mouse button. You can still repro this behavior on user's side<br>
   with if(IsItemHovered() &amp;&amp; IsMouseClicked(2)) p_open = false.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_TabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_TabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_TabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument()</code><br><br></div>
Append '*' to title without affecting the ID, as a convenience to avoid using<br>
   the ### operator. Also: tab is selected on closure and closure is deferred by<br>
   one frame to allow code to undo it without flicker.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthFixed"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthFixed()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthFixed() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthFixed()</code><br><br></div>
Column will not stretch. Preferable with horizontal scrolling enabled<br>
   (default if table sizing policy is _SizingFixedFit and table is resizable).<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthStretch"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthStretch()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthStretch() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthStretch") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthStretch()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TableColumnFlags_WidthStretch()</code><br><br></div>
Column will stretch. Preferable with horizontal scrolling disabled<br>
   (default if table sizing policy is _SizingStretchSame or _SizingStretchProp).<br><br>

   (reduce draw command count, items will be able to overflow into other columns).<br>
   Generally incompatible with TableSetupScrollFreeze.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendX"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendX()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendX() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendX()</code><br><br></div>
Make outer width auto-fit to columns, overriding outer_size.x value. Only<br>
   available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled and Stretch columns are not used.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendY"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendY()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendY() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendY") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TableFlags_NoHostExtendY()</code><br><br></div>
Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table<br>
   past the limit). Only available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled.<br>
   Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible"><hr></a><br>

   TableFlags_BordersOuterV is on, single inner padding if BordersOuterV is off).<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_TableFlags_PadOuterX"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TableFlags_PadOuterX()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TableFlags_PadOuterX() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_TableFlags_PadOuterX") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TableFlags_PadOuterX()</code><br><br></div>
Default if TableFlags_BordersOuterV is on. Enable outermost padding.<br>
   Generally desirable if you have headers.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TableFlags_PreciseWidths"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TableFlags_PreciseWidths()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TableFlags_PreciseWidths() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_TableFlags_PreciseWidths") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_TableFlags_PreciseWidths()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TableFlags_PreciseWidths()</code><br><br></div>
Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation<br>
   on a 100-wide table with 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this<br>
   flag: 33,33,33).<br>
   With larger number of columns, resizing will appear to be less smooth.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TableFlags_Reorderable"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TableFlags_Reorderable()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TableFlags_Reorderable() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_TableFlags_Reorderable") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_TableFlags_Reorderable()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TableFlags_Reorderable()</code><br><br></div>
Enable reordering columns in header row<br>
   (need calling TableSetupColumn + TableHeadersRow to display headers).<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TableFlags_Resizable"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TableFlags_Resizable()</code><br><br></div>

<a name="ImGui_TableFlags_ScrollX"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TableFlags_ScrollX()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TableFlags_ScrollX() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_TableFlags_ScrollX") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TableFlags_ScrollX()</code><br><br></div>
Enable horizontal scrolling. Require 'outer_size' parameter of BeginTable to<br>
   specify the container size. Changes default sizing policy.<br>
   Because this creates a child window, ScrollY is currently generally<br>
   recommended when using ScrollX.<br><br>
