<a name="ImGui_TableGetColumnSortSpecs"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_TableGetColumnSortSpecs(ImGui_Context* ctx, int id, int* column_user_idOut, int* column_indexOut, int* sort_orderOut, int* sort_directionOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_TableGetColumnSortSpecs(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>id, <i>int &amp;</i>column_user_id, <i>int &amp;</i>column_index, <i>int &amp;</i>sort_order, <i>int &amp;</i>sort_direction) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_TableGetColumnSortSpecs", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>id, <i>int &amp;</i>column_user_id, <i>int &amp;</i>column_index, <i>int &amp;</i>sort_order, <i>int &amp;</i>sort_direction) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>integer </i>column_user_id, <i>integer </i>column_index, <i>integer </i>sort_order, <i>integer </i>sort_direction = reaper.ImGui_TableGetColumnSortSpecs(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>integer</i> id)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Int</i> id, <i>Int</i> column_user_idOut, <i>Int</i> column_indexOut, <i>Int</i> sort_orderOut, <i>Int</i> sort_directionOut) = ImGui_TableGetColumnSortSpecs(ctx, id, column_user_idOut, column_indexOut, sort_orderOut, sort_directionOut)</code><br><br></div>
Sorting specification for one column of a table.<br>
Call while incrementing 'id' from 0 until false is returned.<br>
<br>
- ColumnUserID:  User id of the column (if specified by a TableSetupColumn call)<br>
- ColumnIndex:   Index of the column<br>
- SortOrder:     Index within parent SortSpecs (always stored in order starting<br>
  from 0, tables sorted on a single criteria will always have a 0 here)<br>
- SortDirection: SortDirection_Ascending or SortDirection_Descending<br>
  (you can use this or SortSign, whichever is more convenient for your sort<br>
  function)<br>
<br>
See TableNeedSort.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TableGetRowIndex"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TableGetRowIndex(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TableGetRowIndex(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_TableGetRowIndex(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>

<a name="ImGui_TableNeedSort"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_TableNeedSort(ImGui_Context* ctx, bool* has_specsOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_TableNeedSort(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>bool &amp;</i>has_specs) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_TableNeedSort", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>bool &amp;</i>has_specs) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>boolean </i>has_specs = reaper.ImGui_TableNeedSort(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Boolean</i> has_specsOut) = ImGui_TableNeedSort(ctx, has_specsOut)</code><br><br></div>
Return true once when sorting specs have changed since last call,<br>
or the first time. 'has_specs' is false when not sorting.<br>
<br>
See TableGetColumnSortSpecs.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TableNextColumn"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_TableNextColumn(ImGui_Context* ctx)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_TableNextColumn(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_TableNextColumn", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

last column). Return true when column is visible.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_TableSetColumnEnabled"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_TableSetColumnEnabled(ImGui_Context* ctx, int column_n, bool v)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_TableSetColumnEnabled(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>column_n, <i>bool </i>v) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_TableSetColumnEnabled", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>column_n, <i>bool </i>v) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_TableSetColumnEnabled(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>integer</i> column_n, <i>boolean</i> v)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_TableSetColumnEnabled(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Int</i> column_n, <i>Boolean</i> v)</code><br><br></div>
Change user-accessible enabled/disabled state of a column, set to false to<br>
hide the column. Note that end-user can use the context menu to change this<br>
themselves (right-click in headers, or right-click in columns body with<br>
TableFlags_ContextMenuInBody).<br>
<br>
- Require table to have the TableFlags_Hideable flag because we are manipulating<br>
  user accessible state.<br>
- Request will be applied during next layout, which happens on the first call to<br>
  TableNextRow after Begin_Table.<br>
- For the getter you can test<br>
  (TableGetColumnFlags() &amp; TableColumnFlags_IsEnabled) != 0.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TableSetColumnIndex"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_TableSetColumnIndex(ImGui_Context* ctx, int column_n)</code><br><br></div>

<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_TableSetColumnIndex", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>int </i>column_n) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<a name="ImGui_TextWrapped"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_TextWrapped(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* text)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_TextWrapped(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "text") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_TextWrapped", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "text") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_TextWrapped(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> text)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_TextWrapped(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> text)</code><br><br></div>
Shortcut for PushTextWrapPos(0.0); Text(text); PopTextWrapPos();.<br>
Note that this won't work on an auto-resizing window if there's no other<br>
widgets to extend the window width, yoy may need to set a size using<br>
SetNextWindowSize.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TreeNode"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_TreeNode(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* label, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_TreeNode(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_TreeNode", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "label", <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_TreeNode(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> label, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> label, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_TreeNode(ctx, label, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
TreeNode functions return true when the node is open, in which case you need<br>
to also call TreePop when you are finished displaying the tree node contents.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TreeNodeEx"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_TreeNodeEx(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* str_id, const char* label, int* flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_TreeNodeEx(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", "label", <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_TreeNodeEx", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id", "label", <i>optional int</i> flagsIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_TreeNodeEx(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> str_id, <i>string</i> label, <i>optional integer</i> flagsIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> str_id, <i>String</i> label, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_TreeNodeEx(ctx, str_id, label, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Helper variation to easily decorelate the id from the displayed string.<br>
Read the [FAQ](https://dearimgui.com/faq) about why and how to use ID.<br>
To align arbitrary text at the same level as a TreeNode you can use Bullet.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_AllowItemOverlap"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_FramePadding"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_FramePadding()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_FramePadding() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_FramePadding") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_FramePadding()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_FramePadding()</code><br><br></div>
Use FramePadding (even for an unframed text node) to vertically align text<br>
   baseline to regular widget height.<br>
   Equivalent to calling AlignTextToFramePadding.<br><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

   (by default logging will automatically open tree nodes).<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen()</code><br><br></div>
Don't do a TreePush when open (e.g. for CollapsingHeader)<br>
   = no extra indent nor pushing on ID stack.<br><br>

<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

Only open when clicking on the arrow part.<br>
   If TreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick is also set, single-click arrow or<br>
   double-click all box to open.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth()</code><br><br></div>
Extend hit box to the right-most edge, even if not framed.<br>
   This is not the default in order to allow adding other items on the same line.<br>
   In the future we may refactor the hit system to be front-to-back,<br>
   allowing natural overlaps and then this can become the default.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_TreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth()</code><br><br></div>
Extend hit box to the left-most and right-most edges (bypass the indented area).<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_TreePush"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_TreePush(ImGui_Context* ctx, const char* str_id)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_TreePush(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_TreePush", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, "str_id") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_TreePush(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>string</i> str_id)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ImGui_TreePush(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> str_id)</code><br><br></div>
Indent()+PushID(). Already called by TreeNode when returning true,<br>
but you can call TreePush/TreePop yourself if desired.<br><br>
<a name="ImGui_Unindent"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ImGui_Unindent(ImGui_Context* ctx, double* indent_wInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ImGui_Unindent(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>indent_wIn) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ImGui_Unindent", <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional </i>indent_wIn) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ImGui_Unindent(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>optional number </i>indent_wIn)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>Float</i> indent_wInOptional) = ImGui_Unindent(ctx, indent_wInOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Move content position back to the left, by 'indent_w', or<br>
StyleVar_IndentSpacing if 'indent_w' &lt;= 0<br><br>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>ImGui_Context</i> ctx, <i>String</i> label, <i>Float</i> size_w, <i>Float</i> size_h, <i>Float</i> vInOut, <i>Float</i> v_min, <i>Float</i> v_max, <i>String</i> formatInOptional, <i>Int</i> flagsInOptional) = ImGui_VSliderDouble(ctx, label, size_w, size_h, vInOut, v_min, v_max, formatInOptional, flagsInOptional)</code><br><br></div>

<a name="ImGui_ValidatePtr"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ImGui_ValidatePtr(void* pointer, const char* type)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ImGui_ValidatePtr(<i>void*</i> pointer, "type") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ImGui_ValidatePtr", <i>void*</i> pointer, "type") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.ImGui_ValidatePtr(<i>identifier</i> pointer, <i>string</i> type)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  ImGui_ValidatePtr(<i>void</i> pointer, <i>String</i> type)</code><br><br></div>
Return whether the pointer of the specified type is valid.<br>
<br>
Supported types are:<br>
<br>
- ImGui_Context*<br>
- ImGui_DrawList*<br>
- ImGui_DrawListSplitter*<br>
- ImGui_Font*<br>
- ImGui_Function*<br>
- ImGui_Image*<br>
- ImGui_ImageSet*<br>
- ImGui_ListClipper*<br>
- ImGui_TextFilter*<br>
- ImGui_Viewport*<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_WindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_WindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_WindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_WindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_WindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_WindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar()</code><br><br></div>
Allow horizontal scrollbar to appear (off by default).<br>
   You may use SetNextWindowContentSize(width, 0.0) prior to calling Begin() to<br>
   specify width. Read code in the demo's "Horizontal Scrolling" section.<br><br>

<a name="ImGui_WindowFlags_NoInputs"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ImGui_WindowFlags_UnsavedDocument"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int ImGui_WindowFlags_UnsavedDocument()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> ImGui_WindowFlags_UnsavedDocument() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("ImGui_WindowFlags_UnsavedDocument") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.ImGui_WindowFlags_UnsavedDocument()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  ImGui_WindowFlags_UnsavedDocument()</code><br><br></div>
Display a dot next to the title. When used in a tab/docking context,<br>
   tab is selected when clicking the X + closure is not assumed<br>
   (will wait for user to stop submitting the tab).<br>
   Otherwise closure is assumed when pressing the X,<br>
   so if you keep submitting the tab may reappear at end of tab bar.<br><br>

<a name="JS_Byte"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Byte(void* pointer, int offset, int* byteOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Byte(<i>void*</i> pointer, <i>int </i>offset, <i>int &amp;</i>byte) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Byte", <i>void*</i> pointer, <i>int </i>offset, <i>int &amp;</i>byte) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer </i>byte = reaper.JS_Byte(<i>identifier</i> pointer, <i>integer</i> offset)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> pointer, <i>Int</i> offset, <i>Int</i> byteOut) = JS_Byte(pointer, offset, byteOut)</code><br><br></div>
Returns the unsigned byte at address[offset]. Offset is added as steps of 1 byte each.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Composite"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Composite(void* windowHWND, int dstx, int dsty, int dstw, int dsth, void* sysBitmap, int srcx, int srcy, int srcw, int srch, bool* autoUpdateOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Composite(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>dstx, <i>int </i>dsty, <i>int </i>dstw, <i>int </i>dsth, <i>void*</i> sysBitmap, <i>int </i>srcx, <i>int </i>srcy, <i>int </i>srcw, <i>int </i>srch, <b>unsupported</b> autoUpdateOptional) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Composite", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>dstx, <i>int </i>dsty, <i>int </i>dstw, <i>int </i>dsth, <i>void*</i> sysBitmap, <i>int </i>srcx, <i>int </i>srcy, <i>int </i>srcw, <i>int </i>srch, <b>unsupported</b> autoUpdateOptional) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_Composite(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>integer</i> dstx, <i>integer</i> dsty, <i>integer</i> dstw, <i>integer</i> dsth, <i>identifier</i> sysBitmap, <i>integer</i> srcx, <i>integer</i> srcy, <i>integer</i> srcw, <i>integer</i> srch, <b>unsupported</b> autoUpdate)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Int</i> dstx, <i>Int</i> dsty, <i>Int</i> dstw, <i>Int</i> dsth, <i>void</i> sysBitmap, <i>Int</i> srcx, <i>Int</i> srcy, <i>Int</i> srcw, <i>Int</i> srch, <i>Boolean</i> autoUpdateOptional) = JS_Composite(windowHWND, dstx, dsty, dstw, dsth, sysBitmap, srcx, srcy, srcw, srch, autoUpdateOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Composites a LICE bitmap with a REAPER window.  Each time that the window is re-drawn, the bitmap will be blitted over the window's client area (with per-pixel alpha blending).<br>
<br>
 * If dstw or dsth is -1, the bitmap will be stretched to fill the width or height of the window, respectively.<br>
<br>
 * autoUpdate is an optional parameter that is false by default. If true, JS_Composite will automatically invalidate and re-draw the part of the window that covers the current position of the bitmap, and if the bitmap is being moved, also the previous position. (If only one or a handful of bitmaps are being moved across the screen, autoUpdate should result in smoother animation on WindowsOS; if numerous bitmaps are spread over the entire window, it may be faster to disable autoUpdate and instead call JS_Window_InvalidateRect explicitly once all bitmaps have been moved.)<br>
<br>
 * InvalidateRect should also be called whenever the contents of the bitmap contents have been changed, but not the position, to trigger a window update.<br>
<br>
 * On WindowsOS, the key to reducing flickering is to slow down the frequency at which the window is re-drawn. InvalidateRect should only be called when absolutely necessary, preferably not more than 20 times per second.  (Also refer to the JS_Composite_Delay function.)<br>
<br>
 * On WindowsOS, flickering can further be reduced by keeping the invalidated area as small as possible, covering only the bitmaps that have been edited or moved.  However, if numerous bitmaps are spread over the entire window, it may be faster to simply invalidate the entire client area. <br>
<br>
 * This function should not be applied directly to top-level windows, but rather to child windows.<br>
<br>
 * Some classes of UI elements, particularly buttons, do not take kindly to being composited, and may crash REAPER.<br>
<br>
 * On WindowsOS, GDI blitting does not perform alpha multiplication of the source bitmap. For proper color rendering, a separate pre-multiplication step is therefore required, using either LICE_Blit or LICE_ProcessRect.<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
1 if successful, otherwise -1 = windowHWND is not a window, -3 = Could not obtain the original window process, -4 = sysBitmap is not a LICE bitmap, -5 = sysBitmap is not a system bitmap, -6 = Could not obtain the window HDC, -7 = Error when subclassing to new window process.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Composite_Delay"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Composite_Delay(void* windowHWND, double minTime, double maxTime, int numBitmapsWhenMax, double* prevMinTimeOut, double* prevMaxTimeOut, int* prevBitmapsOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Composite_Delay(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, minTime, maxTime, <i>int </i>numBitmapsWhenMax, <i>&amp;</i>prevMinTime, <i>&amp;</i>prevMaxTime, <i>int &amp;</i>prevBitmaps) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Composite_Delay", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, minTime, maxTime, <i>int </i>numBitmapsWhenMax, <i>&amp;</i>prevMinTime, <i>&amp;</i>prevMaxTime, <i>int &amp;</i>prevBitmaps) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>number </i>prevMinTime, <i>number </i>prevMaxTime, <i>integer </i>prevBitmaps = reaper.JS_Composite_Delay(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>number</i> minTime, <i>number</i> maxTime, <i>integer</i> numBitmapsWhenMax)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Float</i> minTime, <i>Float</i> maxTime, <i>Int</i> numBitmapsWhenMax, <i>Float</i> prevMinTimeOut, <i>Float</i> prevMaxTimeOut, <i>Int</i> prevBitmapsOut) = JS_Composite_Delay(windowHWND, minTime, maxTime, numBitmapsWhenMax, prevMinTimeOut, prevMaxTimeOut, prevBitmapsOut)</code><br><br></div>
On WindowsOS, flickering of composited images can be improved considerably by slowing the refresh rate of the window.  The optimal refresh rate may depend on the number of composited bitmaps.<br>
<br>
minTime is the minimum refresh delay, in seconds, when only one bitmap is composited onto the window.  The delay time will increase linearly with the number of bitmaps, up to a maximum of maxTime when numBitmapsWhenMax is reached.<br>
<br>
If both minTime and maxTime are 0, all delay settings for the window are cleared.<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
 * retval = 1 if successful, 0 if arguments are invalid (i.e. if maxTime &lt; minTime, or maxBitmaps &lt; 1).<br>
 * If delay times have not previously been set for this window, prev time values are 0.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Composite_ListBitmaps"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Composite_ListBitmaps(void* windowHWND, char* listOutNeedBig, int listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Composite_ListBitmaps(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, #list) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Composite_ListBitmaps", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, #list) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>string </i>list = reaper.JS_Composite_ListBitmaps(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> listOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> listOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_Composite_ListBitmaps(windowHWND, listOutNeedBig, listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Returns all bitmaps composited to the given window.<br>
<br>
The list is formatted as a comma-separated string of hexadecimal values, each representing a LICE_IBitmap* pointer.<br>
<br>
retval is the number of linked bitmaps found, or negative if an error occured.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Composite_Unlink"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Composite_Unlink(void* windowHWND, void* bitmapOptional, bool* autoUpdateOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Composite_Unlink(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>void*</i> bitmap, <b>unsupported</b> autoUpdateOptional) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Composite_Unlink", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>void*</i> bitmap, <b>unsupported</b> autoUpdateOptional) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_Composite_Unlink(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>identifier</i> bitmap, <b>unsupported</b> autoUpdate)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>void</i> bitmapOptional, <i>Boolean</i> autoUpdateOptional) = JS_Composite_Unlink(windowHWND, bitmapOptional, autoUpdateOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Unlinks the window and bitmap.<br>
<br>
 * autoUpdate is an optional parameter. If unlinking a single bitmap and autoUpdate is true, the function will automatically re-draw the window to remove the blitted image.<br>
<br>
If no bitmap is specified, all bitmaps composited to the window will be unlinked -- even those by other scripts.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Dialog_BrowseForFolder"><hr></a><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Dialog_BrowseForFolder("caption", "initialFolder", #folder) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Dialog_BrowseForFolder", "caption", "initialFolder", #folder) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>string </i>folder = reaper.JS_Dialog_BrowseForFolder(<i>string</i> caption, <i>string</i> initialFolder)</code><br><br></div>

<a name="JS_Dialog_BrowseForOpenFiles"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Dialog_BrowseForOpenFiles(const char* windowTitle, const char* initialFolder, const char* initialFile, const char* extensionList, bool allowMultiple, char* fileNamesOutNeedBig, int fileNamesOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Dialog_BrowseForOpenFiles("windowTitle", "initialFolder", "initialFile", "extensionList", <i>bool </i>allowMultiple, #fileNames) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Dialog_BrowseForOpenFiles", "windowTitle", "initialFolder", "initialFile", "extensionList", <i>bool </i>allowMultiple, #fileNames) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>string </i>fileNames = reaper.JS_Dialog_BrowseForOpenFiles(<i>string</i> windowTitle, <i>string</i> initialFolder, <i>string</i> initialFile, <i>string</i> extensionList, <i>boolean</i> allowMultiple)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>String</i> windowTitle, <i>String</i> initialFolder, <i>String</i> initialFile, <i>String</i> extensionList, <i>Boolean</i> allowMultiple, <i>String</i> fileNamesOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> fileNamesOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_Dialog_BrowseForOpenFiles(windowTitle, initialFolder, initialFile, extensionList, allowMultiple, fileNamesOutNeedBig, fileNamesOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
If allowMultiple is true, multiple files may be selected. The returned string is \0-separated, with the first substring containing the folder path and subsequent substrings containing the file names.<br>
 * On macOS, the first substring may be empty, and each file name will then contain its entire path.<br>
 * This function only allows selection of existing files, and does not allow creation of new files.<br>
<br>
extensionList is a string containing pairs of \0-terminated substrings. The last substring must be terminated by two \0 characters. Each pair defines one filter pattern:<br>
 * The first substring in each pair describes the filter in user-readable form (for example, "Lua script files (*.lua)") and will be displayed in the dialog box.<br>
 * The second substring specifies the filter that the operating system must use to search for the files (for example, "*.txt"; the wildcard should not be omitted). To specify multiple extensions for a single display string, use a semicolon to separate the patterns (for example, "*.lua;*.eel").<br>
<br>
An example of an extensionList string:<br>
"ReaScript files\0*.lua;*.eel\0Lua files (.lua)\0*.lua\0EEL files (.eel)\0*.eel\0\0".<br>
<br>
On macOS, file dialogs do not accept empty extensionLists, nor wildcard extensions (such as "All files\0*.*\0\0"), so each acceptable extension must be listed explicitly. On Linux and Windows, wildcard extensions are acceptable, and if the extensionList string is empty, the dialog will display a default "All files (*.*)" filter.<br>
<br>
retval is 1 if one or more files were selected, 0 if the user cancelled the dialog, or negative if an error occurred.<br>
<br>
Displaying \0-separated strings:<br>
 * REAPER's IDE and ShowConsoleMsg only display strings up to the first \0 byte. If multiple files were selected, only the first substring containing the path will be displayed. This is not a problem for Lua or EEL, which can access the full string beyond the first \0 byte as usual.<br><br>

<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>string </i>fileName = reaper.JS_Dialog_BrowseForSaveFile(<i>string</i> windowTitle, <i>string</i> initialFolder, <i>string</i> initialFile, <i>string</i> extensionList)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>String</i> windowTitle, <i>String</i> initialFolder, <i>String</i> initialFile, <i>String</i> extensionList, <i>String</i> fileNameOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> fileNameOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_Dialog_BrowseForSaveFile(windowTitle, initialFolder, initialFile, extensionList, fileNameOutNeedBig, fileNameOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
retval is 1 if a file was selected, 0 if the user cancelled the dialog, or negative if an error occurred.<br>

extensionList is as described for JS_Dialog_BrowseForOpenFiles.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Double"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Double(void* pointer, int offset, double* doubleOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Double(<i>void*</i> pointer, <i>int </i>offset, <i>&amp;</i>double) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

Returns the 8-byte floating point value at address[offset]. Offset is added as steps of 8 bytes each.<br><br>
<a name="JS_File_Stat"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_File_Stat(const char* filePath, double* sizeOut, char* accessedTimeOut, char* modifiedTimeOut, char* cTimeOut, int* deviceIDOut, int* deviceSpecialIDOut, int* inodeOut, int* modeOut, int* numLinksOut, int* ownerUserIDOut, int* ownerGroupIDOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_File_Stat("filePath", <i>&amp;</i>size, #accessedTime, #modifiedTime, #cTime, <i>int &amp;</i>deviceID, <i>int &amp;</i>deviceSpecialID, <i>int &amp;</i>inode, <i>int &amp;</i>mode, <i>int &amp;</i>numLinks, <i>int &amp;</i>ownerUserID, <i>int &amp;</i>ownerGroupID) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_File_Stat", "filePath", <i>&amp;</i>size, #accessedTime, #modifiedTime, #cTime, <i>int &amp;</i>deviceID, <i>int &amp;</i>deviceSpecialID, <i>int &amp;</i>inode, <i>int &amp;</i>mode, <i>int &amp;</i>numLinks, <i>int &amp;</i>ownerUserID, <i>int &amp;</i>ownerGroupID) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>number </i>size, <i>string </i>accessedTime, <i>string </i>modifiedTime, <i>string </i>cTime, <i>integer </i>deviceID, <i>integer </i>deviceSpecialID, <i>integer </i>inode, <i>integer </i>mode, <i>integer </i>numLinks, <i>integer </i>ownerUserID, <i>integer </i>ownerGroupID = reaper.JS_File_Stat(<i>string</i> filePath)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>String</i> filePath, <i>Float</i> sizeOut, <i>String</i> accessedTimeOut, <i>String</i> modifiedTimeOut, <i>String</i> cTimeOut, <i>Int</i> deviceIDOut, <i>Int</i> deviceSpecialIDOut, <i>Int</i> inodeOut, <i>Int</i> modeOut, <i>Int</i> numLinksOut, <i>Int</i> ownerUserIDOut, <i>Int</i> ownerGroupIDOut) = JS_File_Stat(filePath, sizeOut, accessedTimeOut, modifiedTimeOut, cTimeOut, deviceIDOut, deviceSpecialIDOut, inodeOut, modeOut, numLinksOut, ownerUserIDOut, ownerGroupIDOut)</code><br><br></div>
Returns information about a file.<br>
<br>
cTime is not implemented on all systems. If it does return a time, the value may differ depending on the OS: on WindowsOS, it may refer to the time that the file was either created or copied, whereas on Linux and macOS, it may refer to the time of last status change.<br>
<br>
retval is 0 if successful, negative if not.<br><br>
<a name="JS_GDI_Blit"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_GDI_Blit(void* destHDC, int dstx, int dsty, void* sourceHDC, int srcx, int srxy, int width, int height, const char* modeOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_GDI_Blit(<i>void*</i> destHDC, <i>int </i>dstx, <i>int </i>dsty, <i>void*</i> sourceHDC, <i>int </i>srcx, <i>int </i>srxy, <i>int </i>width, <i>int </i>height, <i>optional </i>"mode") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_GDI_Blit", <i>void*</i> destHDC, <i>int </i>dstx, <i>int </i>dsty, <i>void*</i> sourceHDC, <i>int </i>srcx, <i>int </i>srxy, <i>int </i>width, <i>int </i>height, <i>optional </i>"mode") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_GDI_Blit(<i>identifier</i> destHDC, <i>integer</i> dstx, <i>integer</i> dsty, <i>identifier</i> sourceHDC, <i>integer</i> srcx, <i>integer</i> srxy, <i>integer</i> width, <i>integer</i> height, <i>optional </i><i>string</i> mode)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_GDI_Blit(<i>void</i> destHDC, <i>Int</i> dstx, <i>Int</i> dsty, <i>void</i> sourceHDC, <i>Int</i> srcx, <i>Int</i> srxy, <i>Int</i> width, <i>Int</i> height, <i>String</i> modeOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Blits between two device contexts, which may include LICE "system bitmaps".<br>
<br>
mode: Optional parameter. "SRCCOPY" by default, or specify "ALPHA" to enable per-pixel alpha blending.<br>
<br>
WARNING: On WindowsOS, GDI_Blit does not perform alpha multiplication of the source bitmap. For proper color rendering, a separate pre-multiplication step is therefore required, using either LICE_Blit or LICE_ProcessRect.<br><br>
<a name="JS_GDI_CreateFillBrush"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_GDI_CreateFillBrush(int color)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_GDI_CreateFillBrush(<i>int </i>color) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_GDI_CreateFillBrush", <i>int </i>color) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_GDI_CreateFillBrush(<i>integer</i> color)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_GDI_CreateFillBrush(<i>Int</i> color)</code><br><br></div>
<a name="JS_GDI_CreateFont"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_GDI_CreateFont(int height, int weight, int angle, bool italic, bool underline, bool strikeOut, const char* fontName)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_GDI_CreateFont(<i>int </i>height, <i>int </i>weight, <i>int </i>angle, <i>bool </i>italic, <i>bool </i>underline, <i>bool </i>strike, "fontName") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_GDI_CreateFont", <i>int </i>height, <i>int </i>weight, <i>int </i>angle, <i>bool </i>italic, <i>bool </i>underline, <i>bool </i>strike, "fontName") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_GDI_CreateFont(<i>integer</i> height, <i>integer</i> weight, <i>integer</i> angle, <i>boolean</i> italic, <i>boolean</i> underline, <i>boolean</i> strike, <i>string</i> fontName)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_GDI_CreateFont(<i>Int</i> height, <i>Int</i> weight, <i>Int</i> angle, <i>Boolean</i> italic, <i>Boolean</i> underline, <i>Boolean</i> strikeOut, <i>String</i> fontName)</code><br><br></div>
Parameters:<br>
 * weight: 0 - 1000, with 0 = auto, 400 = normal and 700 = bold.<br>
 * angle: the angle, in tenths of degrees, between the text and the x-axis of the device.<br>
 * fontName: If empty string "", uses first font that matches the other specified attributes.<br>
<br>
Note: Text color must be set separately.<br><br>

<a name="JS_GDI_ReleaseDC"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_GDI_ReleaseDC(void* deviceHDC, void*  windowHWNDOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_GDI_ReleaseDC(<i>void*</i> deviceHDC, <i>void*</i>  windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_GDI_ReleaseDC", <i>void*</i> deviceHDC, <i>void*</i>  windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_GDI_ReleaseDC(<i>identifier</i> deviceHDC, <i>identifier</i>  windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_GDI_ReleaseDC(<i>void</i> deviceHDC, <i>void</i>  windowHWNDOptional)</code><br><br></div>
To release a window HDC, both arguments must be supplied: the HWND as well as the HDC.  To release a screen DC, only the HDC needs to be supplied.  <br>
<br>
For compatibility with previous versions, the HWND and HDC can be supplied in any order.<br>
<br>
NOTE: Any GDI HDC should be released immediately after drawing, and deferred scripts should get and release new DCs in each cycle.<br><br>
<a name="JS_GDI_SelectObject"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_GDI_SelectObject(void* deviceHDC, void* GDIObject)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_GDI_SelectObject(<i>void*</i> deviceHDC, <i>void*</i> GDIObject) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_GDI_SelectObject", <i>void*</i> deviceHDC, <i>void*</i> GDIObject) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_GDI_SelectObject(<i>identifier</i> deviceHDC, <i>identifier</i> GDIObject)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_GDI_SelectObject(<i>void</i> deviceHDC, <i>void</i> GDIObject)</code><br><br></div>
Activates a font, pen, or fill brush for subsequent drawing in the specified device context.<br><br>
<a name="JS_GDI_SetPixel"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_GDI_SetPixel(void* deviceHDC, int x, int y, int color)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_GDI_SetPixel(<i>void*</i> deviceHDC, <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, <i>int </i>color) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<a name="JS_GDI_StretchBlit"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_GDI_StretchBlit(void* destHDC, int dstx, int dsty, int dstw, int dsth, void* sourceHDC, int srcx, int srxy, int srcw, int srch, const char* modeOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_GDI_StretchBlit(<i>void*</i> destHDC, <i>int </i>dstx, <i>int </i>dsty, <i>int </i>dstw, <i>int </i>dsth, <i>void*</i> sourceHDC, <i>int </i>srcx, <i>int </i>srxy, <i>int </i>srcw, <i>int </i>srch, <i>optional </i>"mode") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_GDI_StretchBlit", <i>void*</i> destHDC, <i>int </i>dstx, <i>int </i>dsty, <i>int </i>dstw, <i>int </i>dsth, <i>void*</i> sourceHDC, <i>int </i>srcx, <i>int </i>srxy, <i>int </i>srcw, <i>int </i>srch, <i>optional </i>"mode") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_GDI_StretchBlit(<i>identifier</i> destHDC, <i>integer</i> dstx, <i>integer</i> dsty, <i>integer</i> dstw, <i>integer</i> dsth, <i>identifier</i> sourceHDC, <i>integer</i> srcx, <i>integer</i> srxy, <i>integer</i> srcw, <i>integer</i> srch, <i>optional </i><i>string</i> mode)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_GDI_StretchBlit(<i>void</i> destHDC, <i>Int</i> dstx, <i>Int</i> dsty, <i>Int</i> dstw, <i>Int</i> dsth, <i>void</i> sourceHDC, <i>Int</i> srcx, <i>Int</i> srxy, <i>Int</i> srcw, <i>Int</i> srch, <i>String</i> modeOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Blits between two device contexts, which may include LICE "system bitmaps".<br>
<br>
modeOptional: "SRCCOPY" by default, or specify "ALPHA" to enable per-pixel alpha blending.<br>
<br>
WARNING: On WindowsOS, GDI_Blit does not perform alpha multiplication of the source bitmap. For proper color rendering, a separate pre-multiplication step is therefore required, using either LICE_Blit or LICE_ProcessRect.<br><br>

<a name="JS_Int"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Int(void* pointer, int offset, int* intOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Int(<i>void*</i> pointer, <i>int </i>offset, <i>int &amp;</i>int) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Int", <i>void*</i> pointer, <i>int </i>offset, <i>int &amp;</i>int) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer </i>int = reaper.JS_Int(<i>identifier</i> pointer, <i>integer</i> offset)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> pointer, <i>Int</i> offset, <i>Int</i> intOut) = JS_Int(pointer, offset, intOut)</code><br><br></div>
Returns the 4-byte signed integer at address[offset]. Offset is added as steps of 4 bytes each.<br><br>
<a name="JS_LICE_AlterBitmapHSV"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_AlterBitmapHSV(void* bitmap, double hue, double saturation, double value)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_AlterBitmapHSV(<i>void*</i> bitmap, hue, saturation, value) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_LICE_AlterBitmapHSV", <i>void*</i> bitmap, hue, saturation, value) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_LICE_AlterBitmapHSV(<i>identifier</i> bitmap, <i>number</i> hue, <i>number</i> saturation, <i>number</i> value)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_AlterBitmapHSV(<i>void</i> bitmap, <i>Float</i> hue, <i>Float</i> saturation, <i>Float</i> value)</code><br><br></div>
Hue is rolled over, saturation and value are clamped, all 0..1. (Alpha remains unchanged.)<br><br>
<a name="JS_LICE_AlterRectHSV"><hr></a><br>

Hue is rolled over, saturation and value are clamped, all 0..1. (Alpha remains unchanged.)<br><br>
<a name="JS_LICE_Arc"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_Arc(void* bitmap, double cx, double cy, double r, double minAngle, double maxAngle, int color, double alpha, const char* mode, bool antialias)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_Arc(<i>void*</i> bitmap, cx, cy, r, minAngle, maxAngle, <i>int </i>color, alpha, "mode", <i>bool </i>antialias) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_LICE_Arc", <i>void*</i> bitmap, cx, cy, r, minAngle, maxAngle, <i>int </i>color, alpha, "mode", <i>bool </i>antialias) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_LICE_Arc(<i>identifier</i> bitmap, <i>number</i> cx, <i>number</i> cy, <i>number</i> r, <i>number</i> minAngle, <i>number</i> maxAngle, <i>integer</i> color, <i>number</i> alpha, <i>string</i> mode, <i>boolean</i> antialias)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_Arc(<i>void</i> bitmap, <i>Float</i> cx, <i>Float</i> cy, <i>Float</i> r, <i>Float</i> minAngle, <i>Float</i> maxAngle, <i>Int</i> color, <i>Float</i> alpha, <i>String</i> mode, <i>Boolean</i> antialias)</code><br><br></div>
LICE modes: "COPY" (default if empty string), "MASK", "ADD", "DODGE", "MUL", "OVERLAY" or "HSVADJ", any of which may be combined with "ALPHA".<br>
<br>
LICE color format: 0xAARRGGBB (AA is only used in ALPHA mode).<br><br>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_Bezier(<i>void</i> bitmap, <i>Float</i> xstart, <i>Float</i> ystart, <i>Float</i> xctl1, <i>Float</i> yctl1, <i>Float</i> xctl2, <i>Float</i> yctl2, <i>Float</i> xend, <i>Float</i> yend, <i>Float</i> tol, <i>Int</i> color, <i>Float</i> alpha, <i>String</i> mode, <i>Boolean</i> antialias)</code><br><br></div>
LICE modes: "COPY" (default if empty string), "MASK", "ADD", "DODGE", "MUL", "OVERLAY" or "HSVADJ", any of which may be combined with "ALPHA" to enable per-pixel alpha blending.<br>
<br>
LICE color format: 0xAARRGGBB (AA is only used in ALPHA mode).<br><br>
<a name="JS_LICE_Blit"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_Blit(void* destBitmap, int dstx, int dsty, void* sourceBitmap, int srcx, int srcy, int width, int height, double alpha, const char* mode)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_Blit(<i>void*</i> destBitmap, <i>int </i>dstx, <i>int </i>dsty, <i>void*</i> sourceBitmap, <i>int </i>srcx, <i>int </i>srcy, <i>int </i>width, <i>int </i>height, alpha, "mode") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_LICE_Blit", <i>void*</i> destBitmap, <i>int </i>dstx, <i>int </i>dsty, <i>void*</i> sourceBitmap, <i>int </i>srcx, <i>int </i>srcy, <i>int </i>width, <i>int </i>height, alpha, "mode") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_LICE_Blit(<i>identifier</i> destBitmap, <i>integer</i> dstx, <i>integer</i> dsty, <i>identifier</i> sourceBitmap, <i>integer</i> srcx, <i>integer</i> srcy, <i>integer</i> width, <i>integer</i> height, <i>number</i> alpha, <i>string</i> mode)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_Blit(<i>void</i> destBitmap, <i>Int</i> dstx, <i>Int</i> dsty, <i>void</i> sourceBitmap, <i>Int</i> srcx, <i>Int</i> srcy, <i>Int</i> width, <i>Int</i> height, <i>Float</i> alpha, <i>String</i> mode)</code><br><br></div>
Standard LICE modes: "COPY" (default if empty string), "MASK", "ADD", "DODGE", "MUL", "OVERLAY" or "HSVADJ", any of which may be combined with "ALPHA" to enable per-pixel alpha blending.<br>
<br>
In addition to the standard LICE modes, LICE_Blit also offers:<br>
 * "CHANCOPY_XTOY", with X and Y any of the four channels, A, R, G or B. (CHANCOPY_ATOA is similar to MASK mode.)<br>
 * "BLUR"<br>
 * "ALPHAMUL", which overwrites the destination with a per-pixel alpha-multiplied copy of the source. (Similar to first clearing the destination with 0x00000000 and then blitting with "COPY,ALPHA".)<br><br>
<a name="JS_LICE_Circle"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_Circle(void* bitmap, double cx, double cy, double r, int color, double alpha, const char* mode, bool antialias)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_Circle(<i>void*</i> bitmap, cx, cy, r, <i>int </i>color, alpha, "mode", <i>bool </i>antialias) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_LICE_Circle", <i>void*</i> bitmap, cx, cy, r, <i>int </i>color, alpha, "mode", <i>bool </i>antialias) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_LICE_Circle(<i>identifier</i> bitmap, <i>number</i> cx, <i>number</i> cy, <i>number</i> r, <i>integer</i> color, <i>number</i> alpha, <i>string</i> mode, <i>boolean</i> antialias)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_Circle(<i>void</i> bitmap, <i>Float</i> cx, <i>Float</i> cy, <i>Float</i> r, <i>Int</i> color, <i>Float</i> alpha, <i>String</i> mode, <i>Boolean</i> antialias)</code><br><br></div>
LICE modes: "COPY" (default if empty string), "MASK", "ADD", "DODGE", "MUL", "OVERLAY" or "HSVADJ", any of which may be combined with "ALPHA".<br>
<br>
LICE color format: 0xAARRGGBB (AA is only used in ALPHA mode).<br><br>
<a name="JS_LICE_Clear"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_Clear(void* bitmap, int color)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_Clear(<i>void*</i> bitmap, <i>int </i>color) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<a name="JS_LICE_CreateBitmap"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_LICE_CreateBitmap(bool isSysBitmap, int width, int height)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_LICE_CreateBitmap(<i>bool </i>isSysBitmap, <i>int </i>width, <i>int </i>height) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_FillCircle(<i>void*</i> bitmap, cx, cy, r, <i>int </i>color, alpha, "mode", <i>bool </i>antialias) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_LICE_FillCircle", <i>void*</i> bitmap, cx, cy, r, <i>int </i>color, alpha, "mode", <i>bool </i>antialias) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_LICE_FillCircle(<i>identifier</i> bitmap, <i>number</i> cx, <i>number</i> cy, <i>number</i> r, <i>integer</i> color, <i>number</i> alpha, <i>string</i> mode, <i>boolean</i> antialias)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_FillCircle(<i>void</i> bitmap, <i>Float</i> cx, <i>Float</i> cy, <i>Float</i> r, <i>Int</i> color, <i>Float</i> alpha, <i>String</i> mode, <i>Boolean</i> antialias)</code><br><br></div>
LICE modes: "COPY" (default if empty string), "MASK", "ADD", "DODGE", "MUL", "OVERLAY" or "HSVADJ", any of which may be combined with "ALPHA".<br>
<br>
LICE color format: 0xAARRGGBB (AA is only used in ALPHA mode).<br><br>
<a name="JS_LICE_FillPolygon"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_FillPolygon(void* bitmap, const char* packedX, const char* packedY, int numPoints, int color, double alpha, const char* mode)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_FillPolygon(<i>void*</i> bitmap, "packedX", "packedY", <i>int </i>numPoints, <i>int </i>color, alpha, "mode") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_LICE_FillPolygon", <i>void*</i> bitmap, "packedX", "packedY", <i>int </i>numPoints, <i>int </i>color, alpha, "mode") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_LICE_FillPolygon(<i>identifier</i> bitmap, <i>string</i> packedX, <i>string</i> packedY, <i>integer</i> numPoints, <i>integer</i> color, <i>number</i> alpha, <i>string</i> mode)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_FillPolygon(<i>void</i> bitmap, <i>String</i> packedX, <i>String</i> packedY, <i>Int</i> numPoints, <i>Int</i> color, <i>Float</i> alpha, <i>String</i> mode)</code><br><br></div>
packedX and packedY are two strings of coordinates, each packed as "&lt;i4".<br>
<br>
LICE modes : "COPY" (default if empty string), "MASK", "ADD", "DODGE", "MUL", "OVERLAY" or "HSVADJ", any of which may be combined with "ALPHA" to enable per-pixel alpha blending.<br>
<br>
LICE color format: 0xAARRGGBB (AA is only used in ALPHA mode).<br><br>

<a name="JS_LICE_Line"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_Line(void* bitmap, double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, int color, double alpha, const char* mode, bool antialias)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_Line(<i>void*</i> bitmap, x1, y1, x2, y2, <i>int </i>color, alpha, "mode", <i>bool </i>antialias) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_LICE_Line", <i>void*</i> bitmap, x1, y1, x2, y2, <i>int </i>color, alpha, "mode", <i>bool </i>antialias) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_LICE_Line(<i>identifier</i> bitmap, <i>number</i> x1, <i>number</i> y1, <i>number</i> x2, <i>number</i> y2, <i>integer</i> color, <i>number</i> alpha, <i>string</i> mode, <i>boolean</i> antialias)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_Line(<i>void</i> bitmap, <i>Float</i> x1, <i>Float</i> y1, <i>Float</i> x2, <i>Float</i> y2, <i>Int</i> color, <i>Float</i> alpha, <i>String</i> mode, <i>Boolean</i> antialias)</code><br><br></div>
LICE modes: "COPY" (default if empty string), "MASK", "ADD", "DODGE", "MUL", "OVERLAY" or "HSVADJ", any of which may be combined with "ALPHA".<br>
<br>
LICE color format: 0xAARRGGBB (AA is only used in ALPHA mode).<br><br>

<a name="JS_LICE_ProcessRect"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_LICE_ProcessRect(void* bitmap, int x, int y, int w, int h, const char* mode, double operand)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_LICE_ProcessRect(<i>void*</i> bitmap, <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, <i>int </i>w, <i>int </i>h, "mode", operand) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_LICE_ProcessRect", <i>void*</i> bitmap, <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, <i>int </i>w, <i>int </i>h, "mode", operand) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.JS_LICE_ProcessRect(<i>identifier</i> bitmap, <i>integer</i> x, <i>integer</i> y, <i>integer</i> w, <i>integer</i> h, <i>string</i> mode, <i>number</i> operand)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  JS_LICE_ProcessRect(<i>void</i> bitmap, <i>Int</i> x, <i>Int</i> y, <i>Int</i> w, <i>Int</i> h, <i>String</i> mode, <i>Float</i> operand)</code><br><br></div>
Applies bitwise operations to each pixel in the target rectangle.<br>
<br>
operand: a color in 0xAARRGGBB format.<br>
<br>
modes:<br>
 * "XOR", "OR" or "AND".<br>
 * "SET_XYZ", with XYZ any combination of A, R, G, and B: copies the specified channels from operand to the bitmap. (Useful for setting the alpha values of a bitmap.)<br>
 * "ALPHAMUL": Performs alpha pre-multiplication on each pixel in the rect. operand is ignored in this mode. (On WindowsOS, GDI_Blit does not perform alpha multiplication on the fly, and a separate alpha pre-multiplication step is therefore required.)<br>
<br>
NOTE:<br>
LICE_Blit and LICE_ScaledBlit are also useful for processing bitmap colors. For example, to multiply all channel values by 1.5:<br>
reaper.JS_LICE_Blit(bitmap, x, y, bitmap, x, y, w, h, 0.5, "ADD").<br><br>
<a name="JS_LICE_PutPixel"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_PutPixel(void* bitmap, int x, int y, double color, double alpha, const char* mode)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_PutPixel(<i>void*</i> bitmap, <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, color, alpha, "mode") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_LICE_PutPixel", <i>void*</i> bitmap, <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, color, alpha, "mode") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_LICE_PutPixel(<i>identifier</i> bitmap, <i>integer</i> x, <i>integer</i> y, <i>number</i> color, <i>number</i> alpha, <i>string</i> mode)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_PutPixel(<i>void</i> bitmap, <i>Int</i> x, <i>Int</i> y, <i>Float</i> color, <i>Float</i> alpha, <i>String</i> mode)</code><br><br></div>
LICE modes: "COPY" (default if empty string), "MASK", "ADD", "DODGE", "MUL", "OVERLAY" or "HSVADJ", any of which may be combined with "ALPHA".<br>
<br>
LICE color format: 0xAARRGGBB (AA is only used in ALPHA mode).<br><br>

<a name="JS_LICE_SetAlphaFromColorMask"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_SetAlphaFromColorMask(void* bitmap, int colorRGB)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_SetAlphaFromColorMask(<i>void*</i> bitmap, <i>int </i>colorRGB) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_LICE_SetAlphaFromColorMask", <i>void*</i> bitmap, <i>int </i>colorRGB) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_LICE_SetAlphaFromColorMask(<i>identifier</i> bitmap, <i>integer</i> colorRGB)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_SetAlphaFromColorMask(<i>void</i> bitmap, <i>Int</i> colorRGB)</code><br><br></div>
Sets all pixels that match the given color's RGB values to fully transparent, and all other pixels to fully opaque.  (All pixels' RGB values remain unchanged.)<br><br>
<a name="JS_LICE_SetFontBkColor"><hr></a><br>

<a name="JS_LICE_SetFontColor"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_SetFontColor(void* LICEFont, int color)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_SetFontColor(<i>void*</i> LICEFont, <i>int </i>color) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<a name="JS_LICE_SetFontFromGDI"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_LICE_SetFontFromGDI(void* LICEFont, void* GDIFont, const char* moreFormats)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_LICE_SetFontFromGDI(<i>void*</i> LICEFont, <i>void*</i> GDIFont, "moreFormats") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_LICE_SetFontFromGDI", <i>void*</i> LICEFont, <i>void*</i> GDIFont, "moreFormats") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_LICE_SetFontFromGDI(<i>identifier</i> LICEFont, <i>identifier</i> GDIFont, <i>string</i> moreFormats)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_LICE_SetFontFromGDI(<i>void</i> LICEFont, <i>void</i> GDIFont, <i>String</i> moreFormats)</code><br><br></div>
Converts a GDI font into a LICE font.<br>
<br>
The font can be modified by the following flags, in a comma-separated list:<br>
"VERTICAL", "BOTTOMUP", "NATIVE", "BLUR", "INVERT", "MONO", "SHADOW" or "OUTLINE".<br><br>

Parameters:<br>
<br>
 * quality is an integer in the range 1..100.<br>
 * forceBaseline is an optional boolean parameter that ensures compatibility with all JPEG viewers by preventing too low quality, "cubist" settings.<br><br>

<a name="JS_ListView_GetItemState"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_ListView_GetItemState(void* listviewHWND, int index)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_ListView_GetItemState(<i>void*</i> listviewHWND, <i>int </i>index) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_ListView_GetItemState", <i>void*</i> listviewHWND, <i>int </i>index) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_ListView_GetItemState(<i>identifier</i> listviewHWND, <i>integer</i> index)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_ListView_GetItemState(<i>void</i> listviewHWND, <i>Int</i> index)</code><br><br></div>
State is a bitmask:<br>
1 = focused, 2 = selected. On Windows only, cut-and-paste marked = 4, drag-and-drop highlighted = 8.<br>
<br>
Warning: this function uses the Win32 bitmask values, which differ from the values used by WDL/swell.<br><br>
