<a name="JS_ListView_ListAllSelItems"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_ListView_ListAllSelItems(void* listviewHWND, char* itemsOutNeedBig, int itemsOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_ListView_ListAllSelItems(<i>void*</i> listviewHWND, #items) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_ListView_ListAllSelItems", <i>void*</i> listviewHWND, #items) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>string </i>items = reaper.JS_ListView_ListAllSelItems(<i>identifier</i> listviewHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>void</i> listviewHWND, <i>String</i> itemsOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> itemsOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_ListView_ListAllSelItems(listviewHWND, itemsOutNeedBig, itemsOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Returns the indices of all selected items as a comma-separated list.<br>
<br>
 * retval: Number of selected items found; negative or zero if an error occured.<br><br>
<a name="JS_ListView_SetItemState"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_ListView_SetItemState(void* listviewHWND, int index, int state, int mask)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_ListView_SetItemState(<i>void*</i> listviewHWND, <i>int </i>index, <i>int </i>state, <i>int </i>mask) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_ListView_SetItemState", <i>void*</i> listviewHWND, <i>int </i>index, <i>int </i>state, <i>int </i>mask) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_ListView_SetItemState(<i>identifier</i> listviewHWND, <i>integer</i> index, <i>integer</i> state, <i>integer</i> mask)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_ListView_SetItemState(<i>void</i> listviewHWND, <i>Int</i> index, <i>Int</i> state, <i>Int</i> mask)</code><br><br></div>
The mask parameter specifies the state bits that must be set, and the state parameter specifies the new values for those bits.<br>
<br>
1 = focused, 2 = selected. On Windows only, cut-and-paste marked = 4, drag-and-drop highlighted = 8.<br>
<br>
Warning: this function uses the Win32 bitmask values, which differ from the values used by WDL/swell.<br><br>
<a name="JS_ListView_SetItemText"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_ListView_SetItemText(void* listviewHWND, int index, int subItem, const char* text)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_ListView_SetItemText(<i>void*</i> listviewHWND, <i>int </i>index, <i>int </i>subItem, "text") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_ListView_SetItemText", <i>void*</i> listviewHWND, <i>int </i>index, <i>int </i>subItem, "text") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_ListView_SetItemText(<i>identifier</i> listviewHWND, <i>integer</i> index, <i>integer</i> subItem, <i>string</i> text)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_ListView_SetItemText(<i>void</i> listviewHWND, <i>Int</i> index, <i>Int</i> subItem, <i>String</i> text)</code><br><br></div>
Currently, this fuction only accepts ASCII text.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Localize"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Localize(const char* USEnglish, const char* LangPackSection, char* translationOut, int translationOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Localize("USEnglish", "LangPackSection", #translation) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Localize", "USEnglish", "LangPackSection", #translation) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>string </i>translation = reaper.JS_Localize(<i>string</i> USEnglish, <i>string</i> LangPackSection)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>String</i> USEnglish, <i>String</i> LangPackSection, <i>String</i> translationOut, <i>Int</i> translationOut_sz) = JS_Localize(USEnglish, LangPackSection, translationOut, translationOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Returns the translation of the given US English text, according to the currently loaded Language Pack.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * LangPackSection: Language Packs are divided into sections such as "common" or "DLG_102".<br>
 * In Lua, by default, text of up to 1024 chars can be returned. To increase (or reduce) the default buffer size, a string and size can be included as optional 3rd and 4th arguments.<br>
<br>
Example: reaper.JS_Localize("Actions", "common", "", 20)<br><br>
<a name="JS_MIDIEditor_ArrayAll"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_MIDIEditor_ArrayAll(void* reaperarray)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_MIDIEditor_ArrayAll(<i>void*</i> reaperarray) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_MIDIEditor_ArrayAll", <i>void*</i> reaperarray) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_MIDIEditor_ArrayAll(<i>identifier</i> reaperarray)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_MIDIEditor_ArrayAll(<i>void</i> reaperarray)</code><br><br></div>
Finds all open MIDI windows (whether docked or not).<br>
<br>
 * retval: The number of MIDI editor windows found; negative if an error occurred.<br>
<br>
 * The address of each MIDI editor window is stored in the provided reaper.array. Each address can be converted to a REAPER object (HWND) by the function JS_Window_HandleFromAddress.<br><br>
<a name="JS_MIDIEditor_ListAll"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_MIDIEditor_ListAll(char* listOutNeedBig, int listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_MIDIEditor_ListAll(#list) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_MIDIEditor_ListAll", #list) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>string </i>list = reaper.JS_MIDIEditor_ListAll()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>String</i> listOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> listOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_MIDIEditor_ListAll(listOutNeedBig, listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Finds all open MIDI windows (whether docked or not).<br>
<br>
 * retval: The number of MIDI editor windows found; negative if an error occurred.<br>
<br>
 * list: Comma-separated string of hexadecimal values. Each value is an address that can be converted to a HWND by the function Window_HandleFromAddress.<br><br>

<a name="JS_Mouse_GetCursor"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Mouse_GetCursor()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Mouse_GetCursor() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Mouse_GetCursor") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Mouse_GetCursor()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Mouse_GetCursor()</code><br><br></div>
On Windows, retrieves a handle to the current mouse cursor.<br>
On Linux and macOS, retrieves a handle to the last cursor set by REAPER or its extensions via SWELL.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Mouse_GetState"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Mouse_GetState(int flags)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Mouse_GetState(<i>int </i>flags) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Mouse_GetState", <i>int </i>flags) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_Mouse_GetState(<i>integer</i> flags)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_Mouse_GetState(<i>Int</i> flags)</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves the states of mouse buttons and modifiers keys.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * flags, state: The parameter and the return value both use the same format as gfx.mouse_cap. For example, to get the states of the left mouse button and the ctrl key, use flags = 0b00000101.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Mouse_LoadCursor"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Mouse_LoadCursor(int cursorNumber)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Mouse_LoadCursor(<i>int </i>cursorNumber) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Mouse_LoadCursor", <i>int </i>cursorNumber) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Mouse_LoadCursor(<i>integer</i> cursorNumber)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Mouse_LoadCursor(<i>Int</i> cursorNumber)</code><br><br></div>
Loads a cursor by number.<br>
<br>
cursorNumber: Same as used for gfx.setcursor, and includes some of Windows' predefined cursors (with numbers &gt; 32000; refer to documentation for the Win32 C++ function LoadCursor), and REAPER's own cursors (with numbers &lt; 2000).<br>
<br>
If successful, returns a handle to the cursor, which can be used in JS_Mouse_SetCursor.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Mouse_LoadCursorFromFile"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Mouse_LoadCursorFromFile(const char* pathAndFileName, bool* forceNewLoadOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Mouse_LoadCursorFromFile("pathAndFileName", <b>unsupported</b> forceNewLoadOptional) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Mouse_LoadCursorFromFile", "pathAndFileName", <b>unsupported</b> forceNewLoadOptional) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Mouse_LoadCursorFromFile(<i>string</i> pathAndFileName, <b>unsupported</b> forceNewLoad)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> retval, <i>String</i> pathAndFileName, <i>Boolean</i> forceNewLoadOptional) = JS_Mouse_LoadCursorFromFile(pathAndFileName, forceNewLoadOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Loads a cursor from a .cur file.<br>
<br>
forceNewLoad is an optional boolean parameter:<br>
 * If omitted or false, and if the cursor file has already been loaded previously during the REAPER session by any script, the file will not be re-loaded, and the existing handle will be returned.<br>
 * If true, the file will be re-loaded and a new handle will be returned.<br>
 * WARNING: Each time that a cursor file is re-loaded, the number of GDI objects increases for the entire duration of the REAPER session.<br>
<br>
If successful, returns a handle to the cursor, which can be used in JS_Mouse_SetCursor.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Mouse_SetCursor"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Mouse_SetCursor(void* cursorHandle)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Mouse_SetCursor(<i>void*</i> cursorHandle) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Mouse_SetCursor", <i>void*</i> cursorHandle) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_Mouse_SetCursor(<i>identifier</i> cursorHandle)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_Mouse_SetCursor(<i>void</i> cursorHandle)</code><br><br></div>
Sets the mouse cursor.  (Only lasts while script is running, and for a single "defer" cycle.)<br><br>
<a name="JS_Mouse_SetPosition"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Mouse_SetPosition(int x, int y)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Mouse_SetPosition(<i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Mouse_SetPosition", <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.JS_Mouse_SetPosition(<i>integer</i> x, <i>integer</i> y)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  JS_Mouse_SetPosition(<i>Int</i> x, <i>Int</i> y)</code><br><br></div>
Moves the mouse cursor to the specified screen coordinates.<br>
<br>
NOTES:<br>
 * On Windows and Linux, screen coordinates are relative to *upper* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points downward.<br>
 * On macOS, screen coordinates are relative to the *bottom* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points upward.<br><br>
<a name="JS_ReaScriptAPI_Version"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_ReaScriptAPI_Version(double* versionOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_ReaScriptAPI_Version(<i>&amp;</i>version) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_ReaScriptAPI_Version", <i>&amp;</i>version) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number </i>version = reaper.JS_ReaScriptAPI_Version()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Float</i> versionOut) JS_ReaScriptAPI_Version(versionOut)</code><br><br></div>
Returns the version of the js_ReaScriptAPI extension.<br><br>
<a name="JS_String"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_String(void* pointer, int offset, int lengthChars, char* bufOutNeedBig, int bufOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_String(<i>void*</i> pointer, <i>int </i>offset, <i>int </i>lengthChars, #buf) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_String", <i>void*</i> pointer, <i>int </i>offset, <i>int </i>lengthChars, #buf) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>string </i>buf = reaper.JS_String(<i>identifier</i> pointer, <i>integer</i> offset, <i>integer</i> lengthChars)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>void</i> pointer, <i>Int</i> offset, <i>Int</i> lengthChars, <i>String</i> bufOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> bufOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_String(pointer, offset, lengthChars, bufOutNeedBig, bufOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Returns the memory contents starting at address[offset] as a packed string. Offset is added as steps of 1 byte (char) each.<br><br>
<a name="JS_VKeys_GetDown"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_VKeys_GetDown(double cutoffTime, char* stateOutNeedBig, int* stateOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_VKeys_GetDown(cutoffTime, #state) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_VKeys_GetDown", cutoffTime, #state) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>string </i>state = reaper.JS_VKeys_GetDown(<i>number</i> cutoffTime)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Float</i> cutoffTime, <i>String</i> stateOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> stateOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_VKeys_GetDown(cutoffTime, stateOutNeedBig, stateOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Returns a 255-byte array that specifies which virtual keys, from 0x01 to 0xFF, have sent KEYDOWN messages since cutoffTime.<br>
<br>
Notes:<br>
 * Mouse buttons and modifier keys are not (currently) reliably detected, and JS_Mouse_GetState can be used instead.<br>
 * Auto-repeated KEYDOWN messages are ignored.<br><br>
<a name="JS_VKeys_GetState"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_VKeys_GetState(double cutoffTime, char* stateOutNeedBig, int* stateOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_VKeys_GetState(cutoffTime, #state) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_VKeys_GetState", cutoffTime, #state) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>string </i>state = reaper.JS_VKeys_GetState(<i>number</i> cutoffTime)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Float</i> cutoffTime, <i>String</i> stateOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> stateOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_VKeys_GetState(cutoffTime, stateOutNeedBig, stateOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves the current states (0 or 1) of all virtual keys, from 0x01 to 0xFF, in a 255-byte array.<br>
<br>
cutoffTime: A key is only regarded as down if it sent a KEYDOWN message after the cut-off time, not followed by KEYUP. (This is useful for excluding old KEYDOWN messages that weren't properly followed by KEYUP.) <br>
If cutoffTime is positive, is it interpreted as absolute time in similar format as time_precise().<br>
If cutoffTime is negative, it is relative to the current time.<br>
<br>
Notes:<br>
 * Mouse buttons and modifier keys are not (currently) reliably detected, and JS_Mouse_GetState can be used instead.<br>
 * Auto-repeated KEYDOWN messages are ignored.<br><br>
<a name="JS_VKeys_GetUp"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_VKeys_GetUp(double cutoffTime, char* stateOutNeedBig, int* stateOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_VKeys_GetUp(cutoffTime, #state) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_VKeys_GetUp", cutoffTime, #state) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>string </i>state = reaper.JS_VKeys_GetUp(<i>number</i> cutoffTime)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Float</i> cutoffTime, <i>String</i> stateOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> stateOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_VKeys_GetUp(cutoffTime, stateOutNeedBig, stateOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Return a 255-byte array that specifies which virtual keys, from 0x01 to 0xFF, have sent KEYUP messages since cutoffTime.<br>
<br>
Note: Mouse buttons and modifier keys are not (currently) reliably detected, and JS_Mouse_GetState can be used instead.<br><br>
<a name="JS_VKeys_Intercept"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_VKeys_Intercept(int keyCode, int intercept)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_VKeys_Intercept(<i>int </i>keyCode, <i>int </i>intercept) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_VKeys_Intercept", <i>int </i>keyCode, <i>int </i>intercept) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_VKeys_Intercept(<i>integer</i> keyCode, <i>integer</i> intercept)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_VKeys_Intercept(<i>Int</i> keyCode, <i>Int</i> intercept)</code><br><br></div>
Intercepting (blocking) virtual keys work similar to the native function PreventUIRefresh:  Each key has a (non-negative) intercept state, and the key is passed through as usual if the state equals 0, or blocked if the state is greater than 0.<br>
<br>
keyCode: The virtual key code of the key, or -1 to change the state of all keys.<br>
<br>
intercept: A script can increase the intercept state by passing +1, or lower the state by passing -1.  Multiple scripts can block the same key, and the intercept state may reach up to 255. If zero is passed, the intercept state is not changed, but the current state is returned.<br>
<br>
Returns: If keyCode refers to a single key, the intercept state of that key is returned.  If keyCode = -1, the state of the key that is most strongly blocked (highest intercept state) is returned.<br><br>
<a name="JS_WindowMessage_Intercept"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_WindowMessage_Intercept(void* windowHWND, const char* message, bool passThrough)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_WindowMessage_Intercept(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "message", <i>bool </i>passThrough) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_WindowMessage_Intercept", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "message", <i>bool </i>passThrough) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_WindowMessage_Intercept(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> message, <i>boolean</i> passThrough)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_WindowMessage_Intercept(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> message, <i>Boolean</i> passThrough)</code><br><br></div>
Begins intercepting a window message type to specified window.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * message: a single message type to be intercepted, either in WM_ or hexadecimal format. For example "WM_SETCURSOR" or "0x0020".<br>
 * passThrough: Whether message should be blocked (false) or passed through (true) to the window.<br>
    For more information on message codes, refer to the Win32 C++ API documentation.<br>
    All WM_ and CB_ message types listed in swell-types.h should be valid cross-platform, and the function can recognize all of these by name. Other messages can be specified by their hex code.<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
 * 1: Success.<br>
 * 0: The message type is already being intercepted by another script.<br>
 * -2: message string could not be parsed.<br>
 * -3: Failure getting original window process / window not valid.<br>
 * -6: Could not obtain the window client HDC.<br>
<br>
Notes:<br>
 * Intercepted messages can be polled using JS_WindowMessage_Peek.<br>
 * Intercepted messages can be edited, if necessary, and then forwarded to their original destination using JS_WindowMessage_Post or JS_WindowMessage_Send.<br>
 * To check whether a message type is being blocked or passed through, Peek the message type, or retrieve the entire List of intercepts.<br>
 * Mouse events are typically received by the child window under the mouse, not the parent window.<br>
Keyboard events are usually *not* received by any individual window. To intercept keyboard events, use the VKey functions.<br><br>
<a name="JS_WindowMessage_InterceptList"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_WindowMessage_InterceptList(void* windowHWND, const char* messages)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_WindowMessage_InterceptList(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "messages") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_WindowMessage_InterceptList", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "messages") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_WindowMessage_InterceptList(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> messages)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_WindowMessage_InterceptList(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> messages)</code><br><br></div>
Begins intercepting window messages to specified window.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * messages: comma-separated string of message types to be intercepted (either in WM_ or hexadecimal format), each with a "block" or "passthrough" modifier to specify whether the message should be blocked or passed through to the window. For example "WM_SETCURSOR:block, 0x0201:passthrough".<br>
    For more information on message codes, refer to the Win32 C++ API documentation.<br>
    All WM_ and CB_ message types listed in swell-types.h should be valid cross-platform, and the function can recognize all of these by name. Other messages can be specified by their hex code.<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
 * 1: Success.<br>
 * 0: The message type is already being intercepted by another script.<br>
 * -1: windowHWND is not a valid window.<br>
 * -2: message string could not be parsed.<br>
 * -3: Failure getting original window process.<br>
 * -6: COuld not obtain the window client HDC.<br>
<br>
Notes:<br>
 * Intercepted messages can be polled using JS_WindowMessage_Peek.<br>
 * Intercepted messages can be edited, if necessary, and then forwarded to their original destination using JS_WindowMessage_Post or JS_WindowMessage_Send.<br>
 * To check whether a message type is being blocked or passed through, Peek the message type, or retrieve the entire List of intercepts.<br><br>
<a name="JS_WindowMessage_ListIntercepts"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_WindowMessage_ListIntercepts(void* windowHWND, char* listOutNeedBig, int listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_WindowMessage_ListIntercepts(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, #list) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_WindowMessage_ListIntercepts", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, #list) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>string </i>list = reaper.JS_WindowMessage_ListIntercepts(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> listOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> listOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_WindowMessage_ListIntercepts(windowHWND, listOutNeedBig, listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Returns a string with a list of all message types currently being intercepted for the specified window.<br><br>
<a name="JS_WindowMessage_PassThrough"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_WindowMessage_PassThrough(void* windowHWND, const char* message, bool passThrough)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_WindowMessage_PassThrough(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "message", <i>bool </i>passThrough) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_WindowMessage_PassThrough", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "message", <i>bool </i>passThrough) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_WindowMessage_PassThrough(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> message, <i>boolean</i> passThrough)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_WindowMessage_PassThrough(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> message, <i>Boolean</i> passThrough)</code><br><br></div>
Changes the passthrough setting of a message type that is already being intercepted.<br>
<br>
Returns 1 if successful, 0 if the message type is not yet being intercepted, or -2 if the argument could not be parsed.<br><br>
<a name="JS_WindowMessage_Peek"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_WindowMessage_Peek(void* windowHWND, const char* message, bool* passedThroughOut, double* timeOut, int* wParamLowOut, int* wParamHighOut, int* lParamLowOut, int* lParamHighOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_WindowMessage_Peek(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "message", <i>bool &amp;</i>passedThrough, <i>&amp;</i>time, <i>int &amp;</i>wParamLow, <i>int &amp;</i>wParamHigh, <i>int &amp;</i>lParamLow, <i>int &amp;</i>lParamHigh) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_WindowMessage_Peek", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "message", <i>bool &amp;</i>passedThrough, <i>&amp;</i>time, <i>int &amp;</i>wParamLow, <i>int &amp;</i>wParamHigh, <i>int &amp;</i>lParamLow, <i>int &amp;</i>lParamHigh) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>boolean </i>passedThrough, <i>number </i>time, <i>integer </i>wParamLow, <i>integer </i>wParamHigh, <i>integer </i>lParamLow, <i>integer </i>lParamHigh = reaper.JS_WindowMessage_Peek(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> message)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> message, <i>Boolean</i> passedThroughOut, <i>Float</i> timeOut, <i>Int</i> wParamLowOut, <i>Int</i> wParamHighOut, <i>Int</i> lParamLowOut, <i>Int</i> lParamHighOut) = JS_WindowMessage_Peek(windowHWND, message, passedThroughOut, timeOut, wParamLowOut, wParamHighOut, lParamLowOut, lParamHighOut)</code><br><br></div>
Polls the state of an intercepted message.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * message: String containing a single message name, such as "WM_SETCURSOR", or in hexadecimal format, "0x0020".<br>
 (For a list of WM_ and CB_ message types that are valid cross-platform, refer to swell-types.h. Only these will be recognized by WM_ or CB_ name.)<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
 * A retval of false indicates that the message type is not being intercepted in the specified window.<br>
 * All messages are timestamped. A time of 0 indicates that no message if this type has been intercepted yet.<br>
 * For more information about wParam and lParam for different message types, refer to Win32 C++ documentation.<br>
 * For example, in the case of mousewheel, returns mousewheel delta, modifier keys, x position and y position.<br>
 * wParamHigh, lParamLow and lParamHigh are signed, whereas wParamLow is unsigned.<br><br>
<a name="JS_WindowMessage_Post"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_WindowMessage_Post(void* windowHWND, const char* message, double wParam, int wParamHighWord, double lParam, int lParamHighWord)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_WindowMessage_Post(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "message", wParam, <i>int </i>wParamHighWord, lParam, <i>int </i>lParamHighWord) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_WindowMessage_Post", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "message", wParam, <i>int </i>wParamHighWord, lParam, <i>int </i>lParamHighWord) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.JS_WindowMessage_Post(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> message, <i>number</i> wParam, <i>integer</i> wParamHighWord, <i>number</i> lParam, <i>integer</i> lParamHighWord)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  JS_WindowMessage_Post(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> message, <i>Float</i> wParam, <i>Int</i> wParamHighWord, <i>Float</i> lParam, <i>Int</i> lParamHighWord)</code><br><br></div>
If the specified window and message type are not currently being intercepted by a script, this function will post the message in the message queue of the specified window, and return without waiting.<br>
<br>
If the window and message type are currently being intercepted, the message will be sent directly to the original window process, similar to WindowMessage_Send, thereby skipping any intercepts.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * message: String containing a single message name, such as "WM_SETCURSOR", or in hexadecimal format, "0x0020".<br>
 (For a list of WM_ and CB_ message types that are valid cross-platform, refer to swell-types.h. Only these will be recognized by WM_ or CB_ name.)<br>
 * wParam, wParamHigh, lParam and lParamHigh: Low and high 16-bit WORDs of the WPARAM and LPARAM parameters.<br>
(Most window messages encode separate information into the two WORDs. However, for those rare cases in which the entire WPARAM and LPARAM must be used to post a large pointer, the script can store this address in wParam or lParam, and keep wParamHigh and lParamHigh zero.)<br>
<br>
Notes:<br>
 * For more information about parameter values, refer to documentation for the Win32 C++ function PostMessage.<br>
 * Messages should only be sent to windows that were created from the main thread.<br>
 * Useful for simulating mouse clicks and calling mouse modifier actions from scripts.<br><br>
<a name="JS_WindowMessage_Release"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_WindowMessage_Release(void* windowHWND, const char* messages)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_WindowMessage_Release(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "messages") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_WindowMessage_Release", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "messages") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_WindowMessage_Release(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> messages)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_WindowMessage_Release(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> messages)</code><br><br></div>
Release intercepts of specified message types.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * messages: "WM_SETCURSOR,WM_MOUSEHWHEEL" or "0x0020,0x020E", for example.<br><br>
<a name="JS_WindowMessage_ReleaseAll"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_WindowMessage_ReleaseAll()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_WindowMessage_ReleaseAll() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_WindowMessage_ReleaseAll") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_WindowMessage_ReleaseAll()</code><br><br></div>

<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_WindowMessage_ReleaseWindow(void* windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_WindowMessage_ReleaseWindow(<i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_WindowMessage_ReleaseWindow", <i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

Release script intercepts of window messages for specified window.<br><br>
<a name="JS_WindowMessage_Send"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_WindowMessage_Send(void* windowHWND, const char* message, double wParam, int wParamHighWord, double lParam, int lParamHighWord)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_WindowMessage_Send(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "message", wParam, <i>int </i>wParamHighWord, lParam, <i>int </i>lParamHighWord) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_WindowMessage_Send", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "message", wParam, <i>int </i>wParamHighWord, lParam, <i>int </i>lParamHighWord) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_WindowMessage_Send(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> message, <i>number</i> wParam, <i>integer</i> wParamHighWord, <i>number</i> lParam, <i>integer</i> lParamHighWord)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_WindowMessage_Send(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> message, <i>Float</i> wParam, <i>Int</i> wParamHighWord, <i>Float</i> lParam, <i>Int</i> lParamHighWord)</code><br><br></div>
Sends a message to the specified window by calling the window process directly, and only returns after the message has been processed. Any intercepts of the message by scripts will be skipped, and the message can therefore not be blocked.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * message: String containing a single message name, such as "WM_SETCURSOR", or in hexadecimal format, "0x0020".<br>
 (For a list of WM_ and CB_ message types that are valid cross-platform, refer to swell-types.h. Only these will be recognized by WM_ or CB_ name.)<br>
 * wParam, wParamHigh, lParam and lParamHigh: Low and high 16-bit WORDs of the WPARAM and LPARAM parameters.<br>
(Most window messages encode separate information into the two WORDs. However, for those rare cases in which the entire WPARAM and LPARAM must be used to post a large pointer, the script can store this address in wParam or lParam, and keep wParamHigh and lParamHigh zero.)<br>
<br>
Notes:<br>
 * For more information about parameter and return values, refer to documentation for the Win32 C++ function SendMessage.<br>
 * Messages should only be sent to windows that were created from the main thread.<br>
 * Useful for simulating mouse clicks and calling mouse modifier actions from scripts.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_AddressFromHandle"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_AddressFromHandle(void* handle, double* addressOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_AddressFromHandle(<i>void*</i> handle, <i>&amp;</i>address) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_AddressFromHandle", <i>void*</i> handle, <i>&amp;</i>address) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number </i>address = reaper.JS_Window_AddressFromHandle(<i>identifier</i> handle)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> handle, <i>Float</i> addressOut) = JS_Window_AddressFromHandle(handle, addressOut)</code><br><br></div>
<a name="JS_Window_ArrayAllChild"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Window_ArrayAllChild(void* parentHWND, void* reaperarray)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Window_ArrayAllChild(<i>void*</i> parentHWND, <i>void*</i> reaperarray) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Window_ArrayAllChild", <i>void*</i> parentHWND, <i>void*</i> reaperarray) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_Window_ArrayAllChild(<i>identifier</i> parentHWND, <i>identifier</i> reaperarray)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_Window_ArrayAllChild(<i>void</i> parentHWND, <i>void</i> reaperarray)</code><br><br></div>
Finds all child windows of the specified parent.<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
 * retval: The number of windows found; negative if an error occurred.<br>
 * The addresses are stored in the provided reaper.array, and can be converted to REAPER objects (HWNDs) by the function JS_Window_HandleFromAddress.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_ArrayAllTop"><hr></a><br>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_Window_ArrayAllTop(<i>void</i> reaperarray)</code><br><br></div>
Finds all top-level windows.<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
 * retval: The number of windows found; negative if an error occurred.<br>
 * The addresses are stored in the provided reaper.array, and can be converted to REAPER objects (HWNDs) by the function JS_Window_HandleFromAddress.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_ArrayFind"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Window_ArrayFind(const char* title, bool exact, void* reaperarray)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Window_ArrayFind("title", <i>bool </i>exact, <i>void*</i> reaperarray) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Window_ArrayFind", "title", <i>bool </i>exact, <i>void*</i> reaperarray) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

Finds all windows, whether top-level or child, whose titles match the specified string.<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
 * retval: The number of windows found; negative if an error occurred.<br>
 * The addresses are stored in the provided reaper.array, and can be converted to REAPER objects (HWNDs) by the function JS_Window_HandleFromAddress.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * exact: Match entire title exactly, or match substring of title.<br><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_AttachTopmostPin(<i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_AttachTopmostPin", <i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

Attaches a "pin on top" button to the window frame. The button should remember its state when closing and re-opening the window.<br>
<br>
WARNING: This function does not yet work on Linux.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_ClientToScreen"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_ClientToScreen(void* windowHWND, int x, int y, int* xOut, int* yOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_ClientToScreen(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, <i>int &amp;</i>x, <i>int &amp;</i>y) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_ClientToScreen", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, <i>int &amp;</i>x, <i>int &amp;</i>y) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer </i>x, <i>integer </i>y = reaper.JS_Window_ClientToScreen(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>integer</i> x, <i>integer</i> y)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Int</i> x, <i>Int</i> y, <i>Int</i> xOut, <i>Int</i> yOut) = JS_Window_ClientToScreen(windowHWND, x, y, xOut, yOut)</code><br><br></div>
Converts the client-area coordinates of a specified point to screen coordinates.<br>
<br>
NOTES:<br>
 * On Windows and Linux, screen coordinates are relative to *upper* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points downward.<br>
 * On macOS, screen coordinates are relative to the *bottom* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points upward.<br>
 * On all platforms, client coordinates are relative to the upper left corner of the client area.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_Create"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_Create(const char* title, const char* className, int x, int y, int w, int h, char* styleOptional, void* ownerHWNDOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_Create("title", "className", <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, <i>int </i>w, <i>int </i>h, <i>optional </i>#style, <i>void*</i> ownerHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_Create", "title", "className", <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, <i>int </i>w, <i>int </i>h, <i>optional </i>#style, <i>void*</i> ownerHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> retval, <i>optional </i><i>string </i>style = reaper.JS_Window_Create(<i>string</i> title, <i>string</i> className, <i>integer</i> x, <i>integer</i> y, <i>integer</i> w, <i>integer</i> h, <i>optional </i><i>string </i>style, <i>identifier</i> ownerHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> retval, <i>String</i> title, <i>String</i> className, <i>Int</i> x, <i>Int</i> y, <i>Int</i> w, <i>Int</i> h, <i>String</i> styleOptional, <i>void</i> ownerHWNDOptional) = JS_Window_Create(title, className, x, y, w, h, styleOptional, ownerHWNDOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Creates a modeless window with WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW style and only rudimentary features. Scripts can paint into the window using GDI or LICE/Composite functions (and JS_Window_InvalidateRect to trigger re-painting).<br>
<br>
style: An optional parameter that overrides the default style. The string may include any combination of standard window styles, such as "POPUP" for a frameless window, or "CAPTION,SIZEBOX,SYSMENU" for a standard framed window.<br>
<br>
On Linux and macOS, "MAXIMIZE" has not yet been implemented, and the remaining styles may appear slightly different from their WindowsOS counterparts.<br>
<br>
className: On Windows, only standard ANSI characters are supported.<br>
<br>
ownerHWND: Optional parameter, only available on WindowsOS.  Usually either the REAPER main window or another script window, and useful for ensuring that the created window automatically closes when the owner is closed.<br>
<br>
NOTE: On Linux and macOS, the window contents are only updated *between* defer cycles, so the window cannot be animated by for/while loops within a single defer cycle.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_Destroy"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_Destroy(void* windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_Destroy(<i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_Destroy", <i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_Window_Destroy(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_Window_Destroy(<i>void</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
Destroys the specified window.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_Enable"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_Enable(void* windowHWND, bool enable)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_Enable(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>bool </i>enable) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_Enable", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>bool </i>enable) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_Window_Enable(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>boolean</i> enable)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_Window_Enable(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Boolean</i> enable)</code><br><br></div>
Enables or disables mouse and keyboard input to the specified window or control.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_EnableMetal"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Window_EnableMetal(void* windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Window_EnableMetal(<i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Window_EnableMetal", <i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_Window_EnableMetal(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_Window_EnableMetal(<i>void</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
On macOS, returns the Metal graphics setting:<br>
2 = Metal enabled and support GetDC()/ReleaseDC() for drawing (more overhead).<br>
1 = Metal enabled.<br>
0 = N/A (Windows and Linux).<br>
-1 = non-metal async layered mode.<br>
-2 = non-metal non-async layered mode.<br>
<br>
WARNING: If using mode -1, any BitBlt()/StretchBlt() MUST have the source bitmap persist. If it is resized after Blit it could cause crashes.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_Find"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_Find(const char* title, bool exact)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_Find("title", <i>bool </i>exact) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_Find", "title", <i>bool </i>exact) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Window_Find(<i>string</i> title, <i>boolean</i> exact)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_Find(<i>String</i> title, <i>Boolean</i> exact)</code><br><br></div>
Returns a HWND to a window whose title matches the specified string.<br>
 * Unlike the Win32 function FindWindow, this function searches top-level as well as child windows, so that the target window can be found irrespective of docked state.<br>
 * In addition, the function can optionally match substrings of the title.<br>
 * Matching is not case sensitive.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * exact: Match entire title, or match substring of title.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_FindChild"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_FindChild(void* parentHWND, const char* title, bool exact)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_FindChild(<i>void*</i> parentHWND, "title", <i>bool </i>exact) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_FindChild", <i>void*</i> parentHWND, "title", <i>bool </i>exact) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Window_FindChild(<i>identifier</i> parentHWND, <i>string</i> title, <i>boolean</i> exact)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_FindChild(<i>void</i> parentHWND, <i>String</i> title, <i>Boolean</i> exact)</code><br><br></div>
Returns a HWND to a child window whose title matches the specified string.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * exact: Match entire title length, or match substring of title. In both cases, matching is not case sensitive.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_FindChildByID"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_FindChildByID(void* parentHWND, int ID)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_FindChildByID(<i>void*</i> parentHWND, <i>int </i>ID) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_FindChildByID(<i>void</i> parentHWND, <i>Int</i> ID)</code><br><br></div>
Similar to the C++ WIN32 function GetDlgItem, this function finds child windows by ID.<br>
<br>
(The ID of a window may be retrieved by JS_Window_GetLongPtr.)<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_FindEx"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_FindEx(void* parentHWND, void* childHWND, const char* className, const char* title)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_FindEx(<i>void*</i> parentHWND, <i>void*</i> childHWND, "className", "title") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_FindEx", <i>void*</i> parentHWND, <i>void*</i> childHWND, "className", "title") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Window_FindEx(<i>identifier</i> parentHWND, <i>identifier</i> childHWND, <i>string</i> className, <i>string</i> title)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_FindEx(<i>void</i> parentHWND, <i>void</i> childHWND, <i>String</i> className, <i>String</i> title)</code><br><br></div>
Returns a handle to a child window whose class and title match the specified strings.<br>
<br>
Parameters: * childWindow: The function searches child windows, beginning with the window *after* the specified child window. If childHWND is equal to parentHWND, the search begins with the first child window of parentHWND.<br>
 * title: An empty string, "", will match all windows. (Search is not case sensitive.)<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_FindTop"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_FindTop(const char* title, bool exact)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_FindTop("title", <i>bool </i>exact) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_FindTop", "title", <i>bool </i>exact) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Window_FindTop(<i>string</i> title, <i>boolean</i> exact)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_FindTop(<i>String</i> title, <i>Boolean</i> exact)</code><br><br></div>
Returns a HWND to a top-level window whose title matches the specified string.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * exact: Match entire title length, or match substring of title. In both cases, matching is not case sensitive.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_FromPoint"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_FromPoint(int x, int y)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_FromPoint(<i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_FromPoint", <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Window_FromPoint(<i>integer</i> x, <i>integer</i> y)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_FromPoint(<i>Int</i> x, <i>Int</i> y)</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves a HWND to the window that contains the specified point.<br>
<br>
NOTES:<br>
 * On Windows and Linux, screen coordinates are relative to *upper* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points downward.<br>
 * On macOS, screen coordinates are relative to the *bottom* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points upward.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetClassName"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_GetClassName(void* windowHWND, char* classOut, int classOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_GetClassName(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, #class) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_GetClassName", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, #class) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>string </i>class = reaper.JS_Window_GetClassName(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> classOut, <i>Int</i> classOut_sz) = JS_Window_GetClassName(windowHWND, classOut, classOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>
WARNING: May not be fully implemented on macOS and Linux.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetClientRect"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_GetClientRect(void* windowHWND, int* leftOut, int* topOut, int* rightOut, int* bottomOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_GetClientRect(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int &amp;</i>left, <i>int &amp;</i>top, <i>int &amp;</i>right, <i>int &amp;</i>bottom) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_GetClientRect", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int &amp;</i>left, <i>int &amp;</i>top, <i>int &amp;</i>right, <i>int &amp;</i>bottom) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>integer </i>left, <i>integer </i>top, <i>integer </i>right, <i>integer </i>bottom = reaper.JS_Window_GetClientRect(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Int</i> leftOut, <i>Int</i> topOut, <i>Int</i> rightOut, <i>Int</i> bottomOut) = JS_Window_GetClientRect(windowHWND, leftOut, topOut, rightOut, bottomOut)</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves the screen coordinates of the client area rectangle of the specified window.<br>
<br>
NOTES:<br>
 * Unlike the C++ function GetClientRect, this function returns the screen coordinates, not the width and height. To get the client size, use GetClientSize.<br>
 * The pixel at (right, bottom) lies immediately outside the rectangle.<br>
 * On Windows and Linux, screen coordinates are relative to *upper* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points downward.<br>
 * On macOS, screen coordinates are relative to the *bottom* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points upward.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetClientSize"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_GetClientSize(void* windowHWND, int* widthOut, int* heightOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_GetClientSize(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int &amp;</i>width, <i>int &amp;</i>height) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_GetClientSize", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int &amp;</i>width, <i>int &amp;</i>height) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>integer </i>width, <i>integer </i>height = reaper.JS_Window_GetClientSize(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>

<a name="JS_Window_GetFocus"><hr></a><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_GetFocus() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_GetFocus") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_GetFocus()</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves a HWND to the window that has the keyboard focus, if the window is attached to the calling thread's message queue.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetForeground"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_GetForeground()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_GetForeground() <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_GetForeground") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Window_GetForeground()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_GetForeground()</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves a HWND to the top-level foreground window (the window with which the user is currently working).<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetLong"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_GetLong(void* windowHWND, const char* info, double* retvalOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_GetLong(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "info", <i>&amp;</i>retval) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_GetLong", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "info", <i>&amp;</i>retval) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number </i>retval = reaper.JS_Window_GetLong(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> info)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> info, <i>Float</i> retvalOut) = JS_Window_GetLong(windowHWND, info, retvalOut)</code><br><br></div>
Similar to JS_Window_GetLongPtr, but returns the information as a number instead of a pointer. <br>
<br>
In the case of "DLGPROC" and "WNDPROC", the return values can be converted to pointers by JS_Window_HandleFromAddress.<br>
<br>
If the function fails, the return value is 0.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetLongPtr"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_GetLongPtr(void* windowHWND, const char* info)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_GetLongPtr(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "info") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_GetLongPtr", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "info") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Window_GetLongPtr(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> info)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_GetLongPtr(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> info)</code><br><br></div>
Returns information about the specified window.<br>
<br>
info: "USERDATA", "WNDPROC", "DLGPROC", "ID", "EXSTYLE" or "STYLE".<br>
<br>
For documentation about the types of information returned, refer to the Win32 function GetWindowLongPtr.<br>
<br>
The values returned by "DLGPROC" and "WNDPROC" are typically used as-is, as pointers, whereas the others should first be converted to integers.<br>
<br>
If the function fails, a null pointer is returned.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetParent"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_GetParent(void* windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_GetParent(<i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_GetParent", <i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Window_GetParent(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_GetParent(<i>void</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves a HWND to the specified window's parent or owner.<br>
Returns NULL if the window is unowned or if the function otherwise fails.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetRect"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_GetRect(void* windowHWND, int* leftOut, int* topOut, int* rightOut, int* bottomOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_GetRect(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int &amp;</i>left, <i>int &amp;</i>top, <i>int &amp;</i>right, <i>int &amp;</i>bottom) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_GetRect", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int &amp;</i>left, <i>int &amp;</i>top, <i>int &amp;</i>right, <i>int &amp;</i>bottom) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>integer </i>left, <i>integer </i>top, <i>integer </i>right, <i>integer </i>bottom = reaper.JS_Window_GetRect(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Int</i> leftOut, <i>Int</i> topOut, <i>Int</i> rightOut, <i>Int</i> bottomOut) = JS_Window_GetRect(windowHWND, leftOut, topOut, rightOut, bottomOut)</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves the screen coordinates of the bounding rectangle of the specified window.<br>
<br>
NOTES:<br>
 * On Windows and Linux, coordinates are relative to *upper* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points downward.<br>
 * On macOS, coordinates are relative to the *bottom* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points upward.<br>
 * The pixel at (right, bottom) lies immediately outside the rectangle.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetRelated"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_GetRelated(void* windowHWND, const char* relation)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_GetRelated(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "relation") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_GetRelated", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "relation") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Window_GetRelated(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> relation)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_GetRelated(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> relation)</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves a handle to a window that has the specified relationship (Z-Order or owner) to the specified window.<br>
relation: "LAST", "NEXT", "PREV", "OWNER" or "CHILD".<br>
(Refer to documentation for Win32 C++ function GetWindow.)<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetScrollInfo"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_GetScrollInfo(void* windowHWND, const char* scrollbar, int* positionOut, int* pageSizeOut, int* minOut, int* maxOut, int* trackPosOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_GetScrollInfo(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "scrollbar", <i>int &amp;</i>position, <i>int &amp;</i>pageSize, <i>int &amp;</i>min, <i>int &amp;</i>max, <i>int &amp;</i>trackPos) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_GetScrollInfo", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "scrollbar", <i>int &amp;</i>position, <i>int &amp;</i>pageSize, <i>int &amp;</i>min, <i>int &amp;</i>max, <i>int &amp;</i>trackPos) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>integer </i>position, <i>integer </i>pageSize, <i>integer </i>min, <i>integer </i>max, <i>integer </i>trackPos = reaper.JS_Window_GetScrollInfo(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> scrollbar)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> scrollbar, <i>Int</i> positionOut, <i>Int</i> pageSizeOut, <i>Int</i> minOut, <i>Int</i> maxOut, <i>Int</i> trackPosOut) = JS_Window_GetScrollInfo(windowHWND, scrollbar, positionOut, pageSizeOut, minOut, maxOut, trackPosOut)</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves the scroll information of a window.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * windowHWND: The window that contains the scrollbar. This is usually a child window, not a top-level, framed window.<br>
 * scrollbar: "v" (or "SB_VERT", or "VERT") for vertical scroll, "h" (or "SB_HORZ" or "HORZ") for horizontal.<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
 * Leftmost or topmost visible pixel position, as well as the visible page size, the range minimum and maximum, and scroll box tracking position.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_GetTitle"><hr></a><br>
