<a name="JS_Window_GetViewportFromRect"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_GetViewportFromRect(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, bool wantWork, int* leftOut, int* topOut, int* rightOut, int* bottomOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_GetViewportFromRect(<i>int </i>x1, <i>int </i>y1, <i>int </i>x2, <i>int </i>y2, <i>bool </i>wantWork, <i>int &amp;</i>left, <i>int &amp;</i>top, <i>int &amp;</i>right, <i>int &amp;</i>bottom) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_GetViewportFromRect", <i>int </i>x1, <i>int </i>y1, <i>int </i>x2, <i>int </i>y2, <i>bool </i>wantWork, <i>int &amp;</i>left, <i>int &amp;</i>top, <i>int &amp;</i>right, <i>int &amp;</i>bottom) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer </i>left, <i>integer </i>top, <i>integer </i>right, <i>integer </i>bottom = reaper.JS_Window_GetViewportFromRect(<i>integer</i> x1, <i>integer</i> y1, <i>integer</i> x2, <i>integer</i> y2, <i>boolean</i> wantWork)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> x1, <i>Int</i> y1, <i>Int</i> x2, <i>Int</i> y2, <i>Boolean</i> wantWork, <i>Int</i> leftOut, <i>Int</i> topOut, <i>Int</i> rightOut, <i>Int</i> bottomOut) = JS_Window_GetViewportFromRect(x1, y1, x2, y2, wantWork, leftOut, topOut, rightOut, bottomOut)</code><br><br></div>
Retrieves the dimensions of the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the specified rectangle.<br>
<br>
If the monitor is not the primary display, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative.<br>
<br>
wantWork: Returns the work area of the display, which excludes the system taskbar or application desktop toolbars.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_HandleFromAddress"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_HandleFromAddress(double address)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_HandleFromAddress(address) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

Converts an address to a handle (such as a HWND) that can be utilized by REAPER and other API functions.<br><br>

<a name="JS_Window_IsChild"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_IsChild(void* parentHWND, void* childHWND)</code><br><br></div>

Determines whether a window is a child window or descendant window of a specified parent window.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_IsVisible"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_IsVisible(void* windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_IsVisible(<i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_IsVisible", <i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.JS_Window_IsVisible(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  JS_Window_IsVisible(<i>void</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
Determines the visibility state of the window.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_IsWindow"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_IsWindow(void* windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_IsWindow(<i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_IsWindow", <i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.JS_Window_IsWindow(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  JS_Window_IsWindow(<i>void</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
Determines whether the specified window handle identifies an existing window.<br>
<br>
On macOS and Linux, only windows that were created by WDL/swell will be identified (and only such windows should be acted on by scripts).<br>
<br>
NOTE: Since REAPER v5.974, windows can be checked using the native function ValidatePtr(windowHWND, "HWND").<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_ListAllChild"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Window_ListAllChild(void* parentHWND, char* listOutNeedBig, int listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Window_ListAllChild(<i>void*</i> parentHWND, #list) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Window_ListAllChild", <i>void*</i> parentHWND, #list) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>void</i> parentHWND, <i>String</i> listOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> listOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_Window_ListAllChild(parentHWND, listOutNeedBig, listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Finds all child windows of the specified parent.<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
 * retval: The number of windows found; negative if an error occurred.<br>
 * list: A comma-separated string of hexadecimal values.<br>
Each value is an address that can be converted to a HWND by the function Window_HandleFromAddress.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_ListAllTop"><hr></a><br>

<br>
Returns:<br>
 * retval: The number of windows found; negative if an error occurred.<br>
 * list: A comma-separated string of hexadecimal values. Each value is an address that can be converted to a HWND by the function Window_HandleFromAddress.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_ListFind"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Window_ListFind(const char* title, bool exact, char* listOutNeedBig, int listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Window_ListFind("title", <i>bool </i>exact, #list) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Window_ListFind", "title", <i>bool </i>exact, #list) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>string </i>list = reaper.JS_Window_ListFind(<i>string</i> title, <i>boolean</i> exact)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>String</i> title, <i>Boolean</i> exact, <i>String</i> listOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> listOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_Window_ListFind(title, exact, listOutNeedBig, listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Finds all windows (whether top-level or child) whose titles match the specified string.<br>
<br>
Returns:<br>
 * retval: The number of windows found; negative if an error occurred.<br>
 * list: A comma-separated string of hexadecimal values. Each value is an address that can be converted to a HWND by the function Window_HandleFromAddress.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * exact: Match entire title exactly, or match substring of title.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_MonitorFromRect"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_MonitorFromRect(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, bool wantWork, int* leftOut, int* topOut, int* rightOut, int* bottomOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_MonitorFromRect(<i>int </i>x1, <i>int </i>y1, <i>int </i>x2, <i>int </i>y2, <i>bool </i>wantWork, <i>int &amp;</i>left, <i>int &amp;</i>top, <i>int &amp;</i>right, <i>int &amp;</i>bottom) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_MonitorFromRect", <i>int </i>x1, <i>int </i>y1, <i>int </i>x2, <i>int </i>y2, <i>bool </i>wantWork, <i>int &amp;</i>left, <i>int &amp;</i>top, <i>int &amp;</i>right, <i>int &amp;</i>bottom) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer </i>left, <i>integer </i>top, <i>integer </i>right, <i>integer </i>bottom = reaper.JS_Window_MonitorFromRect(<i>integer</i> x1, <i>integer</i> y1, <i>integer</i> x2, <i>integer</i> y2, <i>boolean</i> wantWork)</code><br><br></div>

<a name="JS_Window_Move"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_Move(void* windowHWND, int left, int top)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_Move(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>left, <i>int </i>top) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_Move", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>left, <i>int </i>top) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_Window_Move(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>integer</i> left, <i>integer</i> top)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_Window_Move(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Int</i> left, <i>Int</i> top)</code><br><br></div>
Changes the position of the specified window, keeping its size constant.<br>
<br>
NOTES:<br>
 * For top-level windows, position is relative to the primary display.<br>
 * On Windows and Linux, position is calculated as the coordinates of the upper left corner of the window, relative to upper left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points downward.<br>
 * On macOS, position is calculated as the coordinates of the bottom left corner of the window, relative to bottom left corner of the display, and the positive Y-axis points upward.<br>
 * For a child window, on all platforms, position is relative to the upper-left corner of the parent window's client area.<br>
 * Equivalent to calling JS_Window_SetPosition with NOSIZE, NOZORDER, NOACTIVATE and NOOWNERZORDER flags set.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_OnCommand"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_OnCommand(void* windowHWND, int commandID)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_OnCommand(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>commandID) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_OnCommand", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>commandID) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.JS_Window_OnCommand(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>integer</i> commandID)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  JS_Window_OnCommand(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Int</i> commandID)</code><br><br></div>
Sends a "WM_COMMAND" message to the specified window, which simulates a user selecting a command in the window menu.<br>
<br>
This function is similar to Main_OnCommand and MIDIEditor_OnCommand, but can send commands to any window that has a menu.<br>
<br>
In the case of windows that are listed among the Action list's contexts (such as the Media Explorer), the commandIDs of the actions in the Actions list may be used.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_Resize"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_Resize(void* windowHWND, int width, int height)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_Resize(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>width, <i>int </i>height) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_Resize", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>width, <i>int </i>height) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_Window_Resize(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>integer</i> width, <i>integer</i> height)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_Window_Resize(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Int</i> width, <i>Int</i> height)</code><br><br></div>
Changes the dimensions of the specified window, keeping the top left corner position constant.<br>
 * If resizing script GUIs, call gfx.update() after resizing.<br>
* Equivalent to calling JS_Window_SetPosition with NOMOVE, NOZORDER, NOACTIVATE and NOOWNERZORDER flags set.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_ScreenToClient"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_ScreenToClient(void* windowHWND, int x, int y, int* xOut, int* yOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_ScreenToClient(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, <i>int &amp;</i>x, <i>int &amp;</i>y) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_ScreenToClient", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>x, <i>int </i>y, <i>int &amp;</i>x, <i>int &amp;</i>y) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer </i>x, <i>integer </i>y = reaper.JS_Window_ScreenToClient(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>integer</i> x, <i>integer</i> y)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Int</i> x, <i>Int</i> y, <i>Int</i> xOut, <i>Int</i> yOut) = JS_Window_ScreenToClient(windowHWND, x, y, xOut, yOut)</code><br><br></div>
Converts the screen coordinates of a specified point on the screen to client-area coordinates.<br>
<br>
NOTES:<br>
 * On Windows and Linux, screen coordinates are relative to *upper* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points downward.<br>
 * On macOS, screen coordinates are relative to the *bottom* left corner of the primary display, and the positive Y-axis points upward.<br>
 * On all platforms, client coordinates are relative to the upper left corner of the client area.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_SetFocus"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_SetFocus(void* windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_Window_SetFocus(<i>void</i> windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>

<a name="JS_Window_SetForeground"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_SetForeground(void* windowHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_SetForeground(<i>void*</i> windowHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<a name="JS_Window_SetLong"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_SetLong(void* windowHWND, const char* info, double value, double* retvalOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_SetLong(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "info", value, <i>&amp;</i>retval) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_SetLong", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "info", value, <i>&amp;</i>retval) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number </i>retval = reaper.JS_Window_SetLong(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> info, <i>number</i> value)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> info, <i>Float</i> value, <i>Float</i> retvalOut) = JS_Window_SetLong(windowHWND, info, value, retvalOut)</code><br><br></div>
Similar to the Win32 function SetWindowLongPtr. <br>
<br>
info: "USERDATA", "WNDPROC", "DLGPROC", "ID", "EXSTYLE" or "STYLE", and only on WindowOS, "INSTANCE" and "PARENT".<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_SetOpacity"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_SetOpacity(void* windowHWND, const char* mode, double value)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_SetOpacity(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "mode", value) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_SetOpacity", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "mode", value) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.JS_Window_SetOpacity(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> mode, <i>number</i> value)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  JS_Window_SetOpacity(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> mode, <i>Float</i> value)</code><br><br></div>
Sets the window opacity.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
mode: either "ALPHA" or "COLOR". <br>
value: If ALPHA, the specified value may range from zero to one, and will apply to the entire window, frame included. <br>
If COLOR, value specifies a 0xRRGGBB color, and all pixels of this color will be made transparent. (All mouse clicks over transparent pixels will pass through, too).  WARNING:<br>
COLOR mode is only available in Windows, not Linux or macOS.<br>
<br>
Transparency can only be applied to top-level windows. If windowHWND refers to a child window, the entire top-level window that contains windowHWND will be made transparent.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_SetParent"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Window_SetParent(void* childHWND, void* parentHWNDOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Window_SetParent(<i>void*</i> childHWND, <i>void*</i> parentHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Window_SetParent", <i>void*</i> childHWND, <i>void*</i> parentHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> reaper.JS_Window_SetParent(<i>identifier</i> childHWND, <i>identifier</i> parentHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>void</i>  JS_Window_SetParent(<i>void</i> childHWND, <i>void</i> parentHWNDOptional)</code><br><br></div>
If successful, returns a handle to the previous parent window.<br>
<br>
Only on WindowsOS: If parentHWND is not specified, the desktop window becomes the new parent window.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_SetPosition"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_SetPosition(void* windowHWND, int left, int top, int width, int height, char* ZOrderOptional, char* flagsOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_SetPosition(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>left, <i>int </i>top, <i>int </i>width, <i>int </i>height, <i>optional </i>#ZOrder, <i>optional </i>#flags) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_SetPosition", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, <i>int </i>left, <i>int </i>top, <i>int </i>width, <i>int </i>height, <i>optional </i>#ZOrder, <i>optional </i>#flags) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>optional </i><i>string </i>ZOrder, <i>optional </i><i>string </i>flags = reaper.JS_Window_SetPosition(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>integer</i> left, <i>integer</i> top, <i>integer</i> width, <i>integer</i> height, <i>optional </i><i>string </i>ZOrder, <i>optional </i><i>string </i>flags)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>Int</i> left, <i>Int</i> top, <i>Int</i> width, <i>Int</i> height, <i>String</i> ZOrderOptional, <i>String</i> flagsOptional) = JS_Window_SetPosition(windowHWND, left, top, width, height, ZOrderOptional, flagsOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Interface to the Win32/swell function SetWindowPos, with which window position, size, Z-order and visibility can be set, and new frame styles can be applied.<br>
<br>
ZOrder and flags are optional parameters. If no arguments are supplied, the window will simply be moved and resized, as if the NOACTIVATE, NOZORDER, NOOWNERZORDER flags were set.<br>
 * ZOrder: "BOTTOM", "TOPMOST", "NOTOPMOST", "TOP" or a window HWND converted to a string, for example by the Lua function tostring.<br>
 * flags: Any combination of the standard flags, of which "NOMOVE", "NOSIZE", "NOZORDER", "NOACTIVATE", "SHOWWINDOW", "FRAMECHANGED" and "NOCOPYBITS" should be valid cross-platform.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_SetScrollPos"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_SetScrollPos(void* windowHWND, const char* scrollbar, int position)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_SetScrollPos(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "scrollbar", <i>int </i>position) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_SetScrollPos", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "scrollbar", <i>int </i>position) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.JS_Window_SetScrollPos(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> scrollbar, <i>integer</i> position)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  JS_Window_SetScrollPos(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> scrollbar, <i>Int</i> position)</code><br><br></div>
Parameters:<br>
 * scrollbar: "v" (or "SB_VERT", or "VERT") for vertical scroll, "h" (or "SB_HORZ" or "HORZ") for horizontal.<br>
<br>
NOTE: API functions can scroll REAPER's windows, but cannot zoom them.  Instead, use actions such as "View: Zoom to one loop iteration".<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_SetStyle"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_SetStyle(void* windowHWND, char* style)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_SetStyle(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, #style) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_SetStyle", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, #style) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>string </i>style = reaper.JS_Window_SetStyle(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string </i>style)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> style) = JS_Window_SetStyle(windowHWND, style)</code><br><br></div>
Sets and applies a window style.<br>
<br>
style may include any combination of standard window styles, such as "POPUP" for a frameless window, or "CAPTION,SIZEBOX,SYSMENU" for a standard framed window.<br>
<br>
On Linux and macOS, "MAXIMIZE" has not yet been implmented, and the remaining styles may appear slightly different from their WindowsOS counterparts.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_SetTitle"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_SetTitle(void* windowHWND, const char* title)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_SetTitle(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "title") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_SetTitle", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "title") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.JS_Window_SetTitle(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> title)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  JS_Window_SetTitle(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> title)</code><br><br></div>
Changes the title of the specified window. Returns true if successful.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_SetZOrder"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool JS_Window_SetZOrder(void* windowHWND, const char* ZOrder, void* insertAfterHWNDOptional)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> JS_Window_SetZOrder(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "ZOrder", <i>void*</i> insertAfterHWND) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("JS_Window_SetZOrder", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "ZOrder", <i>void*</i> insertAfterHWND) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.JS_Window_SetZOrder(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> ZOrder, <i>identifier</i> insertAfterHWND)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  JS_Window_SetZOrder(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> ZOrder, <i>void</i> insertAfterHWNDOptional)</code><br><br></div>
Sets the window Z order.<br>
 * Equivalent to calling JS_Window_SetPos with flags NOMOVE | NOSIZE.<br>
 * Not all the Z orders have been implemented in Linux yet.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * ZOrder: "BOTTOM", "TOPMOST", "NOTOPMOST", "TOP", or a window HWND converted to a string, for example by the Lua function tostring.<br>
<br>
* InsertAfterHWND: For compatibility with older versions, this parameter is still available, and is optional. If ZOrder is "INSERTAFTER", insertAfterHWND must be a handle to the window behind which windowHWND will be placed in the Z order, equivalent to setting ZOrder to this HWND; otherwise, insertAfterHWND is ignored and can be left out (or it can simply be set to the same value as windowHWND).<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_Show"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Window_Show(void* windowHWND, const char* state)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>JS_Window_Show(<i>void*</i> windowHWND, "state") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("JS_Window_Show", <i>void*</i> windowHWND, "state") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.JS_Window_Show(<i>identifier</i> windowHWND, <i>string</i> state)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>JS_Window_Show(<i>void</i> windowHWND, <i>String</i> state)</code><br><br></div>
Sets the specified window's show state.<br>
<br>
Parameters:<br>
 * state: One of the following options: "SHOW", "SHOWNA" (or "SHOWNOACTIVATE"), "SHOWMINIMIZED", "HIDE", "NORMAL", "SHOWNORMAL", "SHOWMAXIMIZED", "SHOWDEFAULT" or "RESTORE". On Linux and macOS, only the first four options are fully implemented.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Window_Update"><hr></a><br>

<a name="JS_Zip_Entry_Close"><hr></a><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Zip_Entry_Close(<i>void*</i> zipHandle) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

Closes a zip entry, flushes buffer and releases resources. In WRITE mode, entries must be closed in order to apply and save changes.<br>
<br>
Returns 0 on success, negative number (&lt; 0) on error.<br><br>

<a name="JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByIndex"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByIndex(void* zipHandle, int index)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByIndex(<i>void*</i> zipHandle, <i>int </i>index) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByIndex", <i>void*</i> zipHandle, <i>int </i>index) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByIndex(<i>identifier</i> zipHandle, <i>integer</i> index)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByIndex(<i>void</i> zipHandle, <i>Int</i> index)</code><br><br></div>
Opens a new entry by index in the zip archive.<br>
<br>
This function is only valid if zip archive was opened in 'r' (readonly) mode.<br>
<br>
Returns 0 on success, negative number on error.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByName"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByName(void* zipHandle, const char* entryName)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByName(<i>void*</i> zipHandle, "entryName") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByName", <i>void*</i> zipHandle, "entryName") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByName(<i>identifier</i> zipHandle, <i>string</i> entryName)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_Zip_Entry_OpenByName(<i>void</i> zipHandle, <i>String</i> entryName)</code><br><br></div>
Opens an entry by name in the zip archive.<br>
<br>
For zip archive opened in 'w' or 'a' mode the function will append a new entry. In readonly mode the function tries to locate an existing entry.<br>
<br>
Returns 0 on success, negative number (&lt; 0) on error.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Zip_ErrorString"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void JS_Zip_ErrorString(int errorNum, char* errorStrOut, int errorStrOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>

<a name="JS_Zip_Extract"><hr></a><br>

<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> reaper.JS_Zip_Extract(<i>string</i> zipFile, <i>string</i> outputFolder)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Int</i>  JS_Zip_Extract(<i>String</i> zipFile, <i>String</i> outputFolder)</code><br><br></div>
Extracts an existing Zip file to the specified folder.<br>
<br>
Returns the number of extracted files on success, negative number (&lt; 0) on error.<br><br>
<a name="JS_Zip_ListAllEntries"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>int JS_Zip_ListAllEntries(void* zipHandle, char* listOutNeedBig, int listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> JS_Zip_ListAllEntries(<i>void*</i> zipHandle, #list) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> extension_api("JS_Zip_ListAllEntries", <i>void*</i> zipHandle, #list) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>integer</i> retval, <i>string </i>list = reaper.JS_Zip_ListAllEntries(<i>identifier</i> zipHandle)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Int</i> retval, <i>void</i> zipHandle, <i>String</i> listOutNeedBig, <i>Int</i> listOutNeedBig_sz) = JS_Zip_ListAllEntries(zipHandle, listOutNeedBig, listOutNeedBig_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Returns the number of entries and a zero-separated and double-zero-terminated string of entry names.<br>
<br>
On error, returns a negative number (&lt; 0).<br><br>
<a name="JS_Zip_Open"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void* JS_Zip_Open(const char* zipFile, const char* mode, int compressionLevel, int* retvalOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  JS_Zip_Open("zipFile", "mode", <i>int </i>compressionLevel, <i>int &amp;</i>retval) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>void*</i>  extension_api("JS_Zip_Open", "zipFile", "mode", <i>int </i>compressionLevel, <i>int &amp;</i>retval) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>identifier</i> retval, <i>integer </i>retval = reaper.JS_Zip_Open(<i>string</i> zipFile, <i>string</i> mode, <i>integer</i> compressionLevel)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>void</i> retval, <i>String</i> zipFile, <i>String</i> mode, <i>Int</i> compressionLevel, <i>Int</i> retvalOut) = JS_Zip_Open(zipFile, mode, compressionLevel, retvalOut)</code><br><br></div>
Opens a zip archive using the given mode, which can be either "READ" or "WRITE" (or simply 'r' or 'w').<br>
<br>
 * READ: Opens an existing archive for reading/extracting.<br>
 * WRITE: Opens an archive for writing/deleting. If the file doesn't exist, an empty archive will created.<br>
<br>
compressionLevel is only relevant for WRITE mode, and ranges from 0 (fastest, no compression) to 9 (slowest, best compression), with a default of 6.<br>
<br>
If successful, returns 0 and a handle to the Zip archive. If failed, returns a negative error code. If the file is already open -- in the given mode -- the existing handle will be returned.<br>
<br>
NOTES:<br>
 * The Zip API functions support Unicode file names and entry names.<br>
 * The original zip specification did not support Unicode. Some applications still use this outdated specification by default, or try to use the local code page. This may lead to incompatibility and incorrect retrieval of file or entry names.<br><br>
<a name="NF_AnalyzeMediaItemPeakAndRMS"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool NF_AnalyzeMediaItemPeakAndRMS(MediaItem* item, double windowSize, void* reaper.array_peaks, void* reaper.array_peakpositions, void* reaper.array_RMSs, void* reaper.array_RMSpositions)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> NF_AnalyzeMediaItemPeakAndRMS(<i>MediaItem</i> item, windowSize, <i>void*</i> reaper.array_peaks, <i>void*</i> reaper.array_peakpositions, <i>void*</i> reaper.array_RMSs, <i>void*</i> reaper.array_RMSpositions) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("NF_AnalyzeMediaItemPeakAndRMS", <i>MediaItem</i> item, windowSize, <i>void*</i> reaper.array_peaks, <i>void*</i> reaper.array_peakpositions, <i>void*</i> reaper.array_RMSs, <i>void*</i> reaper.array_RMSpositions) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.NF_AnalyzeMediaItemPeakAndRMS(<i>MediaItem</i> item, <i>number</i> windowSize, <i>identifier</i> reaper.array_peaks, <i>identifier</i> reaper.array_peakpositions, <i>identifier</i> reaper.array_RMSs, <i>identifier</i> reaper.array_RMSpositions)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  NF_AnalyzeMediaItemPeakAndRMS(<i>MediaItem</i> item, <i>Float</i> windowSize, <i>void</i> reaper.array_peaks, <i>void</i> reaper.array_peakpositions, <i>void</i> reaper.array_RMSs, <i>void</i> reaper.array_RMSpositions)</code><br><br></div>
This function combines all other NF_Peak/RMS functions in a single one and additionally returns peak RMS positions. Lua example code <a href="https://forum.cockos.com/showpost.php?p=2050961&postcount=6">here</a>. Note: It's recommended to use this function with ReaScript/Lua as it provides reaper.array objects. If using this function with other scripting languages, you must provide arrays in the <a href="https://forum.cockos.com/showpost.php?p=2039829&postcount=2">reaper.array</a> format.<br><br>
<a name="NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness(MediaItem_Take* take, bool analyzeTruePeak, double* lufsIntegratedOut, double* rangeOut, double*  truePeakOut, double* truePeakPosOut, double* shortTermMaxOut, double* momentaryMaxOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>bool </i>analyzeTruePeak, <i>&amp;</i>lufsIntegrated, <i>&amp;</i>range, <i>&amp;</i> truePeak, <i>&amp;</i>truePeakPos, <i>&amp;</i>shortTermMax, <i>&amp;</i>momentaryMax) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness", <i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>bool </i>analyzeTruePeak, <i>&amp;</i>lufsIntegrated, <i>&amp;</i>range, <i>&amp;</i> truePeak, <i>&amp;</i>truePeakPos, <i>&amp;</i>shortTermMax, <i>&amp;</i>momentaryMax) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>number </i>lufsIntegrated, <i>number </i>range, <i>number </i> truePeak, <i>number </i>truePeakPos, <i>number </i>shortTermMax, <i>number </i>momentaryMax = reaper.NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>boolean</i> analyzeTruePeak)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>Boolean</i> analyzeTruePeak, <i>Float</i> lufsIntegratedOut, <i>Float</i> rangeOut, <i>Float</i>  truePeakOut, <i>Float</i> truePeakPosOut, <i>Float</i> shortTermMaxOut, <i>Float</i> momentaryMaxOut) = NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness(take, analyzeTruePeak, lufsIntegratedOut, rangeOut,  truePeakOut, truePeakPosOut, shortTermMaxOut, momentaryMaxOut)</code><br><br></div>
Full loudness analysis. retval: returns true on successful analysis, false on MIDI take or when analysis failed for some reason. analyzeTruePeak=true: Also do true peak analysis. Returns true peak value in dBTP and true peak position (relative to item position). Considerably slower than without true peak analysis (since it uses oversampling). Note: Short term uses a time window of 3 sec. for calculation. So for items shorter than this shortTermMaxOut can't be calculated correctly. Momentary uses a time window of 0.4 sec. <br><br>
<a name="NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness2"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness2(MediaItem_Take* take, bool analyzeTruePeak, double* lufsIntegratedOut, double* rangeOut, double*  truePeakOut, double* truePeakPosOut, double* shortTermMaxOut, double* momentaryMaxOut, double* shortTermMaxPosOut, double* momentaryMaxPosOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness2(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>bool </i>analyzeTruePeak, <i>&amp;</i>lufsIntegrated, <i>&amp;</i>range, <i>&amp;</i> truePeak, <i>&amp;</i>truePeakPos, <i>&amp;</i>shortTermMax, <i>&amp;</i>momentaryMax, <i>&amp;</i>shortTermMaxPos, <i>&amp;</i>momentaryMaxPos) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness2", <i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>bool </i>analyzeTruePeak, <i>&amp;</i>lufsIntegrated, <i>&amp;</i>range, <i>&amp;</i> truePeak, <i>&amp;</i>truePeakPos, <i>&amp;</i>shortTermMax, <i>&amp;</i>momentaryMax, <i>&amp;</i>shortTermMaxPos, <i>&amp;</i>momentaryMaxPos) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>number </i>lufsIntegrated, <i>number </i>range, <i>number </i> truePeak, <i>number </i>truePeakPos, <i>number </i>shortTermMax, <i>number </i>momentaryMax, <i>number </i>shortTermMaxPos, <i>number </i>momentaryMaxPos = reaper.NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness2(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>boolean</i> analyzeTruePeak)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>Boolean</i> analyzeTruePeak, <i>Float</i> lufsIntegratedOut, <i>Float</i> rangeOut, <i>Float</i>  truePeakOut, <i>Float</i> truePeakPosOut, <i>Float</i> shortTermMaxOut, <i>Float</i> momentaryMaxOut, <i>Float</i> shortTermMaxPosOut, <i>Float</i> momentaryMaxPosOut) = NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness2(take, analyzeTruePeak, lufsIntegratedOut, rangeOut,  truePeakOut, truePeakPosOut, shortTermMaxOut, momentaryMaxOut, shortTermMaxPosOut, momentaryMaxPosOut)</code><br><br></div>
Same as <a href="#NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness">NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness</a> but additionally returns shortTermMaxPos and momentaryMaxPos (in absolute project time). Note: shortTermMaxPos and momentaryMaxPos indicate the beginning of time <i>intervalls</i>, (3 sec. and 0.4 sec. resp.). <br><br>
<a name="NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness_IntegratedOnly"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness_IntegratedOnly(MediaItem_Take* take, double* lufsIntegratedOut)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness_IntegratedOnly(<i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>&amp;</i>lufsIntegrated) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>MediaItem_Take</i> take, <i>Float</i> lufsIntegratedOut) = NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness_IntegratedOnly(take, lufsIntegratedOut)</code><br><br></div>
Does LUFS integrated analysis only. Faster than full loudness analysis (<a href="#NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness">NF_AnalyzeTakeLoudness</a>) . Use this if only LUFS integrated is required. Take vol. env. is taken into account. See: <a href="http://wiki.cockos.com/wiki/index.php/Measure_and_normalize_loudness_with_SWS">Signal flow</a><br><br>

<a name="NF_GetGlobalStartupAction"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool NF_GetGlobalStartupAction(char* descOut, int descOut_sz, char* cmdIdOut, int cmdIdOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>

<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>string </i>desc, <i>string </i>cmdId = reaper.NF_GetGlobalStartupAction()</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>String</i> descOut, <i>Int</i> descOut_sz, <i>String</i> cmdIdOut, <i>Int</i> cmdIdOut_sz) = NF_GetGlobalStartupAction(descOut, descOut_sz, cmdIdOut, cmdIdOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Gets action description and command ID number (for native actions) or named command IDs / identifier strings (for extension actions /ReaScripts) if global startup action is set, otherwise empty string. Returns false on failure.<br><br>
<a name="NF_GetMediaItemAverageRMS"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>double NF_GetMediaItemAverageRMS(MediaItem* item)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>double </i> NF_GetMediaItemAverageRMS(<i>MediaItem</i> item) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>double </i> extension_api("NF_GetMediaItemAverageRMS", <i>MediaItem</i> item) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>number</i> reaper.NF_GetMediaItemAverageRMS(<i>MediaItem</i> item)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Float</i>  NF_GetMediaItemAverageRMS(<i>MediaItem</i> item)</code><br><br></div>
Returns the average overall (non-windowed) dB RMS level of active channels of an audio item active take, post item gain, post take volume envelope, post-fade, pre fader, pre item FX. <br>
 Returns -150.0 if MIDI take or empty item.<br><br>

 Returns -150.0 if MIDI take or empty item.<br><br>

<a name="NF_GetMediaItemPeakRMS_Windowed"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>double NF_GetMediaItemPeakRMS_Windowed(MediaItem* item)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>double </i> NF_GetMediaItemPeakRMS_Windowed(<i>MediaItem</i> item) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>double </i> extension_api("NF_GetMediaItemPeakRMS_Windowed", <i>MediaItem</i> item) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Float</i>  NF_GetMediaItemPeakRMS_Windowed(<i>MediaItem</i> item)</code><br><br></div>
Returns the average dB RMS peak level of all active channels of an audio item active take, post item gain, post take volume envelope, post-fade, pre fader, pre item FX. <br>
 Obeys 'Window size for peak RMS' setting in 'SWS: Set RMS analysis/normalize options' for calculation. Returns -150.0 if MIDI take or empty item.<br><br>
<a name="NF_GetProjectStartupAction"><hr></a><br>

Gets action description and command ID number (for native actions) or named command IDs / identifier strings (for extension actions /ReaScripts) if project startup action is set, otherwise empty string. Returns false on failure.<br><br>

<a name="NF_SetGlobalStartupAction"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool NF_SetGlobalStartupAction(const char* str)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> NF_SetGlobalStartupAction("str") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("NF_SetGlobalStartupAction", "str") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.NF_SetGlobalStartupAction(<i>string</i> str)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  NF_SetGlobalStartupAction(<i>String</i> str)</code><br><br></div>
Returns true if global startup action was set successfully (i.e. valid action ID). Note: For SWS / S&amp;M actions and macros / scripts, you must use identifier strings (e.g. "_SWS_ABOUT", "_f506bc780a0ab34b8fdedb67ed5d3649"), not command IDs (e.g. "47145").<br>
Tip: to copy such identifiers, right-click the action in the Actions window &gt; Copy selected action cmdID / identifier string.<br>
NOnly works for actions / scripts from Main action section.<br><br>
<a name="NF_SetProjectStartupAction"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool NF_SetProjectStartupAction(const char* str)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> NF_SetProjectStartupAction("str") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("NF_SetProjectStartupAction", "str") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.NF_SetProjectStartupAction(<i>string</i> str)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  NF_SetProjectStartupAction(<i>String</i> str)</code><br><br></div>
Returns true if project startup action was set successfully (i.e. valid action ID). Note: For SWS / S&amp;M actions and macros / scripts, you must use identifier strings (e.g. "_SWS_ABOUT", "_f506bc780a0ab34b8fdedb67ed5d3649"), not command IDs (e.g. "47145").<br>
Tip: to copy such identifiers, right-click the action in the Actions window &gt; Copy selected action cmdID / identifier string.<br>
Only works for actions / scripts from Main action section. Project must be saved after setting project startup action to be persistent.<br><br>
<a name="NF_SetProjectTrackSelectionAction"><hr></a><br>

Returns true if project track selection action was set successfully (i.e. valid action ID). Note: For SWS / S&amp;M actions and macros / scripts, you must use identifier strings (e.g. "_SWS_ABOUT", "_f506bc780a0ab34b8fdedb67ed5d3649"), not command IDs (e.g. "47145").<br>
Tip: to copy such identifiers, right-click the action in the Actions window &gt; Copy selected action cmdID / identifier string.<br>
Only works for actions / scripts from Main action section. Project must be saved after setting project track selection action to be persistent.<br><br>

<a name="NF_SetSWS_RMSoptions"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool NF_SetSWS_RMSoptions(double targetLevel, double windowSize)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> NF_SetSWS_RMSoptions(targetLevel, windowSize) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("NF_SetSWS_RMSoptions", targetLevel, windowSize) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.NF_SetSWS_RMSoptions(<i>number</i> targetLevel, <i>number</i> windowSize)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  NF_SetSWS_RMSoptions(<i>Float</i> targetLevel, <i>Float</i> windowSize)</code><br><br></div>
Set SWS analysis/normalize options (same as running action 'SWS: Set RMS analysis/normalize options'). targetLevel: target RMS normalize level (dB), windowSize: window size for peak RMS (sec.)<br><br>
<a name="NF_TakeFX_GetFXModuleName"><hr></a><br>

<a name="NF_Win32_GetSystemMetrics"><hr></a><br>

<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>int </i> NF_Win32_GetSystemMetrics(<i>int </i>nIndex) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

Equivalent to win32 API GetSystemMetrics(). Note: Only SM_C[XY]SCREEN, SM_C[XY][HV]SCROLL and SM_CYMENU are currently supported on macOS and Linux as of REAPER 6.68. Check the <a href="https://github.com/justinfrankel/WDL/blob/main/WDL/swell">SWELL source code</a> for up-to-date support information (swell-wnd.mm, swell-wnd-generic.cpp).<br><br>
<a name="ReaPack_AboutInstalledPackage"><hr></a><br>

<a name="ReaPack_AboutRepository"><hr></a><br>

Show the about dialog of the given repository. Returns true if the repository exists in the user configuration.<br>
The repository index is downloaded asynchronously if the cached copy doesn't exist or is older than one week.<br><br>
<a name="ReaPack_AddSetRepository"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool ReaPack_AddSetRepository(const char* name, const char* url, bool enable, int autoInstall, char* errorOut, int errorOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> ReaPack_AddSetRepository("name", "url", <i>bool </i>enable, <i>int </i>autoInstall, #error) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("ReaPack_AddSetRepository", "name", "url", <i>bool </i>enable, <i>int </i>autoInstall, #error) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> retval, <i>string </i>error = reaper.ReaPack_AddSetRepository(<i>string</i> name, <i>string</i> url, <i>boolean</i> enable, <i>integer</i> autoInstall)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>String</i> name, <i>String</i> url, <i>Boolean</i> enable, <i>Int</i> autoInstall, <i>String</i> errorOut, <i>Int</i> errorOut_sz) = ReaPack_AddSetRepository(name, url, enable, autoInstall, errorOut, errorOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>
Add or modify a repository. Set url to nullptr (or empty string in Lua) to keep the existing URL. Call <a href="#ReaPack_ProcessQueue">ReaPack_ProcessQueue(true)</a> when done to process the new list and update the GUI.<br>
<br>
autoInstall: usually set to 2 (obey user setting).<br><br>

<a name="ReaPack_EnumOwnedFiles"><hr></a><br>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>PackageEntry</i> entry, <i>Int</i> index, <i>String</i> pathOut, <i>Int</i> pathOut_sz, <i>Int</i> sectionsOut, <i>Int</i> typeOut) = ReaPack_EnumOwnedFiles(entry, index, pathOut, pathOut_sz, sectionsOut, typeOut)</code><br><br></div>
Enumerate the files owned by the given package. Returns false when there is no more data.<br>
<br>
sections: 0=not in action list, &amp;1=main, &amp;2=midi editor, &amp;4=midi inline editor<br>
type: see <a href="#ReaPack_GetEntryInfo">ReaPack_GetEntryInfo</a>.<br><br>

<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>(<i>Boolean</i> retval, <i>PackageEntry</i> entry, <i>String</i> repoOut, <i>Int</i> repoOut_sz, <i>String</i> catOut, <i>Int</i> catOut_sz, <i>String</i> pkgOut, <i>Int</i> pkgOut_sz, <i>String</i> descOut, <i>Int</i> descOut_sz, <i>Int</i> typeOut, <i>String</i> verOut, <i>Int</i> verOut_sz, <i>String</i> authorOut, <i>Int</i> authorOut_sz, <i>Int</i> flagsOut, <i>Int</i> fileCountOut) = ReaPack_GetEntryInfo(entry, repoOut, repoOut_sz, catOut, catOut_sz, pkgOut, pkgOut_sz, descOut, descOut_sz, typeOut, verOut, verOut_sz, authorOut, authorOut_sz, flagsOut, fileCountOut)</code><br><br></div>
Get the repository name, category, package name, package description, package type, the currently installed version, author name, flags (&amp;1=Pinned, &amp;2=BleedingEdge) and how many files are owned by the given package entry.<br>
<br>
type: 1=script, 2=extension, 3=effect, 4=data, 5=theme, 6=langpack, 7=webinterface<br><br>

<a name="ReaPack_ProcessQueue"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>void ReaPack_ProcessQueue(bool refreshUI)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>ReaPack_ProcessQueue(<i>bool </i>refreshUI) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code>extension_api("ReaPack_ProcessQueue", <i>bool </i>refreshUI) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code>reaper.ReaPack_ProcessQueue(<i>boolean</i> refreshUI)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code>ReaPack_ProcessQueue(<i>Boolean</i> refreshUI)</code><br><br></div>
Run pending operations and save the configuration file. If refreshUI is true the browser and manager windows are guaranteed to be refreshed (otherwise it depends on which operations are in the queue).<br><br>
<a name="SNM_AddReceive"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool SNM_AddReceive(MediaTrack* src, MediaTrack* dest, int type)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> SNM_AddReceive(<i>MediaTrack</i> src, <i>MediaTrack</i> dest, <i>int </i>type) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("SNM_AddReceive", <i>MediaTrack</i> src, <i>MediaTrack</i> dest, <i>int </i>type) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.SNM_AddReceive(<i>MediaTrack</i> src, <i>MediaTrack</i> dest, <i>integer</i> type)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  SNM_AddReceive(<i>MediaTrack</i> src, <i>MediaTrack</i> dest, <i>Int</i> type)</code><br><br></div>
[S&amp;M] Deprecated, see <a href="#CreateTrackSend">CreateTrackSend</a> (v5.15pre1+). Adds a receive. Returns false if nothing updated.<br>
type -1=Default type (user preferences), 0=Post-Fader (Post-Pan), 1=Pre-FX, 2=deprecated, 3=Pre-Fader (Post-FX).<br>
Note: obeys default sends preferences, supports frozen tracks, etc..<br><br>
<a name="SNM_AddTCPFXParm"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool SNM_AddTCPFXParm(MediaTrack* tr, int fxId, int prmId)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> SNM_AddTCPFXParm(<i>MediaTrack</i> tr, <i>int </i>fxId, <i>int </i>prmId) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>

<a name="SNM_GetSetObjectState"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool SNM_GetSetObjectState(void* obj, WDL_FastString* state, bool setnewvalue, bool wantminimalstate)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> SNM_GetSetObjectState(<i>void*</i> obj, <i>WDL_FastString</i> state, <i>bool </i>setnewvalue, <i>bool </i>wantminimalstate) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("SNM_GetSetObjectState", <i>void*</i> obj, <i>WDL_FastString</i> state, <i>bool </i>setnewvalue, <i>bool </i>wantminimalstate) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.SNM_GetSetObjectState(<i>identifier</i> obj, <i>WDL_FastString</i> state, <i>boolean</i> setnewvalue, <i>boolean</i> wantminimalstate)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  SNM_GetSetObjectState(<i>void</i> obj, <i>WDL_FastString</i> state, <i>Boolean</i> setnewvalue, <i>Boolean</i> wantminimalstate)</code><br><br></div>
[S&amp;M] Gets or sets the state of a track, an item or an envelope. The state chunk size is unlimited. Returns false if failed.<br>
When getting a track state (and when you are not interested in FX data), you can use wantminimalstate=true to radically reduce the length of the state. Do not set such minimal states back though, this is for read-only applications!<br>
Note: unlike the native GetSetObjectState, calling to FreeHeapPtr() is not required.<br><br>
<a name="SNM_GetSetSourceState"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool SNM_GetSetSourceState(MediaItem* item, int takeidx, WDL_FastString* state, bool setnewvalue)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> SNM_GetSetSourceState(<i>MediaItem</i> item, <i>int </i>takeidx, <i>WDL_FastString</i> state, <i>bool </i>setnewvalue) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("SNM_GetSetSourceState", <i>MediaItem</i> item, <i>int </i>takeidx, <i>WDL_FastString</i> state, <i>bool </i>setnewvalue) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.SNM_GetSetSourceState(<i>MediaItem</i> item, <i>integer</i> takeidx, <i>WDL_FastString</i> state, <i>boolean</i> setnewvalue)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  SNM_GetSetSourceState(<i>MediaItem</i> item, <i>Int</i> takeidx, <i>WDL_FastString</i> state, <i>Boolean</i> setnewvalue)</code><br><br></div>
[S&amp;M] Gets or sets a take source state. Returns false if failed. Use takeidx=-1 to get/alter the active take.<br>
Note: this function does not use a MediaItem_Take* param in order to manage empty takes (i.e. takes with MediaItem_Take*==NULL), see <a href="#SNM_GetSetSourceState2">SNM_GetSetSourceState2</a>.<br><br>

<a name="SNM_MoveOrRemoveTrackFX"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool SNM_MoveOrRemoveTrackFX(MediaTrack* tr, int fxId, int what)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> SNM_MoveOrRemoveTrackFX(<i>MediaTrack</i> tr, <i>int </i>fxId, <i>int </i>what) <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("SNM_MoveOrRemoveTrackFX", <i>MediaTrack</i> tr, <i>int </i>fxId, <i>int </i>what) <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.SNM_MoveOrRemoveTrackFX(<i>MediaTrack</i> tr, <i>integer</i> fxId, <i>integer</i> what)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  SNM_MoveOrRemoveTrackFX(<i>MediaTrack</i> tr, <i>Int</i> fxId, <i>Int</i> what)</code><br><br></div>
[S&amp;M] Deprecated, see TrackFX_{CopyToTrack,Delete} (v5.95+). Move or removes a track FX. Returns true if tr has been updated.<br>
fxId: fx index in chain or -1 for the selected fx. what: 0 to remove, -1 to move fx up in chain, 1 to move fx down in chain.<br><br>
<a name="SNM_ReadMediaFileTag"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool SNM_ReadMediaFileTag(const char* fn, const char* tag, char* tagvalOut, int tagvalOut_sz)</code><br><br></div>

<a name="SNM_TagMediaFile"><hr></a><br>
<div class="c_func"><span class='all_view'>C: </span><code>bool SNM_TagMediaFile(const char* fn, const char* tag, const char* tagval)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="e_func"><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> SNM_TagMediaFile("fn", "tag", "tagval") <i><font size=-1>(requires REAPER 6.24 or later)</font></i></code>
<br><span class='all_view'>EEL2: </span><code><i>bool </i> extension_api("SNM_TagMediaFile", "fn", "tag", "tagval") <i><font size=-1>(legacy syntax, also useful for allowing script to run when third-party extension is not installed)</font></i></code><br><br></div>
<div class="l_func"><span class='all_view'>Lua: </span><code><i>boolean</i> reaper.SNM_TagMediaFile(<i>string</i> fn, <i>string</i> tag, <i>string</i> tagval)</code><br><br></div>
<div class="p_func"><span class='all_view'>Python: </span><code><i>Boolean</i>  SNM_TagMediaFile(<i>String</i> fn, <i>String</i> tag, <i>String</i> tagval)</code><br><br></div>
[S&amp;M] Tags a media file thanks to <a href="https://taglib.github.io">TagLib</a>. Supported tags: "artist", "album", "genre", "comment", "title", "track" (track number) or "year". Use an empty tagval to clear a tag. When a file is opened in REAPER, turn it offline before using this function. Returns false if nothing updated. See <a href="#SNM_ReadMediaFileTag">SNM_ReadMediaFileTag</a>.<br><br>
